Greater Peoria Festivals

By Discover Peoria on

					Mar. 31, 2023
				






Greater Peoria fairs and festivals offer affordable, family-friendly fun year round. Discover the newest art, crafts, music, and film. Enjoy live rock, folk, country, bluegrass, and jazz music. Shop for one-of-a-kind Illinois-made products. Taste a variety of local fare like pumpkin pancakes, cheesecake, strawberry pie, fresh hot pretzels, tenderloin sandwiches, barbecue, craft beers, and wine. Classic cars, the Illinois River, and seasonal agriculture are some of Greater Peoria’s favorite festival themes. Take a fun peek into world cultures at German, Celtic, Latino, India, Polish, Lebanese, and Global celebrations. 
To find information on these events and more, visit our Events Calendar.

 
SPRING
Shorty's Strictly Bluegrass Festival   {East Peoria}   //    March   //     Get ready to immerse yourself in the vibrant Bluegrass music scene at Stoney Creek Inn in East Peoria IL, where passionate fans, talented artists, and enthusiastic bands from across the Midwest come together to jam and perform live in the ballroom. 
 
Spring Craft + Vendor Show   {Peoria}   //    April   //     Discover unique and beautiful handmade crafts and products at the upcoming Spring Craft and Vendor Show in Peoria. From one-of-a-kind artisanal items to a wide selection of quality goods, you're sure to find something that catches your eye while supporting local vendors.
 
Music Wine + Craft Beer Festival   {Mackinaw}   //    May   //     Enjoy live music from a diverse lineup of talented artists while sipping on local wine and craft beer. Food trucks and vendors will also be on-site, so come hungry and ready to celebrate summer!
 
Peoria Heights Fine Art Fair   {Peoria Heights}   //    May   //    Promoting the development, establishment, and expansion of the Arts in Peoria Heights, the Peoria Heights Fine Art Fair is a juried art show featuring ceramics, digital art, drawing, fiber/textiles, glass, jewelry, metal, mixed media, painting, photography, sculpture and more.
 
Summer Camp   {Chillicothe}   //    May   //     Join tens of thousands of music lovers at Three Sisters Park in Chillicothe for a legendary music festival that features top acts like Moe. and Umphrey's McGee. With a diverse lineup and unpredictable weather, make sure to pack accordingly.



 
SUMMER
Farmers Market   {GPA}   //    May-September   //    Visit Peoria's Riverfront for an outdoor farmers' market showcasing local produce, meats, eggs, cheeses, fresh flowers, baked goods, and more. Enjoy live music, art, and demonstrations each week. Don't miss out on this pet-friendly market and make sure to bring your reusable bags! Keep an eye on our Peoria Area Farmers Market Blog for all your locally sourced re-stocking needs.
 
Parks on Tap   {Peoria}   //    May-September   //     A traveling taphouse that brings the party to you! From 4 pm until dusk, enjoy live acoustic music, delicious food truck fare, and a variety of beer and non-beer options, all from a nearby Peoria Park District park!
 
Peoria Heights Fine Art Fair   {Peoria Heights}   //   May   //   A delightful local art festival featuring many categories of art, including ceramics, glass, jewelry, mixed media, and more. This is a juried event, with grand prizes for the best art topping out at $1,000!
 
Peoria Bach Festival   {Peoria}   //    June   //     Celebrate the joy, pathos, and beauty of the music of Bach! The community is invited to participate as either a performer or spectator in a variety of events curated for all ages.
 
Canton Art on Main   {Canton}   //    June   //     Support your local Canton art scene by visiting a variety of artist booths, exhibits, and demonstrations. Enjoy live music and free art activities to keep the kids engaged, with plenty of local food and wine options.
 
Chillicothe Days   {Chillicothe}   //    June   //     Bring your family to the carnival at the Chillicothe Days festival, where a vendor fair and sidewalk sale will keep you entertained for hours. Enjoy a fish fry, games and tournaments, and of course the Mr. Chillicothe contest and Miss Chillicothe pageant.
 
Juneteenth   {Peoria}   //    June   //   Juneteenth is the only holiday that commemorates the emancipation of enslaved Africans throughout the United States. Peoria hosts special programs bringing awareness to Freedom Day by gathering and celebrating through music, history, food, education, culture, and community.
 
Moss Avenue Sale + Festival   {Peoria}   //    June   //    Peoria’s most popular garage sale takes over 8 blocks of historic Moss avenue. Here you’ll find antiques, refinished and repurposed furniture, hand-crafted items, and food vendors.
 
Sommerfest   {Peoria}   //    June   //    Celebrate the beginning of summer the German way, with this unique festival featuring German food, car and bike shows, arts and crafts, and entertainment. Play games and shop for the perfect Father's Day gift with a huge selection of imported items from Germany.
 
Strawberry Festival   {Elmwood}   //    June   //    This annual festival celebrates Elmwoods love for strawberries and brings together crafts and vendors to fund the betterment of Elmwood. Look out for great food and local entertainers, and treat yourself to delectable strawberry desserts. 
 
Princeville Heritage Days   {Princeville}   //    June   //    Visit the beautiful Stevens Square in downtown Princeville for a variety of family fun and entertainment. This carnival showcases the best of Princeville, with awesome vendors, games for the kids, and of course the tractor pull and parade!
 
Turkey Festival   {Tremont}   //    June   //    This community summer celebration feels like home, where you can explore the wares at the craft and antique booths, sip a lemonade shake-up, and watch a variety of performances from the Miss Tremont pageant to a carnival and a parade. Come hungry, good food is a huge component of this festival– try the famous grilled turkey!
 
Good Neighbor Days   {Washington}   //    June   //    Washington's annual festival is the perfect way to experience community spirit at its finest! Come and enjoy five days of live entertainment, food and drinks, and family-friendly activities, culminating in a spectacular firework show.
 
Heart of Illinois Fair   {Peoria}   //    July   //     This expansive showcase of the best of Central Illinois will have you seeing everything from live concerts to motorsports. Catch an exciting ride at the amusement park, or play games with your family and friends.
 
Fiesta en el Río   {Peoria}   //    July   //     This high-energy music festival at the Peoria Riverfront celebrates Hispanic and Latino cultures. Enjoy this diverse experience with many types of music, dance, authentic food, and fun.
 
Marshall Putnam Fair   {Henry}   //    July   //     Celebrating over 100 years, the Marshall Putnam Fair festival has a wide range of activities and events. From Dueling Pianos to wine-tasting, kids activities and pageant performances,  this celebration will keep you entertained for days. Don’t miss the concert featuring a special musical guest!
 
River City Pride Weekend   {Peoria}   //    July   //     You’re invited to celebrate Peoria's annual River City Pride Weekend. Several festivals and events will bring people together, stirring the mind, creating safe spaces, and fostering inclusivity, equality, respect, and awareness.
 
Red, White + Boom!   {Peoria}   //    July   //     Peoria's largest fireworks display, Red, White and Boom!, is a "pyro-musical" that combines stunning fireworks and patriotic music, synchronized to light up the night sky. This spectacular display is visible from both sides of the Illinois River and certain areas of Peoria Heights.
 
Brimfield Old Settlers Days   {Brimfield}   //    August   //     The annual Brimfield Old Settlers Days festival is a three day event filled with games, music, and carnival rides. Enjoy tons of food and drink options, and camp out early to get a good view of the parade.
 
Illinois Oz Festival   {Mapleton}   //    August   //     Join Dorothy, Toto, and friends in the jolly old land of Oz. Meet all your favorite characters, take trolley rides, and even have storytime with Auntie Em while you take your very own journey down the Yellow Brick Road. 
 
India Fest   {Peoria}   //    August   //     Enjoy authentic Indian cuisine served by local Indian restaurants at this exciting festival on the Peoria Riverfront. From Bollywood-style entertainment to arts and crafts,  lessons, and more, you won’t want to miss this spicy cultural experience.
 
Marshall County Old Settlers Days   {Lacon}   //    August   //     This summer festival promises a fun filled weekend packed with events for the whole family to enjoy. Sign up for the 5K run, be amused by stage entertainment and the Grand Parade, and get lunch from one of many delicious food trucks.
 
Peoria Irish Fest   {Peoria}   //    August   //     This annual festival on the RiverFront features live music, dancing, Highland Games, exhibits, and interactive sessions. Come enjoy the culture, food, and fun. This annual event is family-friendly and a great way to experience Celtic culture in Peoria.
 
River City Soul Fest   {Peoria}   //    August   //     Enjoy Peoria’s original celebration of soul and R+B music. This three-day festival features local house DJs and gospel performance groups for an exciting experience of live entertainment.
 
Taste of Peoria   {Peoria}   //    August   //     Satisfy your hunger at this must-attend event featuring local restaurants and food trucks. Enjoy live music while indulging in mouth-watering cuisine. Don't forget to bring a lawn chair for ultimate relaxation.
 
Watermelon Festival   {Spring Bay}   //    August   //    The Watermelon Festival is an annual carnival sponsored by the Spring Bay Legion. Enjoy live entertainment, arts and crafts, and fun for the entire family.


 
AUTUMN
Autumn Market   {Chillicothe}   //    September   //    This market is full of local farmers and artisans. Shop produce, baked goods, sweet treats, hand-crafted goodies, and more! Enjoy music by the Roundstone Buskers and snacks from food trucks like El Zarape Taco Truck and Swanee's Soft Pretzels.
 
Bridge to Bridge River Drive    {Peoria Heights > Chillicothe > Henry > Lacon > Spring Bay}   //    September   //    This charming festival takes place in five of Greater Peoria’s quintessential river towns along the Illinois River. Stop along the route from Peoria Heights to Chillicothe to Lacon to Henry to Spring Bay and experience art fairs, vendor markets, live music, family games, fishing, food, and more!
 
Cannabis Camp  {West Peoria}   //    September   //    Cannabis Camp is the premier cannabis event of the summer in downstate Illinois. This consumption event celebrates all-natural health and wellness treatments, specifically cannabis. There will be a variety of vendors from around the state with booths set up to offer educational materials, purchasable items, and giveaways. We will also have food trucks, live art, yoga, music, and more!
 
Corn Festival   {El Paso}   //    September   //    Visit El Paso for the annual corn festival, featuring three fun filled days of carnival, food, and free entertainment. Set up camp early for the best view of the parade!
 
Grape Stomp + Harvest Festival   {Mackinaw}   //    September   //    Channel your inner Lucy and get your feet wet in this juicy and one-of-a-kind wine-making experience. With wine flights all day and a Lucy-Look-alike contest, you’ll be stomping to the beat of a great time!
 
Havana Oktoberfest   {Havana}   //    September   //    Havana Oktoberfest is an amazing weekend filled with culture and fun. Get ready for food and drinks, vendors, live music, a carnival and parade, contests, polka pace race and fun for all!
 
Labor Day Parade + Picnic   {Peoria}   //    September   //    This Labor Day Parade supports various trade unions beginning their march from the Monroe Street Fire Station all the way to the courthouse. After the parade, enjoy a picnic at the Riverfront Festival Park, with food and beverages on-site.
 
Manito Popcorn Festival   {Manito}   //    September   //     Ditch that microwave popcorn and bring the family to this poppin' Labor Day weekend festival in Manito. Enjoy craft booths, vendors, a parade, and the best popcorn in town.
 
Marigold Festival   {Pekin}   //    September   //    The Pekin Marigold Festival is a can't-miss community event featuring local vendors, artists, music, athletics, and more. Celebrate Senator Everett Dirksen with a parade, carnival, and the crowning of Miss Marigold in the Marigold capital of the world.
 
Pumpkin Festival   {Morton}   //    September   //    Celebrate fall in the Pumpkin Capital of the World! This four-day festival is a pumpkin lover's dream come true. Events include the Pumpkin Boxcar Derby, the Pumpkin Princess pageant, and the Pumpkin Classic 10K. Don't miss the famous Pumpkin Pancake Breakfast, but make sure to arrive early!
 
Peoria Art Guild Fine Art Fair   {Peoria}   //    September   //    This nationally recognized event features original works from national, regional and local artists in a variety of mediums. From jewelry to ceramics and everything in between, there's something for every art lover to enjoy.
 
Peoria Blues + Heritage Festival   {Peoria}   //    September   //    Enjoy a world-class lineup of artists from blues, roots, fun, and soul, and everything in between. Downtown Peoria comes to life in this event that stretches off the waterfront into bars, venues, and local businesses.
 
Peoria Oktoberfest   {Peoria}   //    September   //    With Oompah music, lederhosen, and dirndls, the Peoria Oktoberfest festival is a great way to experience German culture and heritage. This party on the Riverfront features live music, beer samples, Nagelspielen tournaments, and even a catholic mass.
 
Taste of Canton   {Canton}   //    September   //    The streets in downtown Canton will be closed off for this local food festival!! Expect a variety of tastings from local restaurants and food trucks, a wine and beer garden, live music and inflatables for the kiddos. Oh, and don't forget the pie eating contest!!
 
Big Picture Festival   {Peoria}    //    October   //     This annual event brings together artists of all levels to showcase their talent through various mediums, including paint and chalk. In addition to live art demonstrations, featured artists will create stunning large-scale murals.
 
Haunted Houses   {GPA}    //    October   //     Central Illinois is brimming with scary opportunities to face your fears and seek a spooky thrill. Keep an eye on our Haunted Attractions blog for the most terrifying haunts in the Greater Peoria Area. 
 
Peoria Food + Wine Festival   {Peoria Heights}   //    October   //    The Peoria Food and Wine Festival is perfect for foodies and wine connoisseurs as the festival showcases local food and wines! Every year the Peoria Food + Wine festival benefits local charities–this. Stay tuned to find out what non-profit the proceeds will be donated.
 
Schlachtfest    {Dunlap}   //    October   //    Schlachtfest is a combined celebration of German-American Day and a kick-off to German-American Heritage month. The event will feature German music, beer, food, activities, games along with an art and craft fair.
 
Spoon River Drive Fall Festival    {Fulton County}   //    October   //    Spoon River Valley Scenic Drive Fall Festival is a celebration of arts, history, and culture throughout Fulton County. Each of the communities participating (Astoria, Bernadotte, Canton, Duncan Mills, Lewistown, Smithfield and more) are displaying a multitude of arts, crafts, flea markets, foods, history and heritage.
 
Spoon River Days    {Wyoming}   //    October   //    This years’ Schlachtfest will be a combined celebration of German-American Day and a kick-off to German-American Heritage month. The event will feature German music, beer, food, activities, games along with an art and craft fair.


 
WINTER
Festival of Lights and Parade of Lights   {East Peoria}    //    November-December   //     With over three million lights depicting everything from animals to holiday items, this drive-through spectacle is a must-see for all ages. If you want to avoid the crowds, try visiting on a Monday or Tuesday.
 
Santa Claus Parade + Yule Like Peoria  {Peoria}    //    November   //     The Santa Claus Parade is the longest-running holiday parade in the nation. This Peoria tradition takes a magical journey through the downtown streets of Peoria with more than 100 decorated floats and characters. Yule Like Peoria features refreshments and various forms of holiday entertainment in the beautifully decorated business area of downtown Peoria.
 
Christmas On Court   {Pekin}    //    December   //     Explore the charming historic Downtown Court Street, with local retailers and Pop-Up Markets for a unique shopping experience. Indulge in delicious food and drinks and make sure to check out the community Christmas Tree, a tribute to Pekin's First Responders.
 
Kris Kringle Market  {Peoria Heights}    //    December   //     Meet Kris Kringle as Peoria Heights celebrates the annual lighting of their Christmas tree at Tower Park. Visitors to this open air market can expect to cross hot chocolate, cocktails, and live entertainment off their Christmas list.

36 Restaurants For Picky Eaters

By Guest Writer:  Abi Davis on

					Apr. 12, 2023
				






We all know how tough it can be to find a family restaurant that appeals to everybody. Don't worry, though: you have options! Here are 36 great family restaurants in Greater Peoria that appeal to everybody, no matter how fussy they are.


 
Asher’s Bar and Grill  {Pekin}   //  What's awesome about Asher’s is the kid's menu will definitely appeal to kids with pickier palates. The kids menu covers grilled cheese, cheese burgers, and chicken strips. There is something for everybody else too, including, burgers, seafood, pasta and the colossal tenderloin just to name a few. Asher’s is a fan favorite and will keep you and your family coming back.
 
Avanti’s  {East Peoria + Pekin + Peoria}   //   Avanti’s is a family favorite that you can find in so many different locations! What kid doesn’t love spaghetti and meatballs? If they don’t, no biggie, Avanti’s also has chicken tenders, pizza, mozzarella sticks, and so much more. You can also get a family meal package that makes everyone's life easier!
 
Babe’s on Plum  {Havana}   //   Babe’s on Plum is a little slice of heaven you can find tucked into Havana. They have diverse delicious weekly menus that will keep you curiously wanting to come back. The menu has a great selection and you can't go wrong with what you order. 
 
Billy’s Tap   {Canton}   //   Billy’s Tap in Canton is a quintessential stop if you want finger-licking flavors. With delicious daily specials and incredible outdoor dining.  Kid approved menu options and an adult approved drink menu. Pay BIlly’s Tap a visit you will not regret!
 
Braker’s Market   {Eureka}   //   Braker’s is a family-owned business that provides top quality goods, service, and fun for everyone. With a wide selection of goods including deli meats & cheeses, bulk foods, baking ingredients, baked goods, made-to-order sandwiches, children’s toys, specialty gifts, outdoor poly furniture, skirts, and much more! Braker’s Market in Eureka is a must!
 
Brickhouse BBQ   {Washington}   //   Recently voted the Taste of Washington, Brickhouse BBQ knows how its done. Offering a vast menu of BBQ, burgers, pizza, and many other entrees made from fresh ingredients. The Brickhouse is the perfect spot for families, celebrations or everyday dining. Stop in for some tasty BBQ or American classics next time you're in Washington, IL!
 
Burger Barge  {East Peoria}   //   Everyone will be excited to eat dinner at the Burger Barge. With such a fun name, the restaurant offers up a really enjoyable once in a lifetime experience. The menu features fun food with amazing themed names such as the anchor and bluebeard’s Burger. Who wouldn't want to order delicious  food with those kinds of names?!
 
Biscuits + Gravy   {Metamora}   //   Biscuits + Gravy is the perfect go-to for families with picky eaters. They cover everyone’s breakfast and lunch needs, pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, cheeseburgers, pork chops, and more!  Rest assured, picky palates will be more than pleased.
 
Buttermilk Cafe  {Germantown Hills}   //   What picky eater doesn’t love breakfast foods?! There is no choice when it comes to Buttermilk Cafe in Germantown Hills––it will steal your heart. The coziest little corner cafe that provides a vast selection of breakfast and lunch food including chicken and waffles, strawberry cheesecake pancakes, biscuits and gravy, and much much more. Visit Buttermilk Cafe for a classic but elevated breakfast experience. 
 
Busy Corner  {Goodfield}   //   Busy Corner has stayed busy crafting the perfect friendly atmosphere. Whether you are a local customer or just passing by, their customers turn into long-time friends after one piece of their famous pie. 
 
Capponi’s Restaurant   {Toluca}   //   When it comes to picky eaters you can never go wrong with an Italian restaurant, especially Capponi’s! Though they are closely connected to their Italian roots, they also serve American favorites! From delicious fried chicken, fat pretzels, pizza, mozzarella sticks, and other simple pasta items picky eaters will want to devour!
 
Childers Eatery   {Peoria + East Peoria}   //   There's no reason to miss out on the delicious food here just because your kids are picky eaters. What's awesome about Childers is the kid's menu will definitely appeal to kids with pickier palates. With breakfast and lunch options like teddy bear pancakes, french toast sticks, ham and cheese sandwiches, hamburgers, chicken strips, and quesadillas! The whole family can dine at Childers and have a delicious meal together.
 
Dog Haus Biergarten  {Peoria}   //   What child doesn’t love a good hotdog? Dog Haus loves a good dog and has taken it to another level. Along with the most delicious hotdogs they also have sausages, burgers and chicken. Dog Haus will immediately become a family favorite!
 
Donnelly’s Irish Pub  {Peoria}   //   Finding something to love on Donnelly’s menu is easy for anyone. From chicken tenders to Cheeseburgers to traditional hand cut french fries and chips, There’s something sure to please every picky palate and keep you coming back for more. Experience a real, authentic Irish pub atmosphere the whole family can enjoy at Donnelly’s Irish Pub!
 
Double A’s  {Peoria}   //   Before the game, after the game, visit Double A's Sports Bar & Grill. Known for their family friendly atmosphere, great wings, pizza, lunch buffet and TVs for every sporting event. Double A's Sports Bar, Just like Home, Only Better.
 
Garner’s Pizza + Wings  {Morton}   //   With the word “pizza” in the name how can you go wrong. If you're not in the mood for pizza, they also have delicious wings, sandwiches, and appetizers. At Gardner’s you and your picky eaters simply can’t go wrong
 
Gebby’s Family Restaurant   {Peoria Heights}   //   Gebby’s family restaurant will not disappoint picky eaters. They will love the yummy cinnamon rolls, pancakes, french toast, grilled cheese, chicken strips, and corndogs. Trust me, picky eaters will love it here.
 
Good Tequila’s  {Bartonville + Pekin + Peoria + Peoria Heights}   //   Good Tequila’s is perfect for everyone! Outgoing dishes for those who are adventurous and simple dishes for those with picky palettes. With a huge diverse delicious menu there will be something for everyone! Come to Good Tequila’s where nobody has to miss out! 
 
Jalapeños   {Peoria}   //   Jalapenos will satisfy everyone, even the pickiest of eaters. An extensive kids menu that covers quesadillas, tacos, rice, hamburger, grilled cheese, and even more. Trust me, Jalapenos is going to want your picky eaters wanting more. 
 
Jimbo’s Jumbo  {Pekin}   //   Jimbo’s Jumbo provides absolutely appetizing Italian food. With a menu that ranges from basics for the picky eaters, and detailed dishes for those who are feeling a little crazy. No matter what, anyone and everyone will be able to enjoy Jimbo’s Jumbo.
 
Jubilee Cafe  {Edwards}   //   All picky eaters love comfort food, that’s what it’s all about–feeling comfortable. Jubilee Cafe is comfort food at its finest. They offer an all day breakfast menu, burgers, homemade pies, a vast kid's menu and much more. Jubilee Cafe is perfect for the whole family!
 
LaGondola Spaghetti House  {Peoria + Creve Coeur + Bartonville + Morton + Chillicothe}   //   Daily fresh bread, sauce made from scratch, the tantalizing smells and tastes of Italy. You can’t tell me that doesn’t make you want to visit LaGondola. And with their diverse menu, your picky eaters will love it there too!
 
Mona’s Italian Foods  {Toluca}   //   When it comes to picky eaters I promise you can’t go wrong with an Italian restaurant, especially Mona’s! Though they are closely connected to their Italian roots, they also serve American favorites! From delicious fried chicken, fat pretzels, pizza, mozzarella sticks, and other simple pasta items picky eaters will want to devour!
 
Other Dawg  {Peoria Heights}   //   When a kid is a picky eater, they have strong ideas about what they like and don't like. Most of the time, they like meals that appeal to the majority of kids (and the rest of us, too): hotdogs, chicken strips, and nachos. That's why The Other Dawg is another perfect restaurant for kids who are picky eaters. 
 
One World Cafe   {Peoria}   //    One world does in fact have an  incredible adventurous menu. Though the picky eaters don’t have to worry about that. With options like build your own pizza, mac n’ cheese, burgers, and chicken tenders. Just know when you come to One World there will be something for everyone.!
 
Peaches  {Havana}   //   Picky eaters will totally love it here. Options like hotdogs and nachos will keep everyone happy. And for dessert there is an overwhelming amount of options like ice cream, candy shakes, slushes, smoothies, milkshakes, and malts. With so many great simplistic meals to choose from, rest assured, picky palates will be more than pleased. 
 
Peoria Pizza Works  {Peoria Heights}   //   Just based on the name alone you know that they have pizza locked down. They have so many other options too! Quesadillas, chicken fingers, soft pretzels, grilled cheese, and so much more! Everyone will be able to find something they love. 
 
Po-Boy’s On Frostwood  {Peoria}   //   When parents bring their picky eaters to a restaurant, it definitely needs to have a great kid's menu with things that children actually want to eat, and that's exactly what Po-Boy’s On Frostwood has. 
 
Rosati’s Pizza  {Pekin}   //   With a recipe that hasn’t changed since 1964 Rosati’s Pizza has perfected the pizza. And what picky eater doesn’t like pizza? If they don’t like pizza they also have plenty of other options to please everyone!
 
Sicily Pizza  {Washburn}   //   If a restaurant has the word "pizza" in the title then there is a really good chance that picky eaters will be pleased to dine there. Sicily Pizza in Washburn has so many mouth watering choices and kids will have fun deciding what they want on their pizza. If anyone wants something other than pizza, this menu has them covered there, too!
 
Sugar Wood-Fired Pizza   {Peoria}   //   Sugar will be pleasing to everyone you bring in. Insanely delicious wood-fired pizzas and so many other options. A kids menu is also available with simple options for your picky eaters. You absolutely can not go wrong with Sugar!
 
The Feed Store  {Princeville}   //   The Feed Store is a  fun twist on farm to table dining that the whole family will love. American dinner classics like burgers, chicken tenders, and grilled cheese. Along with incredible classic breakfast options like pancakes, cinnamon rolls, and french toast. Everyone will be able to find something they love. 
 
Toots Treats  {Elmwood}   //    When a kid is a picky eater, they have strong ideas about what they like and don't like. Most of the time, they like meals that appeal to the majority of kids (and the rest of us, too): chicken strips, cheeseburgers, mini corn dogs, nachos, and so much more. Don’t forget to get a yummy cold sweet treat too! Toots Treats  is another perfect restaurant for kids who are picky eaters. 
 
Trails End Smokehouse   {Goodfield}   //   Insanely delightful pulled pork, brisket, ribs, the list goes on and on. Trails End also has a kids menu for those picky eaters. You simply can’t go wrong with Trails End Smokehouse. Trust when I say everyone will find something they love. 
 
Weaver’s Fresh Food  {Peoria}   //   There's no reason to miss out on the incredible food here just because your kids are picky eaters. They provide made from scratch pizza, famous chicken fingers, mac n’ cheese, lemon shake ups, and more! The whole family can dine at Weavers and have an amazing evening together.
 
Woody’s Family Restaurant  {Groveland}   //   Who doesn’t love comfort food, picky eaters love feeling comfortable. Woody’s can provide that comfort. They offer an all day breakfast menu, burgers, and sweet treats, options kids will love and much more. Woody’s Family Restaurant is perfect for the whole family!

3 Amazing Peoria Trails for Bicycle Connoisseurs

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 25, 2022
				






Did you know the Peoria Area is home to one of the largest networks of mountain bike trails in the entire state? Here are 3 great rides for peddle connoisseurs:
 
Bike Your Way Through Oz
A quick trip out to the Peoria Park District’s Kinsey Park will transport you to a series of hiking and mountain biking trails, rated from beginner to expert, all of which are named after scenes from the Wizard of Oz. You can ride on the Yellow Brick Road, rip down Flying Monkeys, visit the Land of Oz and ride along with the Tin Man, Cowardly Lion and Scarecrow, plus many others. 
Fun Detail:  The trails have been created, maintained and expanded with the help of volunteers from the Peoria Area Mountain Bike Association (PAMBA). Grab a shovel! PAMBA maintains and expands these trails every Tuesday throughout the summer and fall. Volunteers are welcome! 
 

Biking Out In The Wild!
To tackle some of the more challenging mountain bike trails in the Peoria Area, explore Wildlife Prairie Park, just a short 2.5 miles from the Oz trails at Kinsey Park. This private parkland is accessible with a day pass ($9) or an annual membership. They are rated similar to ski slopes, with green circle signs being easy, blue squares being more moderate, and black diamond being expert—there are even a few double black diamond trails. 
Fun Detail:  If staying at the facility, check out the easier trails on the east side, which are accessible only during business hours, and the west side’s more challenging terrain is operational from dawn to dusk. 

 
Biking The Historic Rock Island Trail
The Rock Island Trail is a relatively flat and easy railway to trail conversion that starts in downtown Peoria, near the Gateway Building, and follows the Peoria Greenway (Peoria Park District black top/maintained pathway) 13 miles all the way up to the small enclave of Alta. There, the blacktop officially turns into the Rock Island Trail, which is an additional 26 mile section of crushed smooth limestone that cuts through the towns of Dunlap, Peoria Heights, Princeville, Wyoming and terminates in Toulon. This easy to peddle route is perfect for all ages, bike styles, and fitness levels. The route provides an opportunity for various quick stops for refreshments and rests, particularly on the southern half of the route. 
Fun Detail:  Originally built as a railroad in 1869, it continued to run trains from 1871 to 1963. It sat unused until it became a public trail in 1989.

The Peoria Area has an abundance of exciting outdoor opportunities, which are often overlooked by visitors and residents. Peoria Outdoor Adventure was created to combine the very best of our LOCAL outdoor clubs, groups, and restaurants that make Greater Peoria an adventurous place. The Greater Peoria Area is loaded with hundreds of miles of trails, thousands of acres of creeks, rivers and parks, and an untapped potential.
Check out PeoriaOutdoorAdventure.com for hidden midwestern resources and gems.

2021 Pride Events to Celebrate

By Guest Writer:  Abby Batson on

					Jun. 24, 2021
				






Recognize Pride Month with festivities that are happening in the Peoria area. This year, in addition to the Virtual River City Pridefest, a variety of smaller events hosted by Peoria Proud, will take place throughout June. These events include Pride Night at Dozer Field and weekly “Pride Nights” at local bars and restaurants. 
Local partners of Peoria Proud include Miss Flo NoMo', Sparky's, Club Diesel, Mack's, Central Illinois Friends, Betty Jayne Brimmer Center for the Performing Arts, the Tartan Inn, Kenny's Westside Pub and Broadway Deli & Lounge. 
 
PRIDE LINE UP
JUNE 25, 2021
Pride Ride  //  Fitness and Party Bike Class, drinks and celebration at Styles Studios Fitness!
Drag N’ Paint  //  Grab your friends and head down to Kenny's Westside Pub as hosts Megan Couri and Miss. Flo guide you to create your masterpiece! Miss Flo has gathered her glamorous friends Artemesia Van Ho and Devevia Mann to entertain while you and your friends paint the night away. 
Pride Night + Karaoke with Miss G  //  Come out to Sparky's Ringside and enjoy Pride Night and Karaoke with Miss G!
 
 
JUNE 26, 2021
Virtual River City Pridefest  //  Among an array of Pride events hosted in Peoria throughout this summer, River City Pride Festival will be holding a large-scale Pride festival virtually once again this year. Sponsored by Peoria Proud, this event will have a variety of speakers, entertainment, information, and much more throughout the day. Link can be found on the Peoria Proud Facebook Page. 
Pride Night and Drag Show  //  Bring your friends out to Sparky’s to enjoy a fun-filled evening celebrating Pride and the annual Drag Show. 
 
 
JUNE 30, 2021
Pride Night at Dozer Field  //  Enjoy Pride Night at the Chief’s game. The first 500 guests will receive a tie dye Chiefs t-shirt. The ever lovely Gayla A. Winter will be singing the National Anthem!
 

Discover more events in the region at DiscoverPeoria.com/Events

The Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau is constantly working to make sure that the Peoria Area is known for being a destination that not only tourist, bus groups, families and couples enjoy but also a known hub for sporting events and a go-to area for meetings and conventions.

Extra! Extra!

3/22/2023 - People of Peoria Podcast President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso was on The People of Peoria Podcast recently! Grab a snack and fun beverage, and give it a listen here. 

11/13/2022 - Round Trip with Colleen Kelly Let's play in Peoria! This week on Round Trip, Colleen and Megan discuss this heartland city, and Colleen recounts her recent college visit with her daughter. Plus, the CEO of Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, J.D. Dalfonso has the best recommendations when visiting Peoria; and the CEO of Wildlife Prairie Park, Roberta English will talk about this amazing place to see wildlife in the area. Hear all about Peoria at the 10:50 mark on the podcast!

4/01/2022 - Meetings Today stopped by to chat with Discover Peoria Vice President of Sales Beth Reusch and President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso about some great places to gather in the Peoria area. They talked all things Louisville Slugger Sports Complex, Peoria Civic Center, and more! Click here to read more about their conversation, and to see which Peoria sports venue you might want to visit next!

PLUG IN:  EV Charging in GPA

By Discover Peoria on

					Mar. 07, 2023
				






EV drivers rejoice!  Here is a comprehensive list of charging stations as you navigate the Greater Peoria Area (GPA).
 
Charging station availability and compatibility may vary over time---please confirm compatibility with the location before traveling to the EV Charging Station.

CANTON

20 Girls’ Night Outings

By Guest Writer:  Aly Nezgoda-Owdom on

					Jan. 11, 2023
				






Call up your gal pals, you’re long overdue for a night out with the ladies! We rounded up 20 fresh girls’ night out ideas in the Peoria Area—from relaxing to wild—so you can enjoy a meaningful evening with your favorite people.

 
12 Bar Lounge  {Peoria Heights}    //   This rooftop lounge is the perfect place for craft cocktails and delicious food in a unique atmosphere. Plan your night out around their impressive Tuesday-Friday specials, including half-priced wine and appetizers.
 
Barn III  {Goodfield}    //    This all-in-one experience is perfect for an entertaining night out with the girls. Enjoy dinner and drinks over a highly anticipated performance at the Barn III. Performances are masterfully crafted to engage audiences through a delicious 4-course meal, complete with signature cocktails crafted with the show in mind. The Barn III is an experience your friends will be talking about for years to come!
 
Basket Case Pub  {Peoria}    //    Sing your hearts out any night of the week at Peoria’s first karaoke bar! If you need a little liquid courage, the daily happy hour specials will boost your confidence—-try one of the popular Pineapple Upside Down cocktails, an Under the Sea, or a Jameson Orange Crush. If you are looking for a fun and eclectic spot, this is the place for you and the girls to enjoy. 
 
Crafted DIY  {Peoria}    //    Let the liquor get your creative juices flowing at Crafted DIY Studio + Bar. Choose a craft cocktail and one of the 20+ unique jewelry, home decor, leather, or woodworking projects and spend the night crafting with your besties. Expect lots of laughs, this gem takes “paint and sips” to a whole new level!!
 
Generations Candle Co.  {Peoria Heights}    //    If a fun yet relaxing girls night out is what you're planning, try creating a custom candle at Generations. Browse the extensive fragrance wall and a Scent Stylist will help each of you mix and match the perfect custom candle. Every second at Generations—from choosing a vessel, designing the label, sniffing, mixing, and pouring—is an amazing shared experience with your tribe. 
 
Gone Mad Rage Room  {Peoria}    //   Going through a breakup and need to vent? Gather up the girls and let loose! Gone Mad offers the unique opportunity to be the bull in a chinashop. Choose a Spotify playlist and release your pent up energy by throwing, smashing, and destroying objects within a safe space without the worry of clean up or consequences. You and the girls can even bring one box of your own items to smash!
Be sure to also check out the Gone Mad sister companies too:  Gone Axe Throwing + Gone in 60 Escape Games.
 
Haynes on Main  {Mackinaw}    //    Haynes on Main hosts impressive ladies’ night events every Thursday featuring local treats and entertainment from across the Peoria Area. Serving delicious food and tasty beverages inside or in the beer garden, this adorable hometown spot will easily turn into a weekly excuse to get the girls together.
 
Industry Brewing Co. {Peoria}    //  Industry has the drinks and the atmosphere to complete an amazing girls night out! Try a beer flight to sample all the brews created on site, indulge in delicious apps and entrees, lounge in the outdoor beer garden for some axe throwing, live music, or to relax by the firepit with a DIY smores kit. Furry friends are also welcome!
 
Jukebox Comedy Club  {Peoria}   //  Wondering what to do for your next girls night out? Check out a Jukebox Comedy Club stand up comedy show. From a casual date night to a spontaneous friends night out, an incredible stand up show will become a favorite memory for years to come. Since 1990, Jukebox has been a premier 
 
Mackinaw Valley Vineyard  {Mackinaw}    //   Who needs Napa when you can head to Mackinaw Valley Vineyard to experience “wine country in our own backyard”!? Take in the stunning vantage point of the vineyards while sampling an amazing selection of handcrafted wines made from fruit on the estate. Mackinaw Valley Vineyard offers winery tours + tastings, chocolate + wine pairings, as well as great events throughout the year such as concerts, trivia game nights, and murder mystery dinners! 
 
Martinis on Water  {Peoria}    //    Enjoy great live music while sipping one of the 100 martinis on the menu. There are drink specials Monday-Friday with $4 martinis on Monday, $4 cosmos on Tuesday, $4 apple martinis on Wednesday, $4 dessert martinis on Thursday, and $5 martini happy hour from 4-6pm on Friday. If you or your girls love martinis then this is the place for you!
 
The Missing Zither  {Peoria}    //    The owners of [CxT] Roasting Company are bringing coffee to cocktails. In addition to their famous espresso-infused libations (pulled fresh from the espresso machine, in decaf, upon order), The Missing Zither offers a variety of craft cocktails and non-alcoholic mocktails in an atmosphere that transports you to the Roaring 20s. Call your ladies for a specialty cocktail, The Missing Zither in Keller Station is the perfect place to enjoy a cozy drink after work or to kick off the weekend in style!
 
Par-A-Dice Casino  {East Peoria}    //    Dreaming of a girls trip to Vegas? Head to the East Peoria marina for a wild night on the Par-A-Dice Casino gambling boat. Choose your favorite slot machine from the 550 available or try your luck on the blackjack, craps, roulette, 3-card poker, Mississippi stud, or mini baccarat tables instead. And you’re in luck because admission is free and the restaurants onsite are the best in town!
 
Peoria Himalayan Salt Cave  {Peoria}    //    Recline, relax, rejuvenate, and restore in the himalayan salt room with this unique spa experience. Halotherapy, or dry salt therapy, offers many health benefits and is a great way to relax the body and mind. If you and the girls need a spa day, this soothing treatment and relaxing ambiance is highly recommended!
 
Peoria Symphony Orchestra  {Peoria}    //    Put on your fancy clothes and spend girls night in style with our very own Peoria Symphony Orchestra. This is a great opportunity to enjoy magical journeys, exhilarating masterpieces, and world-class guest artists with your tribe. Check out the Peoria Symphony Orchestra’s performance schedule to plan your next swanky hen night.
 
Pour Bros. Craft Taproom  {Peoria Heights}    //    Drink as little or as much as you like at Pour Bros Taproom. This unique spot is perfect for beer lovers and explorers. Take a trip to the pour wall and grab your own beer, cider, or mead by the ounce. This happy hour is a must-visit for a fun and memorable girls night out.
 
Racks on the Rocks {West Peoria}    //   Challenge your girls to a game of pool at Racks on the Rocks. This pool and billiard hall offers free pool Monday-Friday from 10am-5pm and great drink specials Monday-Sunday. If you and the gang are looking for consistent rendezvous and are feeling competitive, check out the women's tournament league playing Mondays and Sundays. 
 
Succulent Natural Skincare  {Peoria}    //   Succulent Natural Skincare offers a mobile Mask Bar!! This traveling spa service is the best way to relax with your ladies in the comfort of your home. This facial experience is a fun and unique way to relax with the girls and pamper yourselves with natural, zero-waste, skincare products made right here in Peoria!
 
The Cookery {Morton}    //    Take your cooking skills to the next level! The Cookery is thrilled to share their passion for cooking with the Peoria Area. With a variety of unique cooking classes including homemade pasta, the art of dumplings, superfood detox cleanses, and knife skills, the Cookery has options for every group looking for a fun night out. 
 
Your Pedal Party  {Peoria Heights}    //   Grab your favorite beverages and your support circle for a truly unique and memorable night out. Your Pedal Party is a regional-first! This custom 14-passenger cycle-powered pub will have you and your friends poppin’ bottles and pedaling through downtown Peoria Heights. It’s the most fun you’ll have at 5MPH!

5 Date Night Dinner Ideas

By Discover Peoria on

					Dec. 09, 2021
				






Looking for new restaurants to try out for date night? Whether you want a romantic candlelit dinner or a casual + fun atmosphere, try one of these five restaurants in Peoria.
 
Jim's Bistro   //   If you love steak, then this is the place for you! Jim’s Bistro offers an unforgettable fine dining experience with a selection of fine, dry-aged steaks cut in-house. It also offers seafood, pasta, salads, and more for those that aren't a big fan of steak. 

Fish House   //   If seafood shipped in from all over the world isn’t enough to convince you to eat at the Fish House, then I don't know what will! The Fish House has been a staple in Peoria for over 40 years, and has always served the freshest seafood dishes that have been flown in from Chile, Hawaii, Canada and more! Its dimly lit and intimate space is perfect for a romantic evening full of good food and fine wines.

Thanh Linh   //   Known for its big portions and authentic Vietnamese cuisine, Thanh Linh is perfect for date night! It’s relatively cheap compared to the other restaurants we recommended and you will definitely get your money’s worth in terms of portion sizes. Its Pad Thai and Lemongrass Chicken are a couple of our favorite dishes, and the portion is so huge that it’s easy to share with your date!

Cyd’s In The Park   //   Cyd's in the Park offers a unique and memorable experience with its beautifully lit patio and delicious food! It’s perfect if you’re looking for a more casual and laid-back spot that is still intimate and romantic. Cyd’s host live music on the weekends and even offer a bonfire at nighttime for a cozy and relaxing experience. Be sure to try the pretzel bites with kimchi pimento cheese and crudité as it's one of our favorite items on the menu!

Osaka Hibachi & Sushi Bar   //   Located in the Shoppes at Grand Prairie, Osaka's Hibachi experience is a unique and fun experience, where your meal is cooked right in front of you by chefs who enjoy showing off their knife skills and maneuvers.

Date Night Destinations

By Guest Writer:  Abi Davis on

					Feb. 20, 2023
				






There are plenty of memorable restaurants in Greater Peoria for couples to enjoy. From cozy bistros to elegant fine dining establishments, from intimate candlelit settings to stunning views of the region—these restaurants provide the perfect ambiance for a great evening out on the town. Afterall, the quickest way to our hearts is through our stomachs. Luckily, the Greater Peoria Area is dotted with restaurants to make you swoon.
 
So, grab your boo or work up the courage to ask out a crush—these romantic hideaways are perfect for date night!
 
 
FULTON COUNTY
Bistro 101   {Canton}   //   This elevated bistro is tucked away in downtown Canton. We highly recommend checking it out for a date night—you can’t go wrong with a menu crafted from innovative recipes and fresh ingredients. The diverse and delicious menu is accompanied with great service and strong drinks, Bistro 101 is a superb choice for a night out. 
 
 
 
MARSHALL COUNTY
Capponi’s Restaurant   {Toluca}   //   Capponi’s is an old school family Italian restaurant with an incredibly welcoming atmosphere that makes this classic joint an essential date spot. If you are craving Italian comfort foods like risotto, pasta, or marinated proteins, make a reservation at Capponi’s 
 
Gator'z Pub + Grill   {La Rose}   //   Gator’z Pub + Grill is a quaint local spot in La Rose with a newly renovated vibe—providing a fun atmosphere. Add Gator’z to your casual date night list for a tasty burger or hand tossed pizza. We promise it will become your new favorite hideaway.
 
Italian Villa   {Henry}   //   The Italian Villa is a hidden gem and the perfect place for a low-key pizza date. This local pizza shop has a dedicated clientele driving miles for a slice of happiness—stop in with your date to experience what all the fuss is about. Their hand tossed, made-from-scratch pizza crust, ooey gooey cheese, and freshly chopped toppings is the perfect dish to bond over.
 
Mona’s Italian Food   {Toluca}   //   Mona’s Italian Food has a nostalgic ambiance that will transport you from Toluca to a quaint little street in Italy. Giving you the opportunity to fully enjoy their creamy, flavorful pasta, juicy chicken, and fun twists on other classics. Treat yourself and a lover to a date night at Mona’s that feels straight out of a movie.
 
Scapecchi's Supper Club   {Farmington}   //   Scapecchi’s Supper Club is family run and has been around for over 20 years, so they have the date night experience down. They’ve mastered the tender, melt in your mouth steak, perfectly cooked fish, with unmatched appetizers and cocktails, and you can’t not have dessert! Lovingly wander down to Farmington with your better half and let Scapecchi show you how it's done.
 
 
 
MASON COUNTY
Babe’s on Plum  {Havana}   //   Babe’s on Plum is a little slice of heaven you can find tucked into Havana. They have diverse delicious weekly menus that will keep you curiously wanting to come back. You and your babe will absolutely fall in love with Babe’s.
 
Hawks Grove Inn  {Manito}   //   Manito is home to a lot of places but Hawks Grove Inn  is, dare I say, some of the best food in town. With truly unmatched classic options like steak, fried chicken, catfish, and much more. Hawks Grove inn will be a place you and your honey will want to come back to over and over. 
 
Los Charros  {Havana}   //   Los Charros is the place to go for those who dabble in margarita tasting. Not only do they have some of the best margs around, they also have the best top notch, authentic, Mexican cuisine. Havana’s Los Charros is the place to go when you and your boo want the true Mexican restaurant experience.
 
 
 
PEORIA COUNTY
Connected  {Peoria}   //   Connected is a true hidden gem, giving you a truly elevated dining experience you won’t find anywhere else, except Italy. This upscale Italian restaurant has food that you could only dream of and elevated signature cocktails that add a little sprinkle of magic to your dining experience. Connected is the place to go if you truly want to celebrate.
 
Edge by Chef Dustin Allen  {Peoria Heights}   //   Peoria Heights home to Edge by Chef Dustin Allen, with a modern industrial feel, it will feel like you are dining in a big city! They have a network of over 60+ local farms that provide a revolving door of fresh ingredients.  Edge By Chef Dustin Allen is an experience that you and your love absolutely have to experience.
 
Fish House  {Peoria}   //   The Fish house is Peoria’s home of seafood perfection. They specialize in fresh seafood dishes from around the world with an eclectic mix of steak, Chicken and pasta dishes that will satisfy all appetites. The fish house is a date night must visit for you and your beloved.
 
Gil’s Supper Club  {Hanna City}   //   GIl’s Supper Club has been in business since 1962, in the same location with the same delicious chicken recipe for over 50 years. Known for their iconic fried chicken, Jumbo pork tenderloins and a full service menu with a variety of items. You have to travel to Hanna CIty to go to GIl’s, OH and don’t forget to get your sweetie pie a pie!
 
Jim’s Steakhouse  {Peoria}   //  Jim’s Steakhouse was started in Peoria and has been around for over half a century. They use dry-aged beef, a time consuming and expensive operation indulged in by only a lucky few. They supply their customers with the freshest of produce, the highest quality ingredients and supreme care in preparation. Jim’s Steakhouse will curate the most excellent date night for you and your lover.
 
Joe’s Original Italian + Martini Bar  {Peoria Heights}   //   Joe’s is the place to go if you want Italian food that is plentiful and delicious. They have perfected classic Italian-American cuisine along with having perfected excellent cocktails, appetizers, pastas, and entrees such as Chicken Parmesan, Veal Marsala, or a filet wrapped in bacon and a lot more. Joe’s Original Italian + Martini Bar is a must-go for you and your truelove, Word on the street is that they also make a mean martini!
 
Lariat Steakhouse  {Peoria}   //   As one of the original restaurants in Peoria IL, The Lariat Steakhouse has been serving top-quality steaks and seafood to discerning diners for almost 80 years. Famous for their juicy 1 ½ pound prime rib, hefty 8-ounce hand-cut fresh salmon and mouth-watering lobster tail, among many other specialties to delight your palate. Let Lariat Steakhouse do all the work so you and your loved one can have a magical night out.
 
Mi Ranchito  {Elmwood}   //  Everyone is in need of a go to Mexican Restaurant, Mi Ranchito in Elmwood is perfect for that role. They’ve got a massive menu full of options for everyone and are known for their lightning-fast kitchen. They provide true authentic delicious Mexican cuisine, flavorful margaritas, and you have to top it all off with a tasty dessert! You and your love will have a new go-to after visiting Mi Ranchito. 
 
Odie’s  {Chillicothe}   //  Chillicothe’s Odie’s has a magical energy along with a delectable menu in a quaint, modern industrial atmosphere. Whether you're in the mood for a doughnut or a sandwich, Odie's has you covered. This restaurant will make you fall in love with your significant other all over again.
 
Rhythm Kitchen  {Peoria}   //   Rhythm Kitchen welcomes you with open arms and funky vibes. Everyone needs a hip, fresh riverfront cafe and bar with live music, coffee & a menu of outstanding global eats on their go to date night list. Rhythm Kitchen will quickly work its way into your hearts.
 
Suite Fire Bar + Grille  {Peoria}   //   The Suite Fire Bar + Grille is an upscale casual restaurant and is conveniently located inside the Holiday Inn Suites, Peoria at Grand Prairie. Providing a spacious bar, incredible fresh menu options, outdoor patio with firepits, multiple flat screen TV’s and insanely cozy conversation areas. Suite FIre Bar + Grille will show you and your boo a truly magical night that you will never forget.
 
 
 
STARK COUNTY
Catalpa Grove Tavern {Toulon}   //   If you and your love need an adventure, Catalpa Grove Tavern is the place. It’s off the beaten path but trust me, it's well worth the drive. Well known for its insanely delicious burgers, and delicious breakfast food. Toulan’s Catalpa Grove Tavern is the perfect place if you and your love need a little adventure.
 
The Lounge  {Wyoming}   //   The Lounge in Wyoming may not be the place for a beautiful dinner but it’s PERFECT for a super fun time with drinks, appetizers, and games! Grab your lover or a group of friends and have the time of your life at The Lounge! 
 
 
 
TAZEWELL COUNTY
BC BBQ  {Pekin}   //   BC BBQ in Pekin is some of THE best BBQ around! With all of the classic favorites like flavorful ribs, brisket, and unreal pulled pork. You and your boo must find your way to Pekin to enjoy some BBQ!
 
Bernardi’s Restaurant  {Washington}   //   Your search for an Authentic Italian Restaurant is over, Benardi’s in Washington is the answer. Their tortellini and spaghetti will transport your taste buds to Northern Italy, where their recipes and family first began. WIth something everyone can enjoy, Bernardi's is somewhere you and your love must visit. 
 
Jonah’s Seafood House  {East Peoria}   //   This elevated restaurant is right on the river in East Peoria. Jonah’s Seafood House serves fresh seafood that is flown in daily to meet their high standards for quality. At The 2601 Oyster Bar with its first come first serve rule you will always find a lively crowd, enjoying the casual, yet upscale atmosphere. Jonah’s Seafood House and 2601 Oyster Bar are essential date night experiences. 
 
Pho Noodle House  {East Peoria}   //   From Grandma’s traditional recipes and a whole lot of street food inspiration, comes a whole new experience, Pho Noodle House. Everything is super fresh, and tasty, with plenty of pho and chinese options. East Peoria’s Pho Noodle House will be a new craving you and your love will not be able to resist. 
 
Season’s Gastropub  {Morton}   //   Seasons is an American gastropub with food that is done fresh, utilizing great local seasonal ingredients. Come in for a scrumptious dinner while enjoying a great bar selection of wines, craft beers, and cocktails along with incredible live music. FInd your way to Morton so Season’s can sweep you off your feet.
 
Smokin’ Notes BBQ  {East Peoria}   //   Known to be the best BBQ in East Peoria. With huge portions and killer food such as brisket that reminds people of Memphis and Bbq chicken that falls right off the bone, and absolutely insane ribs. Top notch BBQ like this is rare so make sure you make the visit to Smokin’s Notes BBQ.
 
Tin Lizard  {East Peoria}   //   Tin Lizard should be your go-to spot for a lively yet comfortable atmosphere! They feature a wide range of tasty shambles, craft brews, creative cocktails, and daily delicious specials. Choose the TIn Lizard in East Peoria for a date night, enjoy good eats, good drinks, and the best local and regional bands!
 
Yesterday’s Bar + Grill  {Pekin}   //   Yesterday’s Bar and Grill has been a  staple of downtown Pekin since 1994. This local gem is an incredible after dark spot for people who need a night off. A variety of delicacies ranging from perfectly cooked salmon, Butternut squash risotto, Huge french onion bites. When you and your lover need a wonderful lowkey day night, Yesterday's is perfect. 
 
 
 
WOODFORD COUNTY
Kouri’s Grill and Bar  {Germantown Hills}   //   You will fall in love with Kouri’s Pub for its relaxed, “down home” simplicity with great food and drinks. As soon as you enter Kouri’s Pub, you’ll know this is the place to be. It’s no wonder so many are constantly coming back for more. Also located in Peoria and Pekin (Peoria + Tazewell Counties)
 
Sheets Creek Saloon  {Spring Bay}   //   You can find Sheets Creek Salon off one of the lakes in Spring Bay. Phenomenal Burgers, you don't even wanna ruin with condiments, and fries that are seasoned perfectly. Sheet’s Creek Salon Will show you a night you and your date will not forget!
 
Sicily Pizza  {Washburn}   //   If you are in need of a genuinely delicious slice of pizza Washburn’s very own Sicily Pizza is the perfect place to go. With homemade Italian food, and the experiences they provide you will have lasting memories with the person you love.
 
The Bowling Alley  {Eureka}   //   With a name that stems from their history The Bowling Alley is a super fun experience in Eureka. No operational lanes but they still offer darts, billiards, pinball and golden tee to play while enjoying a scrumptious cocktail. Yummy food and a fun environment will keep you coming back for more.

2021 Fourth of July in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Abby Batson on

					Jun. 24, 2021
				






Central Illinois is booming this summer with a variety of Fourth of July celebrations happening throughout the area. Despite the postponement of this year’s Red White and Boom celebration on the Peoria Riverfront, residents and visitors alike are sure to find fun with these events happening in the surrounding communities. 
Bring your friends and family out to enjoy a day filled with food, music, fireworks and community to celebrate the holiday!
Events Line-up:


Chillicothe’s 4th of July at Three Sisters Park - Celebrate 4th of July in Chillicothe with an afternoon of fun at Three Sisters Park leading up to a huge Fireworks display. Free and open to the public. 


4th of July Honor America Celebration at Memorial Stadium - Pekin’s Independence Day celebration will feature an amazing fireworks display beginning around dusk. You can get tickets at the Pekin Farmers’ Market and tickets will also be available for purchase at the gate of the stadium on July 4. 


Peoria Chiefs Game at Dozer Park - There will be fireworks all weekend long at Dozer Park, following the games Friday through Sunday. Check out the Chiefs’ website to get your tickets. 


Boy’s and Girl’s Club of Peoria Fourth of July Family Fun Fest at Le Vieux Carre Park (across from the State Street Post Office in Peoria) - Le Vieux Carre Park and Water Street from State to Walnut Streets in downtown Peoria become an intimate festival area for the whole family with a possible fireworks display to come!


Morton Community 4th of July Celebration at McClallen Park - The Morton Park District is hosting a free 4th of July celebration at McClallen Park. There will be live entertainment, food, a beer tent and a fireworks show once it gets dark. 


Havana Riverfront 4th of July Celebration - Havana will host its annual 4th of July celebration at the Riverfront Park. Enjoy a day of vendors, live entertainment, the boat parade and more. 


Firecracker 5000 - Join the Peoria Jaycees in their fun, celebrating the holiday by running the firecracker 5k or the 2-mile walk through downtown Peoria!


Eureka Independence Day Parade and Fireworks- Stop by the Eureka Independence Day parade on Saturday morning or the family fun festivities on Sunday at Eureka Park.


Elmwood- Yates City- Farmington Fireworks - Head out to Elmwood evening for a night of fireworks at Sweetwater Park.


Mackinaw Fireworks at Brock Lake- Mackinaw will hold their 2021 Fireworks show at Brock Lake at dusk.


Learn more about these events and other events happening in central Illinois this summer at DiscoverPeoria.com/Events.
Know of any other 4th of July events happening in central Illinois? Send us an email at marketing@peoria.org!

Peoria Outdoor Adventure was created to combine the very best of our LOCAL outdoor clubs, groups, and restaurants that make Greater Peoria an adventurous place. The Greater Peoria Area is loaded with hundreds of miles of trails, thousands of acres of creeks, rivers and parks, and an untapped potential.

The Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau is constantly working to make sure that the Peoria Area is known for being a destination that not only tourist, bus groups, families and couples enjoy but also a known hub for sporting events and a go-to area for meetings and conventions.

Extra! Extra!

3/22/2023 - People of Peoria Podcast President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso was on The People of Peoria Podcast recently! Grab a snack and fun beverage, and give it a listen here. 

11/13/2022 - Round Trip with Colleen Kelly Let's play in Peoria! This week on Round Trip, Colleen and Megan discuss this heartland city, and Colleen recounts her recent college visit with her daughter. Plus, the CEO of Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, J.D. Dalfonso has the best recommendations when visiting Peoria; and the CEO of Wildlife Prairie Park, Roberta English will talk about this amazing place to see wildlife in the area. Hear all about Peoria at the 10:50 mark on the podcast!

4/01/2022 - Meetings Today stopped by to chat with Discover Peoria Vice President of Sales Beth Reusch and President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso about some great places to gather in the Peoria area. They talked all things Louisville Slugger Sports Complex, Peoria Civic Center, and more! Click here to read more about their conversation, and to see which Peoria sports venue you might want to visit next!

Greater Peoria Treasures

By Guest Writer: Tim Alexander on

					Apr. 12, 2023
				






What not to miss when visiting the River City

The Greater Peoria area is home to a plethora of treasures—some hidden and some well-known. From historical sites to outdoor recreational opportunities, eclectic shops to family fun spots, Greater Peoria has something to offer for both longtime residents and visitors who are new to the area. Here’s a small sampling, in no particular order, of what the region has to offer:


 
PEORIA COUNTY
 
Peoria City Hall  {Peoria}   //   Several Peoria ironworks companies and their craftsmen helped construct Peoria’s magnificent and historic City Hall, which was dedicated in 1899 and remains in use today. The building, known for its red sandstone facade and stunning marble interior, is considered a local architectural treasure. Start your visit to Peoria with a tour.
 
Peoria Civic Center  {Peoria}   //   First opened in 1982, the Peoria Civic Center is the premier arena and concert hall in central Illinois, playing host to professional sports events, concerts, theater events and more.
 
Dozer Park  {Peoria}   //   Home to the St. Louis Cardinals high Class A minor league franchise, the Peoria Chiefs  play here each year from April through early September. Check the Discover Peoria Calendar of Events for the game schedule and special promotion nights in a family-first environment. 
 
Contemporary Art Center + Water Street  {Peoria}   //   According to their website, over 15,000 visitors each year are attracted to the Contemporary Art Center on Peoria’s RiverFront. Peoria’s “cultural hub” features the innovative artwork of living artists at the forefront of today’s art scene, in three galleries situated on Peoria’s vibrant Water Street.
 
8-Bit Arcade Bar  {Peoria}   //   Also located on Water Street, the 8-Bit Arcade Bar quickly became the talk of the town with its multitude of craft beers and three rooms of vintage video games that you can play for free. For adults only with the exception of occasional family days. 
 
Gone Axe Throwing  {Peoria}   //   Located in Peoria’s resurgent Waterfront District, Gone Axe Throwing is great for family fun, date night or getting together with friends.  There are a variety of games for players to go “head-to-head” for some competitive fun! 
 
Peoria Riverfront Museum  {Peoria}   //   The Peoria Riverfront Museum, known as the only multidisciplinary museum of its kind in the nation, uses art, science, history and achievement to inspire confidence, lifelong learning, and talent. It features major traveling exhibitions, a permanent collection, interactive galleries, a dome planetarium, giant screen theater and educational programming. 
 
Peoria Zoo  {Peoria}   //   The Peoria Zoo is home to unique animals from all over the world and is open to the public 360 days a year.  The Zoo also offers behind-the-scenes tours and serves as a great venue for birthday parties, weddings, and corporate events.
 
Luthy Botanical Gardens  {Peoria}   //   Conveniently situated adjacent to the Peoria Zoo in Glen Oak Park, Luthy is home to a tropical conservatory, a theme garden and seasonal botanical shows. The sprawling garden is also a beautiful background for weddings, showers and corporate events.
 
Grandview Drive + Park  {Peoria Heights}   //   Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, Grand View Drive is a 2.52 mile meandering pleasure driveway constructed in 1903, according to the Peoria Park District website. The “world’s most beautiful drive,” as President Theodore Roosevelt referred to it in a visit to Peoria in 1910, offers visitors numerous panoramic scenic views of the Illinois River Valley and the chance to view many historic and remarkable homes lining it.
 
Downtown Peoria Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   Cap off your tour of Grandview Drive with a stop in Peoria Heights on Prospect Avenue between Lake Street and Knoxville Avenue, where an eclectic array of family-owned shops and bistros await you. From Heritage Square to Downtown Heights, there is something for everyone.
 
Kartville  {West Peoria}   //   Go-kart enthusiasts can head out to West Peoria for a visit to Kartville, where there are also bumper boats, mini-golf and batting cages for a full afternoon of family fun.
 
Wheels O’ Time Museum  {Dunlap}   //   Open from May to October, the Wheels O' Time Museum campus encompasses five buildings of over 30,000 square feet, filled with treasures from Peoria’s and the nation’s past. Begun as an automobile museum by two Caterpillar, Inc. retirees, the museum has grown to house one of the most diverse collections of nostalgia in the Midwest.  
 
Donovan Park  {Peoria}   //   Formerly a Peoria Park District golf course in the heart of the city, Donovan offers an observatory open to the public, a sculpture garden, fishing in three ponds, several picnic tables and Cyd’s in the Park—a locally owned gourmet restaurant.
 
Wildlife Prairie Park  {Hanna City}   //   Located  10 miles west of Downtown Peoria, Wildlife Prairie Park has been referred to as a jewel in the Midwest. Opened in the 1970s, the park features over 1,800 acres of woodland and prairie inhabited by over 150 animals of 60 different species that are native to Illinois.
 
Jubilee College State Park  {Brimfield}   //   This 3,200-acre facility is located in Peoria County between the towns of Kickapoo and Brimfield. A scenic area with rolling topography and meandering streams, Jubilee offers a variety of outdoor recreation opportunities. It is home to Jubilee College (circa 1839), which was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1972. 
 
Peoria’s Historic West Bluff  {Peoria}   //   Encompassing 365 acres along North and Main Streets, High Wine Street, Moss and Randolph Avenues, Sheridan and University, east of Western Avenue, and parts of adjoining streets, the West Bluff Historic District is one of three Registered Historic Districts in Peoria County. The area flourished in the 1800s when prominent residents of the city built their mansions and stately residences. The area encompasses Bradley University, Bradley Park, the Arbor, Cottage, and Orchard Districts, the Uplands and a few other neighborhoods.




 
OTHER GREATER PEORIA CAN’T-MISS DESTINATIONS INCLUDE—
FULTON COUNTY
Dickson Mounds Museum  {Lewistown}   //   Dickson Mounds, a branch of the Illinois State Museum, is listed on the National Register of Historic Places as one of the most notable on-site archaeological museums in the United States. It offers a unique opportunity to explore the world of the American Indian in an awe-inspiring journey through 12,000 years of human experience in the Illinois River Valley.
 
Emiquon Nature Preserve  {Lewistown}   //   The Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge is a 11,122-acre wetland wildlife refuge located in Waterford Township in Fulton County, Illinois across the Illinois River from the town of Havana. 



 
MARSHALL COUNTY
Marshall State Fish and Wildlife Area  {Lacon}   //   Marshall State Fish and Wildlife Area, located along nearly 10 miles of scenic Illinois River backwaters, bottomlands and bluffs, lies in the heart of the mallard flyway and supports a wide variety of animals, plants and outdoor pursuits.



 
MASON COUNTY
Historic Downtown Havana  {Havana}   //   Located on the banks of the Illinois River between Peoria and Springfield, Havana is known for its rich history, red brick streets and beautiful Riverfront Park. Once known for its cigar manufacturing and notorious nightlife (Al Capone was an occasional visitor), Havana is now well known for its downtown shopping and business district. 
 
Sand Ridge State Forest  {Forest City}   //   A forest in a sea of agricultural fields located just minutes southwest of Peoria, Sand Ridge State Forest, at 7,200 acres, is the largest of Illinois' state forests. The area boasts sweeping expanses of native oak-hickory woodland, extensive pine plantations, sprawling open fields, grasslands and completely unique sand prairies.



 
STARK COUNTY
Rock Island Trail State Park  {Alta to Toulon}   //   The Rock Island Trail State Park is a converted railbed that winds through parts of Stark and Peoria counties. The recreational trail stretches from Alta to Toulon, encountering Dunlap, Princeville, and Wyoming along the way. The linear park offers many natural and architectural attractions in a tree-canopied corridor that is only 50 to 100 feet wide.

Tanner’s Orchard  {Speer}   //   Since 1947, four generations of the Tanner family have provided an amazing country farm experience near the border of northern Peoria and Stark counties. Tanners Orchard has become a family destination with a bakery serving noon lunches, a large country farm market, wagon rides to the orchard with pick-your-own apples and pumpkins, a corn maze and the Back 40 Fun Acres with farm animals. 

 
 
TAZEWELL COUNTY
Par-A-Dice Casino  {East Peoria}   //   With a stay at the 202-room Par-A-Dice Hotel and Casino, you'll be steps from Par-A-Dice Casino. The hotel features fine dining, a full bar, fitness center and other amenities including complimentary wireless Internet access and gift shops/newsstands. Additional amenities at this hotel include wedding services, a ballroom, and a vending machine, along with a computer station, express check-out, and complimentary newspapers in the lobby.

Fort Creve Coeur  {Creve Coeur}   //   Fort Creve Coeur is a historical re-creation of the winter, 1680, quarters of the French explorer LaSalle, who went on from this site to explore the Mississippi River. There are interpretive events featured at the site a couple times a year.



 
WOODFORD COUNTY
Ronald Reagan Museum + Peace Garden  {Eureka}   //   Housed in the Donald B. Cerf Center at Eureka College, the museum collection numbers over 10,000 items from President Reagan's Eureka College student days, his movie and TV career, his governorship of California and two terms as president of the United States. The Reagan Peace Garden located on the historic campus includes a bust of the 40th president and a section of the Berlin Wall.
 
Metamora Courthouse Historic Site  {Metamora}   //   Built in 1845, this building served as the center of county government until the county seat was moved to Eureka in 1896. It is one of the two surviving courthouses on the historic 8th Judicial Circuit traveled by Abraham Lincoln.
 
The Barn III Dinner Theater  {Goodfield}   //   Doubling as an event center, the Barn III offers top-notch dining and entertainment, while also hosting weddings, family and corporate events in a rural setting near Goodfield.

8 Authentic Irish Pubs in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Mar. 02, 2023
				






When it's not St. Patrick's Day, here are some great locations to keep the party going until Irish Fest. Sure, you can get Guinness anywhere, but doesn't it taste better in an Irish Pub? Luckily, here are some of the Peoria Area's locally-owned Irish-themed pubs!
 
 
Carrigan's Pub  {East Peoria}   //    Voted one of the best spots for a tenderloin sandwich, this Irish pub is an amazing spot for classic Irish dishes and midwestern classics.
 
Donnelly’s Irish Pub  {Peoria}   //    This is Peoria's original Irish Pub! Donnelly's has been serving Central Illinois since 1970. You will find Irish fare such as fish and chips, Rueben's, bangers and mash (seasonal), and a giant whole menu of American favorites. Donnelly's has 16 rotating draft beers, fresh cask ale on an English beer engine, over 100 Irish Whiskey's, single malt scotch and bourbons. Donnelly's has an Irish Pub atmosphere the whole family can enjoy.
 
Jimmy's Bar  {West Peoria}   //    This Irish bar in West Peoria is the purveyors of stouts, fine ales, and spirits. This year marks 41 years of St. Patrick's Day celebrations---don't miss the best party of the year.
 
Kelleher’s Irish Pub & Eatery  {Peoria}   //    This Irish Pub is located in the Warehouse District and hosts one of the largest and longest-running St. Patrick's Day celebrations in the area. With delicious Irish Fare and 26 rotating draft beers, this is a great spot year round to be Irish.
 
Kenny’s Westside Pub  {Peoria}   //    Located just steps away from the Peoria Civic Center, Kenny's Westside is a local pub specializing in Irish-inspired foods and their signature tater tots. Locals love it for their lunch specials and cozy pub atmosphere. At night, it's one of the best places in town to check out live music with both touring acts and locals taking the stage throughout the week.
 
Paddy O'Flaherty's  {Morton}   //    Paddy O'Flaherty's is a great little Irish Pub in Morton! Attached to the Comfort Inn + Suites, this pub has been voted best traditional corned beef and cabbage in the area. Sport your green and enjoy this great local hangout!
 
Ulrich’s Rebellion Room  {Peoria}   //    Ulrich’s Rebellion Room is an Irish Pub and Cafe featuring an extensive selection of beer and food. Don't miss the mayhem at this Main Street hub this St. Patrick's Day! 
 
W.E. Sullivan’s Irish Pub and Fare  {Peoria Heights}   //    W.E. Sullivan's prides themselves on providing true Irish Fare for the people of Central Illinois. Expect timeless classics and new twists on traditional Irish dishes. While the menu is Irish at the core, the culinary team brings flare from all corners of the globe.
