Golf Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Mar. 19, 2023
				






Spring is quickly approaching with warm weather and the season of golf. Get into the swing of things with these 26 'tee'-rific golf courses in Greater Peoria, including several hidden gems that are occasionally overlooked given their proximity but are well worth the short drive. Read on to discover where to tee off next.
 
Arrowhead Country Club  {Edelstein}   //   This course offers golf, swimming, fishing, camping, and picnicking on over 200 acres of rolling countryside, lakes and streams. The current 18-hole golf course is accompanied with a two story clubhouse that overlooks the ninth green and the adjoining lakes.

 
 
Bluegrass Creek Golf Course  {Minier}   //   Bluegrass Creek Golf Course is a beautiful 9 hole course in the country. The course has no sand traps, no rough, no Geese, and best of all, NO TEE TIMES. Built from a cow pasture in 1962, Bluegrass Creek traces the natural movement of the land and provides 360 degree views of Tazewell County.
 
Country Club of Peoria  {Peoria Heights}   //   Head out to the Country Club of Peoria in Peoria Heights and experience a traditional private golf experience. This 18-hole course is the area’s oldest course, designed in the early part of the 20th century. It has since been redesigned and evolved to include lush hills, valleys, new bunkers and bent grass fairways. 
 
Coyote Creek Golf Club  {Bartonville}   //   With scenic lakes and creeks, bridges, and waterfalls, you’re sure to soak up some nature and beauty at Coyote Creek Golf Club in Bartonville. This premiere, signature championship course is made up of bent grass fairways, dramatic elevation changes and breathtaking views. Grab some post-game fuel at Coyote Creek Pub and Eatery after playing this unique and challenging course.
 
El Paso Golf Club  {El Paso}   //   El Paso Golf Club is a scenic, well maintained, challenging test of golf from any set of tees. The USGA course rating is 69.6, with a slope of 126. El Paso Golf Club features many elevation changes, 36 sand traps, 1,200 trees, three lakes and a creek running throughout. Water comes into play on 13 holes.
 
Fairlakes Golf Club  {Secor}   //   Fairlakes' course offers a unique layout making this spot a destination for golfers of all skill levels. These beautiful greens are a private course but membership is allows reciprocal play between Indian Springs Golf Course, Bluegrass Creek Golf Course, Indian Creek Golf + Country Club, and Timber Lake Club of Peoria. 
 
Fon du Lac Golf Course  {East Peoria}   //   A 9-hole, par 3 golf course that is challenging for the experienced golfer and also beginner friendly for the novice. Great for a quick round and easy on your pocket book.
 
Hillcrest Golf Center  {Washington}   //   Located near the heart of Washington, Hillcrest Golf Center is a staple to the community. With manicured greens and surprises around every corner, this simple yet beautiful course is great for players of all ages and abilities. 
 
Kaufman Park Golf Course  {Eureka}   //   Enjoy a day that is up to par at Kaufman Park Golf Course in Eureka. This beautiful course is great for players of all skill levels, and gives you the chance to adventure out past Peoria into one of the area’s surrounding cities!
 
Kellogg Golf Course  {Peoria}   //   With bent grass fairways, sand bunkers and a putting green, in Peoria is a 18 hole championship course that is sure to putt you in a good mood!  If you get hungry, stop by their snack shop. You can also visit the pro shop to browse the latest golf gear. 
 
Lick Creek Golf Course  {Pekin}   //   Enjoy some spring sunshine at this course opened in June of 1976 but has since been renovated and reopened in 2007 with new greens, cart paths and bentgrass. Rated 4 stars by Golf Digest, Lick Creek is considered one of the best courses to play at in Central Illinois.
 
Madison Golf Course  {Peoria}   //   Work on your swing at this location features an 18 hole course, practice field, putting green, pro shop and snack shop. This destination is ideal for a carefree, relaxing round!
 
Maple Lane Country Course  {Elmwood}   //   The course at Maple Lane maintains a traditional, walkable feel featuring wide, forgiving fairways and greens situated close to the following tees. Although a private country club, Maple Lane allows guests to enjoy this 9-hole hidden gem.
 
Metamora Fields Golf Club  {Metamora}   //   Looking for another traditional course? Pay a visit to Metamora Fields Golf Club, a 8 hole championship course located just east of Peoria. This course features a blend of holes for all levels of players, with a design believing in the themes of straight forward shots and traditional play. While you’re there, grab a bite to eat at The Fields Restaurant. 

 
Mt. Hawley Country Club  {Peoria}   //   The Mt. Hawley Country Club is a private 18-hole golf course features bentgrass greens, tees, and fairways. Sand bunkering, water features and trees lining Mt. Hawley’s narrow fairways make the course a true test for all skill levels of the game of golf. The course is a pleasant walk and an abundance of wildlife adds to a great experience.
 
Newman Golf Course  {Peoria}   //   Recently renovated and ready for play, 18-hole Newman Golf Course is a favorite of Peoria area golfers. Newman offers 6,497 yards of challenging steep terrain, moderate ravines, deep bunkers and numerous mature trees.
 
Parkview Golf Course  {Pekin}   //   Putt putt and away! This course is 18 holes seven days a week, year-round with twilight fees available. Enjoy this course and its added hills for extra challenge at any time! Season passes are also available to enjoy both Lick Creek and Parkview courses in Pekin.
 
Pekin Country Club  {Pekin}   //   Known for having one of the best courses in Central Illinois, the Pekin Country Club is a pristine 18-hole course with four sets of tees and a state of the art practice facility. The club  includes a full sized swimming pool and clubhouse dining, plus members can discover 11 other courses around the state. 
 
Pine Lakes Golf Club  {Washington}   //   Located just 10 minutes from downtown Peoria, Pine Lakes Golf Club in Washington is an 18 hole public golf course featuring tree-lined fairways. Celebrate post-game by grabbing a drink on the deck of the clubhouse bar, which overlooks the 18th hole. 
 
Quail Meadows Golf Course  {Washington}   //   Get ready to spot some wildlife at Quail Meadows Golf Course. You will surely enjoy your game on this course featuring beautiful scenery, water, and many naturalized areas that are home to a variety of birds and animals. While you’re there, get some extra practice at the golf simulator or driving range.
 
Sunset Hills Golf Course  {Pekin}   //   With expertly manicured greens and lush scenery, Sunset Golf Course is an 18-hole course in an exceptional environment that provides challenge to more experienced players. This location features a disc golf course and Mashie’s Pub & Eatery, a restaurant with tasty American eats and a rotating beer selection. Yum!
 
Timberlake Golf Club  {Peoria}   //   Enjoy this 9 hole course, hidden gem course for players of all skill levels, featuring small and challenging greens and tight undulating fairways. The par 3’s will surely test you, and the par 4’s play on the idea of risk and reward which makes for an exhilarating game!
 
Tall Oaks Country Club  {Toluca}   //   Tall Oaks Country Club is a private golf club offering multiple memberships for individuals, families, and youth golfers. Multiple tees on the 9-hole course provides different views at each hole. The ability to play 18 holes in under 4 hours is a great advantage for those looking for a less time consuming round of golf. 
 
Timber Ridge Golf Club  {Lacon}   //   Whether a member or just passing through, Timber Ridge offers a great round of golf. Non-members are welcome at this beautiful 9-hole private golf course. 
 
WeaverRidge Golf Club  {Peoria}   //   Enjoy views of rolling hills, valleys and beautiful homes. This 18 hole championship public golf course is rated 4.5 stars by Golf Digest and is great for players of all ages and abilities, featuring fast and true greens, elevations and practice facilities.
 
Wee-Ma-Tuk Hills Country Club  {Canton}   //   The 18-hole “Wee-Ma-Tuk Hills” course features 6,486 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 72. The course rating is 72.0, and it has a slope rating of 125. The course features picturesque lakes, waterfalls, and elevated tees making Wee-Ma-Tuk Hills a scenic and playable delight.

Where to Find the Grinch's Roast Beast

By Guest Writer:  Aly Nezgoda-Owdom on

					Nov. 29, 2022
				







The Grinch, with his grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling. How could it be so? The whole family is coming! Their tummies will be grumbling! I’ll have to cook something fresh and becoming! Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn’t before. “Maybe dinner,” he thought, “doesn't come from a chain. Maybe Christmas feast….perhaps….should be locally obtained!”

Spending locally not only supports our friends and neighbors who run the businesses that make our communities unique, but also upholds the quality of life in Greater Peoria. Please follow in the Grinch’s footsteps. Whether your family is carving turkey, ham, or prime rib, check out these local butchers and farms for your holiday roast beast.

 
Alwan + Sons Meat Company  {Peoria}   //     In addition to the vast selection of hams, turkey, prime rib + more, Alwan + Sons provides helpful tips and tricks and recipe cards to make holiday cooking a breeze! 
 
Barn Again Beef  {Princeville}    //   Barn Again Beef has a plethora of roast and steak options, but order now as some cuts have a longer wait time.  Transitioning to Barn Again Meats, bison, pork, chicken, and seafood may also be available
 
Bittners Eureka Meat Locker  {Eureka}   //     Serving up prime rib? Bittner’s Meat Co. offers a prime rib roast, as well as a Chateaubriand roast perfect for your holiday gathering
 
Braker’s Market  {Eureka}   //   Braker’s Market is your one stop shop for all things Christmas dinner. Smoked and spiral ham and turkey will be available for the holidays 
 
Broad Branch Farms  {Chillicothe}    //  Broad Branch Farms offers a large variety of beef cuts, pork, and chicken. Even better, you can order online and get your feast delivered right to your door for no added cost
 
Dixon’s Seafood  {East Peoria}    //    For our Nordic friends, if you’re planning Lutefisk this year, Dixon’s has you covered! Of course Dixon’s Seafood is also the place to go for lobster, shellfish, and fresh or frozen filets for your holiday table
 
Echo Valley Meats  {Bartonville}    //    Naturally smoked, spiral sliced, honey glazed hams will be available to purchase, as well as beef tenderloin, and prime rib
 
Elmwood Meat Products  {Elmwood}   //     Smoked ham, prime rib, and smoked turkey will all be available this holiday season. Call ASAP to place your order 
 
Heritage Farmers Market  {Pekin}    //    Heritage Farmers Market offers all natural beef and pork. Here you can find high quality meat processed by Bittner’s Meat Locker in Eureka
 
Lean Holsteen  {Tremont}    //    This family owned farm offers hormone and steroid free beef. The offer many bundles of steaks and roasts so you can serve it at your holiday gathering and freeze the rest for later
 
Legacy Ranch American Wagyu  {Eureka}    //    Legacy Ranch specializes in Wagyu beef known for its marbling and flavor. They offer roasts and steaks, as well as sausage and snack sticks to add to your spread
 
Little Blue’s Farm  {Morton}   //     Little Blue’s Farm offers turkey, prime rib, beef tenderloin, whole hams and more for your holiday feast
 
Musselman Meats  {Morton}    //   Excess frozen turkeys will be available to purchase. Musselman Meats also offers a great selection of unique beef and pork options you won’t find anywhere else
 
Pottstown Meat + Deli  {Peoria}     //     Amish Country Kitchen’s fresh turkeys are available for the holidays (place orders ASAP). Not serving up turkey? Pottstown also offers bone-in, spiral sliced, and boneless ham
 
Prairie Creek Pastures  {Tremont}    //    Due to a very successful Thanksgiving, Prairie Creek Pastures will be offering turkey pieces, hams, and beef sticks for December holidays
 
Raber Packing Co.  {West Peoria}    //     If ham is on your menu, Raber’s is the place to go! Their cured and smoked hams are a top seller for the holidays. They also have smoked turkeys available. Ordering begins right after Thanksgiving
 
Springer Cattle Co.  {Morton}    //   Let Springer Cattle Co. supply your 100% grass fed beef this holiday season. They have roast and steak packages to accommodate gatherings small and large
 
Wettstein Organic Farm  {Carlock}    //    Whether you have beef, pork, or poultry planned for the holidays, you can rest assured knowing your feast is all natural and top quality

Inspired by The Grinch Who Stole Christmas by Dr. Seuss
The Grinch, with his grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling. How could it be so? It came without ribbons! It came without tags! It came without packages, boxes or bags! Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn’t before. “Maybe Christmas,” he thought, “doesn't come from a store. Maybe Christmas….perhaps….means a little bit more!”
 
And he, he himself...the Grinch...carved the roast-beast!

text:

The Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau is constantly working to make sure that the Peoria Area is known for being a destination that not only tourist, bus groups, families and couples enjoy but also a known hub for sporting events and a go-to area for meetings and conventions.

Extra! Extra!

3/22/2023 - People of Peoria Podcast President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso was on The People of Peoria Podcast recently! Grab a snack and fun beverage, and give it a listen here. 

11/13/2022 - Round Trip with Colleen Kelly Let's play in Peoria! This week on Round Trip, Colleen and Megan discuss this heartland city, and Colleen recounts her recent college visit with her daughter. Plus, the CEO of Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, J.D. Dalfonso has the best recommendations when visiting Peoria; and the CEO of Wildlife Prairie Park, Roberta English will talk about this amazing place to see wildlife in the area. Hear all about Peoria at the 10:50 mark on the podcast!

4/01/2022 - Meetings Today stopped by to chat with Discover Peoria Vice President of Sales Beth Reusch and President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso about some great places to gather in the Peoria area. They talked all things Louisville Slugger Sports Complex, Peoria Civic Center, and more! Click here to read more about their conversation, and to see which Peoria sports venue you might want to visit next!

A Guide to Popcorn in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Feb. 22, 2023
				






If the only popcorn you’ve eaten came from a microwave or behind the concession stand of a movie theater, then it’s time to taste what you’ve been missing. There’s something sentimental about popcorn—and with so many new and unusual flavors on the market, snack time just became more adventurous.
Popcorn has some significance here in the Greater Peoria Area—much more than you may know. In 2012, Mason County was the number one producer of popcorn kernels IN THE NATION!!  And each year, Mason County is consistently the top producer in the state. Which means our local popcorn is the freshest—and best—around. 
 
So, whether you lean towards nostalgic classics or enjoy experimenting with new flavors, check out these locally-owned popcorn shops to find your new favorite midnight nosh.
 
America’s Popcorn Shop  {Morton}   //   America’s Popcorn Shop is a family-owned business using premium ingredients sourced entirely from the United States. The shop offers over 70 flavors of hand-crafted, gourmet popcorn. Be sure to try the Vermont Maple, the Salt and Vinegar, and the Morton Mix (a Pumpkin Capital of the World staple, which mixes Caramel and Pumpkin Popcorn). Oh! And did we mention they're an Illinois Made Maker recipient?!
 
Aunt Em’s Gourmet Popcorn  {Deer Creek}   //   Aunt Em’s specializes in full flavored popcorn products with few if any artificial ingredients. With 7 nationally-recognized flavors, Aunt Em’s Gourmet Popcorn specializes in developing and making store brand products at competitive prices for nationally known retailers.
 
Bluhaven Farm  {Speer}   //   Bluhaven is a family-owned farm famous for producing homegrown gourmet popcorn. Order online for the freshest popcorn popcorn kernels on the market. All orders can be shipped, locally delivered, or pick-up at the farm. 
 
Holland’s Caramel Corn  {Washington}   //   Holland’s Caramel Corn is a family-owned shop located on Historic Washington Square. Specializing in gourmet popcorn, made from scratch daily. Known for their caramel corn, Holland’s is a local treasure. Be sure to try their other one-of-a-kind flavors too. We recommend the Kaleidoscope, Sea Salt Truffle, and the Cinnabun.
 
Pop Of The Morning  {Dahinda}   //   This charming shop is constantly surprising us with unique and delicious mixes and flavors. Pop of the Morning usually makes the market circuit around the region but will ship and make local deliveries. We highly recommend the Jalapeño Nacho, the Lemon Drizzle, and the Theater Popcorn!
 
Poppin In The Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   With new flavors ‘pop’ping-up each week, keep your eye on Poppin In The Heights. This delightful new shop in the Heights is wonderful. We highly recommend the 2-gallon tins filled with classic Caramel, Cheddar, and Butter flavored popcorn—it's the perfect snack for a night of Netflix binging—but we also love the Zebra Pop and the S’mores.
 
She-Pop Gourmet Popcorn  {Peoria}   //   This fun new shop in Peoria specializes in delicious homemade popcorn made fresh and mixed exactly as your wish. Stop in for a great quality product—we recommend the She-Pop Candy and the Nach-yo Taco flavors—they’re poppin!
 
The Popcorn Shoppe  {Peoria}   //   The Popcorn Shoppe is a premier popcorn store popping an array of unique flavors and mixes. We recommend the Rainbow Marshmallow Crunch, the Garlic Parmesan, and the River City Mix. But don’t take our word for it—check out the “try-before-you-buy” wall to find your next favorite snack.
 
The Sweet Shoppe  {Canton}   //   This old-fashioned sweet shop has just about anything you could imagine—including an amazing selection of freshly-popped popcorn. Try the Chicago Style Corn or the classic Caramel Corn. Flavors are always changing, so keep a look out.  
 
Weaver Popcorn Company  {Forest City}   //   Weaver Popcorn Bulk is the largest bulk popcorn producer in the world, selling under its Pop Weaver brand and co-manufacturing distinct varieties of kernels to serve businesses both domestically and internationally. Weaver Popcorn Bulk produces more than one-third of the highest quality kernels right here in Mason County, Illinois.
 
Young’s Popcorn Heaven  {Peoria}   //   For six years in a row, Popcorn Heaven has won The Best of the Best award in the Gourmet Popcorn category from the Peoria Journal Star. The Peoria Area has fallen in love with Popcorn Heaven and their 55+ flavors! Try the Peanut Butter Chocolate, the Cheddar Bliss, which is a medley of savory cheesy flavors, and the Smoky Bar-B-Que!

24 Must-Visit Springtime Activities

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Mar. 14, 2023
				






April showers bring May flowers! As the rain begins to clear and the temperature starts to rise, take advantage of the many adventures and locations to explore during one of Greater Peoria's most beautiful seasons:  springtime.
 
12 Bar Lounge  {Peoria Heights}   //   There’s no shortage of beautiful views at 12 Bar Lounge, located in Peoria Heights. Start off the spring season with a quality and delicious meal, and indoor or outdoor rooftop seating featuring an outdoor fireplace. Enjoy local live music, draft beer and a selection of hand-crafted cocktails.
 
Bushwhacker  {Peoria}   //   Now that the weather is warmer, it’s time to ditch your car and hit the bike trails. Make Bushwhacker, located in the Junction City Shopping Center your go-to destination for any outdoor gear you may need this spring. Stop in and browse their huge selection of bikes, boats and spring footwear and apparel. 
 
Cyd's in the Park  {Peoria}   //   Located in Donovan Park, Cyds in the Park offers outdoor patio dining, making it the ideal spot for an outdoor spring-time meal. Choose from a full lunch and dinner menu and enjoy a casual and relaxing experience. Don’t forget to end your meal with a dessert from their bakery. 
 
Dozer Park  {Peoria}   //   Spring is here, and so is baseball season. Dozer park is home to the Peoria Chiefs, which have a full spring schedule, packed with exciting games running until mid September. Get ready to enjoy all your favorite ballpark snacks and cheer on your favorite team!
 
Eagles Landing Park   {Chillicothe}   //   Have you ever been bird watching? Eagles Landing Park is the perfect springtime destination, featuring a 50-foot tall observation tower that will give visitors the chance to scope out eagles, wildlife and birds along the Illinois River. You never know what animals you might spot!
 
Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge  {Lewistown}    //   Enjoy the spring weather and get some sun at Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge in Havana. This beautiful destination has many bird watching platforms as well as recreational activities including hunting, fishing and hiking. Enjoy the abundant communities of wildlife, fish and plants as well as wetlands, lakes, prairies, forests and bluffs. 
 
Fon du Lac Farm Park  {East Peoria}   //   Fon du Lac Farm Park offers children a unique glimpse of what 1920’s farm life was like on a Central Illinois farm. Enclosed within six acres of Neumann Park,  Farm Park includes a country kitchen museum, playgrounds, a silo slide, gift shop, concession stand, and (of course) an opportunity to meet, pet and feed the animals. Spring is an exciting time to visit the farm—there are always new baby animals to meet.
 
Forest Park Nature Center  {Peoria Heights}   //   Get outdoors this spring by taking a visit to Forest Park Nature Center. Enjoy seven miles of hiking trails, featuring prairie openings and forested woodlands. Guided hiking tours are also available, and you can end your day outdoors by browsing their gift shop.
 
Hoerr Nursery  {Peoria}   //   Looking for a one-stop shop for all things plants and gardening? You have to take a visit to Hoerr Nursery, where you can wander through the beautiful grounds and greenhouses and find the perfect plants for your landscape or home. When you’re done, shop from a selection of gifts and boutique items. 
 
Luthy Botanical Garden  {Peoria}   //   Take a visit to Glen Oak Park and stroll through Luthy Botanical Garden, which features over five acres of gardens and a tropical conservatory. You will be amazed by the beauty of various flowers from around the globe, the display of spring blooming bulbs and the range of vibrant colors. 
 
Mineral Springs Park  {Pekin}   //   Mineral Springs Park should be your next outdoor springtime destination. Whether you decide to relax under the pavilion, or spend your day paddle boating on the lagoon, you’re sure to get some sun and enjoy the spring weather.
 
Oliver’s Main Street Pub  {Toluca}   //   Head out to the charming Downtown Toluca and enjoy a meal at Oliver’s Main Street Pub. This gastropub features fresh, homemade pub food and a selection of craft beers. Plus, you can’t beat their famous pizza, juicy burgers and outdoor seating.
 
Pearce Community Center  {Chillicothe}   //   With the warm weather approaching, now is the perfect time for swimming lessons. Pearce Community Center offers lessons for ages 4 and up, teaching both basic and fundamental swimming skills. Develop your swimming skills and you’ll be ready to hit the pools in no time.
 
Peoria Zoo  {Peoria}   //   Celebrate spring by taking a visit to the Peoria Zoo, where you can spend the day enjoying the spring weather and discover many unique animal exhibits. Visit your favorite animals as you walk through Africa, the Asian Trail, the Tropics Building and the Australia Walk-About. Make sure you don’t miss their daily presentations!
 
Picket Fence Garden Center  {Chillicothe}   //   Nothing screams spring like flowers and gardens! Picket Fence Garden Center has one of the best greenhouses in the area, bursting with color and texture. Select from a huge variety of flowers and plants, and get some spring-time shopping done in their boutique. Packed with gifts and accessories including home decor, jewelry and gourmet foods, you’re sure to find something to love.
 
Quail Meadows Golf Course  {Washington}   //   Springtime brings with it golfing season, and Quail Meadows Golf Course is a great location to visit and get in a round. You will surely enjoy your game on this course featuring beautiful scenery, water, and many naturalized areas that are home to a variety of birds and animals. While you’re there, get some extra practice at the golf simulator or driving range. You might even spot some wildlife.
 
Riverfront Museum  {Peoria}   //   Take a trip to the Peoria Riverfront Museum and discover something new. This Peoria gem is the only multidisciplinary museum of its kind in the nation! The Peoria Riverfront Museum uses art, science, history and achievement to inspire confidence, lifelong learning, and talent.
 
Sculpture Walk  {Peoria}   //   Get outside this spring and discover all of the public art that Downtown Peoria has to offer. The Peoria Sculpture Walk offers the experience of learning about each art piece and its artist as you walk through Downtown Peoria and find the different sculptures placed throughout the area. Get some fresh air and explore our region at the same time.
 
Seasons Gastropub  {Morton}   //   Take a trip to Seasons Gastropub for phenomenal food, great wines, craft beer and live entertainment. Their beautiful indoor seating with open-air garage doors and an outdoor patio ensures you will experience the beauty of the spring season during your meal.
 
Spoon River Junction Winery  {Canton}   //   Visit the tasting room at Spoon River Junction Winery for a unique wine tasting experience! Spoon River Junction creates creative wines for adventurous people that not only taste amazing, but incorporate new and unique blends of flavors. Spend a day tasting all of their sweet and dry wines, shopping from their wine selection and spending time on their new outdoor patio. 
 
Stag Tap  {Havana}   //   Located in the middle of downtown Havana, Stag Tap is a local favorite destination to unwind, grab a drink and have some fun! Known for their beautiful outdoor beer garden, soak up some sun this spring and enjoy the company of others, good food, cold drinks and live music. While you’re there, take advantage of their karaoke, video gaming and pool tables. 
 
Uncle Bob’s Ice Cream  {Eureka}   //   Cool down this spring with fresh, homemade ice cream from Uncle Bob’s Ice Cream. Uncle Bob’s has been serving the area with classic and unique ice cream flavor combinations since 1980. Treat yourself and make the trip next time you’re craving something sweet.
 
Wildlife Prairie Park  {Hanna City}   //   Make Wildlife Prairie Park your go-to destination this spring for outdoor adventuring. Home to 60 different species, all ages will love the beautiful nature views and discovering over 150 animals. With daily programs offered, every visit to Wildlife Prairie Park is full of excitement. 
 
 

  
(left)  Picket Fence in Chillicothe, Illinois    (right)  Mineral Springs Park in Pekin, Illinois

5 Haunted Attractions in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Sep. 05, 2022
				






Leaves changing colors and pumpkin spice mean the arrival of fall and Halloween and the opening of haunted attractions across Greater Peoria. Check out these 5 terrifying haunted attractions in the Greater Peoria Area:
 
Aura Haunted House   {Bartonville}   //   September 30, October 1, 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29, 31, November 4, 5   //   Aura is located in the old Bartonville State Hospital, a psychiatric hospital operated by the State of Illinois from 1902 to 1973. Completed under the direction of Dr. George Zeller as a “cottage system plan” of 63 buildings. This location is truly haunted. 

 
Blood Moon Manor   {Forest City}   //   September 30, October 1, 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29   //   Blood Moon Manor (formerly Fright Night) is an "old school" IN YOUR FACE haunted attraction! This Haunted Attraction is the main fundraiser for Forest City Park Development Committee–all proceeds from Blood Moon Manor go to local community charities.

 
Old State Mine Haunted Trail   {Bartonville}   //   September 30, October 1, 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29   //   The Old State Mine is located in the woods of the Bartonville asylum. This outdoor trail is based around the legend of an old mining village that was overtaken by an evil entity known as Doom.

 
Spider Hill Haunted Attractions at Three Sisters Park   {Chillicothe}   //   October 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29   //   Open every Friday and Saturday in October, Spider Hill Haunted Attractions features a massacre mansion, trail of terror, and zombie invasion are frightening, twisted, and filled with horror!

 
Spook Hollow Haunted House   {Marquette Heights}   //   October 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, 29   //   Open the last three Fridays and Saturdays in October, Spook Hollow is an award-winning haunted house with high-intensity scares!

The Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau is constantly working to make sure that the Peoria Area is known for being a destination that not only tourist, bus groups, families and couples enjoy but also a known hub for sporting events and a go-to area for meetings and conventions.

Extra! Extra!

3/22/2023 - People of Peoria Podcast President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso was on The People of Peoria Podcast recently! Grab a snack and fun beverage, and give it a listen here. 

11/13/2022 - Round Trip with Colleen Kelly Let's play in Peoria! This week on Round Trip, Colleen and Megan discuss this heartland city, and Colleen recounts her recent college visit with her daughter. Plus, the CEO of Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, J.D. Dalfonso has the best recommendations when visiting Peoria; and the CEO of Wildlife Prairie Park, Roberta English will talk about this amazing place to see wildlife in the area. Hear all about Peoria at the 10:50 mark on the podcast!

4/01/2022 - Meetings Today stopped by to chat with Discover Peoria Vice President of Sales Beth Reusch and President and CEO J.D. Dalfonso about some great places to gather in the Peoria area. They talked all things Louisville Slugger Sports Complex, Peoria Civic Center, and more! Click here to read more about their conversation, and to see which Peoria sports venue you might want to visit next!

22 Friday Fish Fry Recommendations

By Discover Peoria on

					Feb. 20, 2023
				






A fish fry is a Midwestern tradition. We may not live near the ocean, but with our rivers and lakes, we Illinoisans are accustomed to having delicious flakey fish. It’s something many people cherish and for others—especially those who partake in Lent—it is a Friday staple.
Looking to catch a classic Midwest Friday fish fry? Here are some spots in Greater Peoria to consider:

 
American Legion Post 100  {Washington}   //   LENTEN SEASON ONLY.  Serving a classic midwestern fish fry every Friday evening in Lent from 5:30-8pm at the American Legion Post #100
 
Brasky’s Bar + Grill  {Peoria}   //   Hand coated, flakey catfish filets, grilled honey bourbon salmon, large succulent red Argentinian shrimp, and apricot-glazed mahi mahi are served regularly.
 
Brickhouse BBQ, Burgers + Brews  {Washington}   //   Served year round, the Brickhouse cooks up award-winning grilled or fried catfish filets and hand breaded catfish po’boys. 
 
Burger Barge  {East Peoria}   //    Big Fish Baskets are served every Friday throughout the year. This local favorite flakey white fish is served with fries, hush puppies, and coleslaw.
 
Busy Corner Restaurant  {Goodfield}   //   Serving walleye and shrimp dinners regularly every Friday throughout the year.
 
Castaways  {Chillicothe}   //   Castaways serves all you can eat (AYCE) walleye dinners and shrimp baskets every Friday during lent. This classic fish fry comes with rye bread, fries or a baked potato and a trip to their famous salad bar.
 
Donnelly’s Irish Pub  {Peoria}   //   This Irish pub serves hand battered cod filets and house made fries every day throughout the year but during lent you can also order battered whole catfish and walleye, blackened tilapia sandwiches, shrimp po boys, and fried shrimp dinners.
 
Fox Pub  {Peoria}   //   Fox Pub regularly serves British-style fish and chips. With a little malt vinegar, this local favorite transports your tastebuds to a cozy London tavern.
 
East Port Galley Restaurant + Pub  {East Peoria}   //  Anchor down for some great seafood options. East Port Galley serves walleye sandwiches, whole catfish, catfish and walleye filets, and jumbo shrimp regularly. 
 
Gil's Supper Club  {Hanna City}  // Ahoy! Gil's Catfish Sandwich is a golden fried fillet served fresh from the sea. Their Alaskan Walleye is crunchy and flakey, and succulent jumbo shrimp will send you reeling.
 
Grecian Gardens  {Chillicothe}   //   This favorite gem serves breaded and whole channel catfish, jumbo fried shrimp, Alaskan walleye, broiled or breaded cod, perch filets, orange roughy, fried smelt, and frog legs (which, fun fact, are considered seafood and allowed during meatless fasts.)
 
Kelleher’s Irish Pub  {Peoria}   //   You can get Irish fish and chips year-round at Kelleher’s but they’re serving a little something extra during the Lenten season. On Ash Wednesday and every Friday through the season, order from their special fish fry menu!
 
Kemp 208  {Morton}   //   For an elevated fish experience, Kemp 208 regularly serves poblano and cilantro drizzled scallops, orange maple glazed salmon, BBQ crab cake sandwiches, and pan seared rainbow trout.
 
Kenny’s Westside Pub  {Peoria}   //   Traditional Irish fish and chips are available 7 days a week throughout the year at Kenny’s. Hand dipped in beer batter, these crispy cod filets are served with tartar sauce, cole slaw, and your choice of fries or tots.
 
Kickapoo Sportsman’s Club  {Brimfield}   //   LENTEN SEASON ONLY.  Serving a classic midwestern fish fry every Friday evening in Lent from 4:30-7pm at the Kickapoo Sportsman’s Club.
 
Maquet’s Rail House {Pekin}   //   The Rail house serves fish and chips regularly throughout the year. Their hand breaded cod filets are served golden brown with fries and marbled rye bread.
 
Midway Duck Inn  {Low Point}   //   LENTEN SEASON ONLY.  Serving AYCE (all you can eat) fish fry every Friday evening throughout Lent.
 
Morton Knights of Columbus Hall  {Morton}   //   LENTEN SEASON ONLY.  The Morton Knights of Columbas are serving a classic midwestern fish fry every Friday evening in Lent from 5:30-8pm.
 
Peacocks Pub  {Bartonville}  //  Walleye dinners are back on Friday nights! They also have jumbo shrimp, or you can go all out with a seafood platter. 
 
Po-Boy’s on Frostwood  {Peoria}   //   This is not your typical midwestern fish fry. Po-Boy’s regularly serves up New Orleans style catfish and shrimp dinners. Their menu is filled with flavorful seafood options to enjoy.
 
The Publik House  {Peoria Heights}   //   Fish and chips is a Publik House classic. Served regularly, this old world-style alehouse is a great spot for crispy flaky fish and hand cut fries.
 
The Rail Splitter  {Mossville}   //   Serving fish sandwiches during lunch and catfish + walleye dinners after 3pm every Friday throughout the year.
 
TnT’s Sports Bar + Grill  {East Peoria}   //   This local-favorite quintessential midwestern fish fry is served with a potato, cole slaw, and a dinner roll every Friday throughout the year.
 
Ulrich’s Rebellion Room  {Peoria}   //   Ulrich’s regularly serves Irish-style fish n’ chips. With housemade potato crisps and coleslaw, this local favorite dish will teleport you to a drizzly Dublin pub.

Know Before You Go:  Morton Pumpkin Festival

By Guest Writer: Alissa Williams on

					Sep. 08, 2022
				






 TIP #1    //    Come Hungry. The Morton Pumpkin Festival operates two food tents, and the carnival midway offers more options for snacks and dinner. At the Festival Grill tent you can enjoy pork chop sandwiches, brats, hot dogs, pumpkin chili, pumpkin pasta salad as well as our Wing Wednesday special. This year there will be a limited quantity of baked potatoes each night. To satisfy your sweet tooth visit the Festival Sweet Shop for pumpkin ice cream, pumpkin pie and pumpkin chocolate chip cookies, pumpkin doughnuts and other sweet pumpkin treats.
 
 TIP #2    //    Wear Your Walking Shoes. The Festival covers a lot of ground and the Art and Craft Market is now a mere quarter mile away from the grounds at Birchwood Park. Follow the walking path through the neighborhood off Main St. to reach the Art and Craft Market.
 
 TIP #3    //   Get Carnival Tickets. You can buy carnival tickets in advance for use on Wednesday and Thursday at local Morton businesses. There’s also Wristbands available on Friday afternoon where you can ride as many rides as you like between 2:30 and 5:30 pm.  There are also free fun family activities at the Family Fun Patch, located at Church Square (across from the School at 225 E. Jefferson St). 
 
TIP #4    //   Visit the Entertainment Stage. Each weekday night enjoy free, live music at 7:30 pm on the Gold’s Gym Entertainment Stage. On Saturday afternoon watch the pumpkin pie eating contest at 3 pm and local dance and theater performances the rest of the afternoon, ending with the lip sync contest at 7 pm. 

TIP #5    //   Set your alarm for Saturday morning. Pumpkin Pancakes start coming off the grill at 6:30 am. Enjoy breakfast and then walk through the Art and Craft Market that opens at 8 am before finding the perfect spot along Jefferson Street to view the Pumpkin Festival Parade that kicks off at 10:30 am from Jefferson and Nebraska. Don’t forget to bring a bag to collect candy and toys, handed out by many of the parade entries, and wear orange to the parade to show your pumpkin spirit!

Photo References: Morton Pumpkin Festival

Learn Something New in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Aug. 26, 2022
				






When was the last time you did something for the first time? Greater Peoria is packed with tours, classes, historical sites, and experiences that foster exploration and growth. Read on to learn, try, and discover something new:
 
The Cookery Inc.  {Morton}   //   Looking to deepen your skills in the kitchen? The Cookery Inc. in Morton takes pride in sharing restaurant and culinary knowledge with the Peoria area. Channel your inner chef and participate in a fun, unique, and technique driven cooking class. The class options range with different themes from baking something sweet to cooking something savory or learning how to make ethnic and cultural dishes. They have events for all ages and skill levels including date night and family events, with their most popular class being their knife skills class that is open to all ages. While you’re there, you have to try out their single serve gourmet to-go meals, they’re delicious! 
 
Princeville Heritage Museum  {Princeville}   //   Calling all history lovers! You won’t regret taking a trip to Princeville Heritage Museum, where you can observe and learn about artifacts related to the history of Princeville and surrounding communities. Take a step back in time and tour many different displays including antique agricultural equipment, genealogy research and steam-powered tractors. The museum also features the Akron Townhouse School, which gives visitors the opportunity to see what it was like to learn in a one-room schoolhouse.
 
The Golf Learning Center  {Peoria}   //   Not only is Peoria home to a diverse selection of golf courses, but Peoria Park District’s Golf Learning Center presents the perfect opportunity for experienced golfers and beginners to broaden their golf skills. They offer lessons for golfers of all ages and skill sets. With many different practice areas and very friendly staff, their facilities have everything you need to build your game. Take advantage of their indoor putting and heated hitting stations, all-season driving range and par 3 pitch-and-putt course. You’ll be a golf star before you know it!
 
Bicycle Safety Town {Peoria}   //   Most kids look forward to the day they will be able to get behind the wheel and out onto the road. Thanks to the Peoria Park District, they don’t need to wait to make this dream a reality! With nearly 4,000 feet of one-way streets, curves and traffic signals, Bicycle Safety Town allows kids to hit the road and practice “driving” on their bicycles. Kids can grab their helmets,  and get ready to learn the roads while responding to 70 various traffic signs. 
 

 
Sky Blue Stables {East Peoria}  //   It’s never too late to become an equestrian! With Sky Blue Stables located in East Peoria, you don’t have to travel far to strengthen your horse riding skills. Sky Blue Stables offers riding lessons for all ages from amazing teachers that motivate their students while making them feel comfortable and relaxed, encouraging hard work and doing things correctly. Stop horsing around! Saddle up and get ready to master the art of horseback riding. 
 
Peddlers Way Quilt Co.  {Washington}   //   There’s plenty to learn and discover on the Historic Washington Square, and Peddlers Way Quilt Co. is a great place to start. Offering a variety of classes and events including open sew, machine applique classes, quilting classes and more, there’s plenty of opportunities to learn a new skill. Browse their selection of quilting fabrics, sewing machines, embroidery supplies and more. Plus, Peddlers Way Quilt Co. is a certified Judy Niemeyer shop, so you can shop from patterns that you won’t see at normal shops. You will have sew much fun!

 
Chillicothe Public Library {Chillicothe}   //   What better place to learn than the library? From snack recipes, to scrapbooking, to computer skills, there’s so much to discover at Chillicothe Public Library. Their calendar of events is packed with opportunities to gain and develop new skills. We recommend you start with their monthly “Curiosity & Cheesecake” event, a great way to explore stories about our world, creatures, science and history while enjoying Triple Dipple’s delicious cheesecake. 

 
Five Points Washington {Washington}   //   I think we can all agree that Illinois summers are very hot, which makes swimming an important skill to have in the Peoria region. Luckily, Five Points Washington offers private swimming lessons where children ages 2  and older can grow their swimming abilities and work towards becoming confident swimmers. Their wonderful team of trained instructors ensures a positive experience and the development of strong swimming skills, so grab some sunblock and a towel!
 
Peoria Historical Society Tours {Peoria}   //   Did you know that Peoria was once the Whiskey Capital of the World? The greater Peoria area is packed with history and stories that have led it to become the region we know and love today. The Peoria Historical Society provides the opportunity to learn about the region with their summer and fall walking and bus tours. Walking tours include destinations filled with adventures, such as Moss Avenue and Grandview Drive. With many options for themed bus tours, you’re sure to find a topic that sparks your interest. Discover Peoria’s most notorious crime, the Bernie Shelton murder, or explore the darker side of the city with the Haunted Peoria tour. Don’t want to leave your home? Check out the Springdale Cemetery virtual tour. 
 
Generations Candle Co {Peoria Heights}   //   Experience crafting like never before and find your own signature scent at Generations Candle Company located in Peoria Heights. Personalize your own hand-poured candle or another fragranced product from start to finish by creating a unique blend of fragrances from 90 choices, choosing a vessel that matches your style and designing a label for the end product. Generations Candle Co is more than just a candle shop, and encourages you to grab your loved ones and create lasting memories. If you work up an appetite from all that candle pouring, visit one of the charming restaurants located along Prospect road in Peoria Heights. Generations Candle Co will deliver your fresh candle to you when it’s ready!
 
With plenty of opportunities to learn and discover in the Greater Peoria Area, we challenge you to try something new.
 

Photo Reference: Generations Candle Company

The Secret Food Scene of East Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Feb. 19, 2023
				






East Peoria may not be perceived as Greater Peoria’s culinary focal point, but there are some real gems on the eastern banks of the Illinois River, miles from Downtown Peoria. Tucked away in these quiet neighborhoods are some of our most prized entities unfamiliar to business travelers, tourists, and even regional residents. 
 
These are the hidden local stops—the small family-owned treasures with delicious foods well worth seeking out. Keep reading for some surprisingly impressive eats in East Peoria, Illinois.

 
French Dip Sandwich at 5th Quarter Bar + Grill  {East Peoria}   //   Add sweet or hot peppers to the mountain of shaved angus beef, gooey cheese and sauteed onions and this sandwich will be your new favorite! Be prepared to ask for a stack of napkins because this beast is served with a cup of steaming homemade au jus that will force you to roll up your sleeves when you dive in.
 
Big Fish Boat at Burger Barge  {East Peoria}   //   The Big Fish Boat is a satisfying collation of flavors that really hit the spot. This tender, flakey Alaskan white fish is dipped in a handcrafted beer batter, and deep-fried to crispy, golden brown perfection. Even though the filet is deep-fried, the fish is light and crusty with delicate seasonings and won’t leave you feeling bloated or greasy. It’s a great piece of fish that’s beautifully seasoned and cooked.
 
Tenderloin Sandwich at Carrigan’s Pub  {East Peoria}   //   This beast-of-a-sandwich is served with an impressive slab of thick-cut pork, lightly breaded, and flash fried to ensure a tender and juicy center and a perfectly golden crispy exterior.  We gotta say, the Peoria Area is packed with impressive tenderloin sandwiches but Carrigans’ ranks amongst the best.
 
Charbroiled Steak Sandwich at Country Saloon  {East Peoria}   //   Warning:  this meal is so good you will crave it in the middle of the night. Country Saloon hand cuts a beautiful marbled ribeye and seasons it with a secret rub to enhance its natural flavors. It’s then seared until slightly charred, grilled to order, and presented on a toasted baguette piled high with sauteed onions and thinly sliced mushrooms. It’s a work of culinary art.
 
Smoked Salmon Benedict at Eggcellent Cafe  {East Peoria}   //   This heavenly smoked salmon benedict uses buttery, toasty English Muffins to float salty smoked salmon, creamy avocado, roasted tomatoes, and perfectly poached eggs all topped off with a smooth and zesty homemade Hollandaise sauce. Eggcellent Cafe has perfected this succulent dish by combining intense flavors and silky textures—it’s truly a brunch game changer.
 
Stop, Drop, and Rollies at Firehouse Pizza  {East Peoria}   //   We love Firehouse’s made-daily-from-scratch dough and famous sweet sauce, but have you tried the Stop Drop, and Rollies?! Imagine a pinwheel of hand-tossed crust filled with juicy honey-barbecue chicken, gooey mozzarella cheese, and tangy red peppadews served steaming hot, golden brown, and utterly delicious.
 
Seven Layer Salad at Jonah’s Seafood House  {East Peoria}   //   Why are we raving about a salad?? Because these seven layers are a healthy hearty dish that doesn't taste like rabbit food. Jonah’s seven layer salad is an exception. It’s hearty. It’s flavorful. It’s wholesome. It’s fresh spring greens topped with cauliflower, bell peppers, peas, sweet onion, freshly shredded cheese, crispy bacon and is tossed in a secret homemade sweet and tangy dressing that will shock and delight. It’s famous for a reason and it’s available in the marketplace if you need a quick fix. 
 
Crab Rangoon at Pho Noodle House  {East Peoria}   //   These pinched pockets of wonton are packed with a savory combination of rich warm cream cheese, real crab meat, and seasoned with green onions. Each pocket is deep fried to golden deliciousness and served with a homemade sweet chili pineapple dipping sauce. Pho Noodle House makes each delicate triangle from scratch, by hand daily and it shows in the stunning quality and rich flavors of this appetizer!
 
Silver Bullet Burger at Silver Bullet  {East Peoria}   //   While the menu at Silver Bullet may be considered "bar food" the quality is first-rate. There’s something to be said about a classic, deliciously simple, uncomplicated cheeseburger and Silver Bullet has mastered it with their Silver Bullet Burger. It’s not fancy but it’s perfectly crafted with melted cheese atop a juicy beef patty, crispy bacon, lettuce, pickles, thinly sliced tomatoes and onions on a Brioche bun.
 
Quesabirria Tacos at Tacos El Gallo  {East Peoria}   //   Get ready for a flavor fiesta with these quesabirria tacos! This dish is a cross between a taco and a quesadilla with made-from-scratch corn tortillas packed with melted chihuahua cheese, slow-roasted birria beef, topped with fresh onions and cilantro. Served with lime wedges and a piping-hot cup of broth—known as consomé—for dunking each flavorful masterpiece. This is another delightfully messy dish, so grab a stack of napkins, roll up your sleeves, and dig in!
 
Giant Pretzel at Tin Lizard Bar + Grill  {East Peoria}   //   Four words: ale house cheese fondue. Yes, the massive pretzel itself is amazing—it’s a perfect balance of crusty and chewy, warm, fragrant, and coated in coarse salt. But if we’re being honest, this giant pretzel is merely a German vehicle for the aromatic, zesty stone ground mustard and the delectably luscious cheese fondue. Regardless of the reasoning, the Tin Lizard’s giant pretzel is comfort food at its finest!

Friday Fish Fry at TnT’s Sports Bar + Grill  {East Peoria}   //   These delicate filets are lightly tossed in TnT’s homemade breading and fried to golden perfection. It’s a midwestern quintessential fish fry served with a potato, cole slaw, and a dinner roll. Be prepared, even though TnT’s is tucked away at the edge of East Peoria and Morton, this gem draws a big crowd eager for their Friday night catfish and walleye dinners.

How Morton Crowned Itself Pumpkin Capital of the World

By Guest Writer: Alissa Williams on

					Sep. 08, 2022
				






Morton claims its title as Pumpkin Capital of the World because 90% of the world’s canned pumpkin is processed in the village at the Libby’s canning factory. Opened in 1925, the factory has been exclusively processing pumpkins since 1970. It’s only natural the community should celebrate this claim to fame and for the past 56 years, Morton has held a Fall Festival to honor its pumpkin heritage.
 
In 1978, Illinois Governor James Thompson officially declared Morton “The Pumpkin Capital of the World.” In 1987 the Festival was mentioned on ABC's Good Morning America. The Food Network featured the Festival on March 9, 2003 in "All American Festivals: Morton Pumpkin Festival."
 
The Libby’s plant was built in 1925 by Dickinson Canning Company to process corn, peas, and string beans, and in 1929 the canneries in Morton, Washington and Eureka merged their business with Libby’s. In 1959, the plant stopped packing peas and in 1973 the plant stopped canning sweet corn. By 1970, the Eureka pumpkin plant had closed and operations for canning pumpkins were moved to Morton. Later Libby’s was sold to Nestle. As part of the second Festival in 1968 Libby’s allowed continuous tours of their processing plant during the Festival. The plant tours continued until the 2000s when events made the tours no longer possible.
Festivals had been held in Morton off and on since the 1920s but had been dormant for four years when Bob Humphrey, an area businessman, and the Morton Chamber of Commerce decided to plan a Festival in 1967. Originally planned to be in the downtown area – the Festival grew too large and was moved to W. Jefferson street and “in the general vicinity of the Tuloma offices,” according to an article in the Tazewell County News. “All the downtown parking lots are filled by the displays, exhibits, and carnival rides we have coming in,” said Festival Chairman Bob Humphreys.  In subsequent years it was held in an open area on David Street (site of the current Knights of Columbus Hall, Potter’s Alley and Morton Post Office), and then it moved to its present location on and around the Jefferson School grounds in 1970. The first Festival had eighteen different events, beginning with the Queen selection. Despite four days of rain and not making any money, the Tazewell County News declared this first Festival a “satisfying accomplishment.” The Festival Chairman estimated there were 12,000 people on the grounds during the four days and four nights and more than 7,000 free pumpkin pies were distributed. 
The second Festival featured twice as many carnival rides as the first and made a $500 profit. The people of Morton got a “one night” jump on other residents when the carnival opened on Thursday night solely for the benefit of Mortonites. Following the second Festival a 10 person Board of Festival Directors was created. And the Festival has grown since these early days into a four day event, featuring over 30 events and activities and 2,000 volunteers. Throughout the years, the Morton Chamber of Commerce has given more than $600,000 from proceeds of the Pumpkin Festival to local non-profit organizations and in support of community projects. 

 
The Morton community looks forward to welcoming everyone to “Pumpkins Go 80s” September 14-17, 2022. 

Photo References: Morton Pumpkin Festival

11 Wild Adventures in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Jul. 13, 2022
				






It’s time to discover where the wild things are! Our region is packed with opportunities to explore wildlife and nature. Discover the incredible animals and wildlife that represent our area and prepare yourself to adopt the pace of nature. Breathe in the wild air at any of the locations below, time spent among trees and animals is never wasted!
 
1. Peoria Zoo   {Peoria}   //  Stop monkeying around and go on a safari at the Peoria Zoo! Visit all of your favorite animals as you walk through Africa and discover the Asian Trail. Stop into the Tropics building to see snakes, geckos, spiders and bats. Walk through the Australia Walk-About and come eye to eye with emu and wallabies. Feed the budgies, and hang out with donkeys and goats at the contact barn. The Peoria Zoo is more than just viewing animals, take advantage of their many opportunities for learning and interaction through camps, classes, tours and programs. This destination is the perfect balance of sun and shade, and relaxation and learning. It’s easy to spend the day exploring, don’t miss the daily presentations and stop into the Safari Gift Shop on your way out to shop for eco-friendly products. Who knew there’s so much to do at the zoo.
 
2. Eagles Landing Observation Tower   {Chillicothe}   //   Sometimes a change in scenery can help everything. Take a walk on the wild side at Cutright Park. With a 50-foot-tall observation tower,  you can easily spot different animals along the Illinois River. A staircase and two telescopes allow visitors the perfect view of wildlife. Relax in nature as you spot different wildlife with a birds-eye view. Who wouldn’t want to see majestic creatures close up!? You won’t want to miss this river view! You won’t want to miss this river view, and with wildlife and birds at every corner, you can explore the park as well. You’ll have so much fun it should be ill-eagle. 
 

3. Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge   {Havana}   //  Wander where the wifi is weak at Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge, one of the largest floodplain restoration projects in the Midwest. Explore 11,122 acres of wetlands, lakes, forests, bluffs and prairies. This land represents the abundant natural resources that have supported over 600 generations of civilization and feature many diverse communities of plants and animals. With boardwalks, canoe launches and hiking trails, there’s so much to do and explore. Seek adventure by fishing, bird-watching or boating. Who knows what species you will discover as you spend time on this beautiful land.


4. Sankoty Lakes   {Spring Bay}   //  You will feel wild and free at Sankoty Lakes, home to some of the clearest and cleanest water found on our planet. This Spring Bay destination is situated on the incredible waters of the Sankoty Aquifer and offers our region the opportunity to experience a world-class wilderness retreat. With a balance of recreation, education and relaxation, Sankoty Lakes has something for everyone. Try out midwestern fly fishing, go bird-watching or enjoy the beautiful beachfront and lakeside views. Extend your adventuring by camping in their RV park, cabins or tents, and end your day with farm-to-table dining. This especially unique location allows you to enjoy the beauty of the Central Illinois River Valley. Make some memories one campsite at a time. 
 
5. Banner Marsh State Fish and Wildlife Area   {Canton}   //  Breathe in the wild air at Banner Marsh State Fish and Wildlife Area, which covers 4,363 acres of land. Located just 25 miles southwest of Peoria on U.S. Route 24, Banner Marsh State Fish and Wildlife Area is a beautiful destination for peaceful nature, clear water and plenty of birds and wildlife. Park activities include boating, fishing, hunting, dog training and wildlife observation, but this destination is especially known for fishing. No matter if you prefer boat or bank fishing, there’s plenty of water for fishing at this location and numerous species of fish including walleye, sunfish and northern carp. Adventure more and worry less!
 
6. Rocky Glen   {Peoria}   //  Who can say no to hiking, beautiful views and the chance to spot wildlife? Rocky Glen Park offers steep hills and views of streams and the forest. This local treasure is filled with scenery and packed with history. It was once a coal-mining destination and now features an abandoned mine as well as many rock features. If you’re new to hiking and don’t want to get lost when you hit the trails, Rocky Glen also offers free guided hiking tours for those who prefer some extra guidance when navigating through nature.  As you adventure along the trails, see what wildlife you discover! Pro tip: Visit this destination after a small rainstorm and you might catch some waterfalls!
 
7. Forest Park Nature Center   {Peoria Heights}   //   If you love nature, you will especially find beauty at Forest Park Nature Center. With seven miles of hiking trails featuring woodlands and prairie openings, you’re sure to spot some wild deer and turkey. Life is better in hiking boots! Adventure through nature and see what you discover. We recommend you take the trail that leads up to Grandview Drive, known as the world's most beautiful drive and a favorite destination among locals for a stunning scenic view of the Illinois river. If you didn’t see enough wildlife during your hike, check out their bird observation museum or the natural history museum, and end your visit with some shopping in the Trailhead Nature Store.  
 

8. Wildlife Prairie Park   {Hanna City}   //   You will feel wild and free exploring the 60 different species and 150 animals at Wildlife Prairie Park. Listed as a top 10 destination to visit in Illinois, Wildlife Prairie Park is known not only for being a hidden gem in our area, but also as a great destination for family fun. Different daily program offerings ensure that every visit to Wildlife Prairie Park is unique and holds its own excitement. Discover wolves, bison, waterfowl, black bears, stunning natural landscapes and more. With animal trails, fishing, educational programs and lodging, there’s plenty of opportunity for recreation at Wildlife Prairie Park as well. Always say yes to adventure! 
 
9. Blue Ridge Community Farm   {Chillicothe}   //  Blue Ridge Community Farm is a 245-acre working farm for adults and children with special needs. They currently offer field trips for special education as well as life skills classes. Home to alpacas, donkeys, chickens and a horse, Blue Ridge Community Farm is a non-profit organization and also offers other social events for adults with special needs such as square dancing, cookouts, campfire sing-alongs and outdoor fall concerts. Not to mention, the farm also has beautiful scenic nature views. Sometimes all you need is a day among the animals. 
 
10. Rock Island Trail State Park   {Alta to Toulon through Greater Peoria}   //   Escape the city traffic and experience the natural and architectural attractions of Rock Island Trail State Park, a 26-mile-long trail that stretches from Alta to Toulon, passing through Peoria and its surrounding areas. The trail earned its name because it runs along the old train lines of the Rock Island Railroad Company trains that once ran passengers through our region. As you follow the trail, see what wildlife you come across! Tall prairie grasses and wildflowers allow visitors to experience what Illinois was like to its early settlers. Take a break and adventure through undisrupted nature, taking part in activities such as camping, hiking and skiing. This destination is especially popular for mountain biking, so get ready to shift your gears!
 
11. Sandridge State Forest   {Forest City}   //  Never Stop exploring at Sand Ridge State Forest. This destination is the largest of Illinois’ state forests with over 7000 acres of land. Experience native oak-hickory woodland, pine plantations, open fields, unique sand prairies and grasslands. The amount of unspoiled nature offers a truly unique opportunity for adventuring and exploring wildlife. We have nothing to lose and a world to see! Enjoy recreational activities like archery, camping, mountain biking, snowmobile trails, skiing, geocaching and equestrian trails. Wonder. Wander. Repeat! 
 
When nature calls, you have to answer! There are plenty of destinations to experience wildlife in Greater Peoria. Get out into the beauty of nature and see what wildlife you discover…adventure awaits you.

Sand Ridge State Forest Photo Reference: Peoria Outdoor Adventure

Greater Peoria Easter Egg Hunts

By Guest Writer: Annalee Anderson on

					Mar. 21, 2023
				






We've rounded up the top Easter Egg Hunts in the Greater Peoria Area for Spring 2023, so grab your baskets and 'hop' to these ‘egg’citing springtime celebrations. 
 
For more springtime excitement in Greater Peoria, visit the Calendar of Events.
 
 
FULTON COUNTY
CANTON     //     Wallace Park     //     Saturday, April 8    //     10:00am   
 
FARMINGTON     //     Farmington Moose Lodge     //     Saturday, April 8    //     10:00am   

 
MARSHALL COUNTY
LACON      //     Timber Ridge Golf Club     //     Saturday, April 8    //     10:30am - 2:30pm 
 
 
PEORIA COUNTY
BELLEVUE      //     Villas of Hollybrook     //     Saturday, April 1    //     2:00pm
 
BRIMFIELD      //     Brimfield Evangelical Free Church    //     Saturday, April 1    //     10:00am - 2:00pm
 
CHILLICOTHE      //    Shore Acres Park     //     Sunday, April 2    //     8:00am
 
DUNLAP      //     Cedar Hills Baptist Church     //     Saturday, April 8    //     11:00am
 
HANNA CITY     //     Wildlife Prairie Park     //     Sunday, April 9    //     12:30p (0-3yo), 12:50p (4-7yo), 1:10p (8-12 yo)
 
PEORIA      //     401 SW Water St     //     Saturday, April 1    //     11:00am - 2:00pm
         //     Proctor Recreation Center    //     Friday, April 7    //     1:00pm - 3:00pm
         //     Peoria Public Library Lincoln Branch     //     Saturday, April 8    //     2:30pm - 3:30pm
 
PEORIA HEIGHTS       //     Peoria Heights Congregational Church     //     Saturday, April 8    //     10:00am 
 
 
TAZEWELL COUNTY
EAST PEORIA      //     RockChurch    //     Saturday, April 1    //     10:00am - 11:30am
           //     The Encounter-East Peoria     //     Saturday, April 8    //     10:00am
 
MORTON      //     Morton Dog Park     //     Sunday, April 2    //     10:00am - 2:00pm
 
PEKIN      //     New Pointe Church    //     Saturday, April 8    //     1:00pm
 
WASHINGTON      //    Rotary Shelter in Washington Park     //     Saturday, April 8    //     11:00am
             //     American Legion Post 100     //     Friday, March 31    //     6:30pm (ADULT)

 
WOODFORD COUNTY
METAMORA      //     Black Partridge Park     //     Sunday, April 2    //     2:00pm

Meet Me in the Whiskey City

By Guest Writer: Connect Travel on

					Jul. 14, 2022
				






If you are looking to give your team or event—or both, for that matter—a shot in the arm, head to the Whiskey City. Peoria, Illinois, has the location, amenities and service to create an experience that will leave attendees motivated to accomplish whatever goals are set before them.
 
This Midwestern destination is in the middle of everything. Indianapolis, Chicago and St. Louis are among the metropolises within driving distance. One major advantage of the proximity of those nearby major cities is the affordability Peoria provides—without sacrificing on meeting facilities, dining, retail and genuine hospitality. 
 
With 11 direct airplane routes into General Wayne A. Downing Peoria International Airport, you needn’t be local. The same convenience and enjoyability benefits all in town for business.
 
The riverside downtowns of both Peoria and East Peoria add a vibrancy to your attendees’ stay. And with 4,500 hotel rooms to choose from, planners can find their financial comfort spot when trying to hit their budget. 
 
Throw in the walkability factor and it’s easy to see why there is a buzz about Peoria. It is a place to bring groups ready to convene without some of the hassle seen elsewhere. A meeting should feel seamless, with each decision the right one to reach your objectives.
 
Read on to learn what makes planning in the Whiskey City such a smooth experience.
 
Peoria Civic Center
As the largest event venue in Southern Illinois, Peoria Civic Center is outfitted with a ballroom, meeting rooms, exhibition halls and other gathering settings to host thousands for a national convention—or a dozen C-suite executives for a high-stakes board meeting.
With 110,000 square feet of exhibit space spread across four halls, the civic center holds up to 653 booths. The ballroom holds 1,260 for a reception and has an outdoor balcony featuring a panoramic view of Peoria. For more intimate meetings, the ballroom divides into nine meeting rooms, and there are 16 additional breakout venues.
An impressive arena and performance theater add additional options for meeting space, entertainment and networking sessions.
The in-house audiovisual and catering teams provide unrivaled service to meet any planner’s needs.

 
Hotel Selection
Looking to provide your group an elegant stay? Trying not to break the budget? Or how about something for both extremes? Check, check and check again. Find your ideal venue in Peoria.
Hotel Pere Marquette blends a rich history, layers of sophistication, modern amenities and convenience. Impressively, it never feels stuffy while providing all the niceties guests could desire. There are 286 luxurious rooms and 35 suites. A skywalk connects the hotel to the Peoria Civic Center and arena. Planners can also utilize the 19,500 square feet of meeting space on-site as well.
Four Points by Sheraton Peoria Downtown is chock-full of amenities. The 323-room hotel includes 12 meeting rooms, with the largest available space (ballroom) holding up to 1,800 attendees. Up-to-date technology and safety measures ensure a successful meeting here.
Embassy Suites by Hilton East Peoria Riverfront Hotel & Conference Center puts your group in the heart of downtown and its acclaimed venues, restaurants and shopping destinations. The 35,000-sq.-ft. conference center is ideal for a midsize business event and/or convention. 

 
Barrel Full of Unique Venues
For a different perspective from traditional convention centers and hotels, local venues add a fun sense of place to your event. Options include:
Caterpillar Visitors Center & Museum is a popular choice for its inside look at the world of manufacturing and sustainability. Corporate meeting space is available for half-day or full-day rentals, or for nighttime use. Be sure to build in time for the group to tour the exhibitions to gain a new appreciation for what it takes to build a lasting organization.
Peoria Riverfront Museum is an inspired choice to teach the importance of interdisciplinary teamwork. Designated as one of the 200 great places in Illinois by the American Institute of Architects, the facility includes several meeting and event spaces. Consider the lobby for an off-site reception and book a private laser show at the Dome Planetarium.
 
Group Activities
Shared experiences build bonds and long-term memories. Take the whole group out to the ballgame or a show for a night on the town.
The charm of Minor League Baseball never wears off. The Peoria Chiefs, affiliated with the St. Louis Cardinals, are a sure hit for a team outing April through mid-September. Better yet, Dozer Park is within walking distance of the civic center and contains several venues for business meeting that are available during the season and in the offseason.
 
Local Flavor
For a true taste of Peoria, attendees can embrace the community’s rich offerings from the food and drink to fun activities. Highlights include:
Black Band Distillery is the right stop to see how the destination earned its nickname of “Whiskey City.”
Zion Coffee Bar in the Warehouse District sources its coffee directly from small growers in Central America. Artisan cocktails and pastries are also available. Planners can order coffee via delivery to up the morning caffeine game.
Crafted DIY Studio & Bar is just what it sounds like. Create a project over a nice drink at this unusual setting also in the Warehouse District.
Workout nuts and wellness-minded attendees will climb hand over fist to First Ascent for a good workout.
Gone Axe Throwing is more than a catchier phrase than the traditional fishing angle. Attendees can test their aim and strength after a full day of meetings.

 
There are many reasons to say “cheers” to Peoria, but it truly is the total package that sets the destination apart. With convenience, amenities and top venues, Peoria has a combination that appeals to all groups. Come meet in Whiskey City for yourself to see the magic firsthand.

Team Building and Group Fun in the Peoria Area

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Apr. 20, 2022
				






Teamwork is a vital part of any community, and if you’re looking for things to do with a group you’ve come to the right place. The Peoria area is filled with opportunities that require you to work with others and will help you to grow relationships within a team. Visit any of these locations with your group for an enjoyable team building experience!
 
Escape 60
Escape 60 in Peoria gives groups the chance to work together and think on their feet during a live escape room adventure. Choose from a number of escape rooms with different tasks and show off your problem solving skills in a high pressure environment. You may have to find a serial killer, disarm a missile that’s about to explode, or save all of mankind! 
 
Escape Town Peoria
Also a location providing the area with escape room adventures, Escape Town Peoria encourages groups to take on a challenge and work together to break out of an interactive and creative escape room. Pick a room theme with options ranging from a party house to a wild west jailbreak, and get ready to use your critical thinking skills. 
 
Round1
Your group is guaranteed to have fun at Round1, a destination in Peoria known for arcade games and excitement. Get to know your team members during a game of bowling, billiards, ping pong or darts. Don’t be afraid to sing your heart away during a round of karaoke, or enjoy their kids zone play area and some pizza or wings!
 

 
Pekin Park District 
Does your group have a love for learning? The Pekin Park District is the perfect destination for adventuring and programs that will not only get you moving but will teach you new skills. With hiking and biking trails, ice skating, horseback riding, athletic fields and more, there’s plenty of opportunities for fun and discovery. Enjoy a game of golf or mini golf, or break out of your comfort zone by renting paddle boats and boating on the lagoon!
 
Lick Creek Golf Course
Considered to be one of the best golf courses in Central Illinois, Lick Creek Golf Course in Pekin is an ideal destination for a team outing. Put your golf skills to the test and take part in some healthy competition!
 
Parkview Golf Course 
Open year round with 18 holes, Parkview Golf Course is another popular course in the area with some hills for added challenge. Learn all about your team while playing a round and showcasing your golf knowledge. 
 

 
Greater Peoria understands the importance of collaboration and teamwork in our region. Make one of these destinations your next spot for a team building activity or some group fun.
