Autumn in Greater Peoria 2022

By Discover Peoria on

					Sep. 05, 2022
				






From late September to the end of October, Greater Peoria puts on a seasonal show like nowhere else—and stunning foliage is just the beginning. Join us in our neck of the woods this autumn. Make the most of your foliage day trip, road trip, or weekend getaway with our list of memorable things to do in Greater Peoria this fall, excerpted from the September/October 2022 Calendar of Events.
 
Wildfire Fall Concert Series at Wildlife Prairie Park  {Hanna City}   //   September 1, 8, 22, 29, 2022   //    Every Thursday in September, grab a lawn chair and head to Wildlife Prairie Park for their free concert series on the main bricks.

Mackinaw Grape Stomp & Harvest Festival at Mackinaw Valley Vineyard   {Mackinaw}   //   September 4, 2022   //   Get ready to get your feet wet in the wine! Enjoy a fun day of winemaking as well as food by The Mackinaw Lions Club and live music by the Mystery Machine.

Pekin Marigold Festival at Mineral Springs Park   {Pekin}   //   September 8-11, 2022   //   Held in the Marigold Capital of the World, don't miss this annual festival to honor Pekin’s favorite son, Senator Everett Dirksen. Enjoy the yearly parade, crowning of Miss Marigold, carnival, live music, amazing food, vendor show, and more! This year's festival theme is ‘Back In Time’ as we celebrate the festival's 50th year!

Elmwood Fall Festival  {Elmwood}   //   September 8-10, 2022   //    This is a quintessential midwestern fall festival—you can expect not only the amusement rides but carnival games, food, bingo, music, and a parade on Saturday.

Havana Oktoberfest  {Havana}   //   September 9-11, 2022   //    Havana Oktoberfest is an amazing weekend filled with culture and fun. Get ready for food and drinks, vendors, live music, a carnival and parade, contests, polka pace race and fun for all!

Cannabis Camp  {West Peoria}   //   September 10, 2022   //    Cannabis Camp is the premier cannabis event of the summer in downstate Illinois. This consumption event celebrates all-natural health and wellness treatments, specifically cannabis. There will be a variety of vendors from around the state with booths set up to offer educational materials, purchasable items, and giveaways. We will also have food trucks, live art, yoga, music, and more!

Morton Pumpkin Festival  {Morton}   //   September 14-17, 2022   //    The Morton Pumpkin Festival is the perfect fall festival for any pumpkin lover in the Pumpkin Capital of the World! This four-day festival is packed with events like the Pumpkin Weigh-Off, the Pumpkin Princess pageant, Pumpkin Classic 10K, live entertainment, parades, carnival rides, pumpkin foods, and soooo much more!

Peoria Oktoberfest at the Peoria Riverfront Festival Park  {Peoria}   //   September 16-18, 2022   //    Come and experience the magic world of the big tent where one leaves Peoria and enters Germany! This three-day event showcases German heritage through song, dance, food, drink, cultural exhibits and much more. Do not miss the talented German bands and musicians on multiple stages, vendors and much more!

Bridge to Bridge   {Peoria Heights, Chillicothe, Lacon, Henry, Spring Bay}   //   September 17-18  //   This charming festival takes place in five of Greater Peoria’s quintessential river towns along the Illinois River. Stop along the route from Peoria Heights to Chillicothe to Lacon to Henry to Spring Bay and experience art fairs, vendor markets, live music, family games, fishing, food, and more!

Fall Dessert Tour   {Chillicothe}   //   September 17, 2022   //    The Fall Dessert Tour is a part of the Bridge to Bridge event. You won’t want to miss this walkable dessert tour with 18 local businesses participating!

Fall Craft Show at Shore Acres Park   {Chillicothe}   //   September 17, 2022   //    The Fall Craft show is a part of the Bridge to Bridge event. Join the fun for a great day at the park with amazing makers, crafters, and vendors. Bring the family and enjoy delicious food + great music. Leashed pets are welcome!

Autumn Market   {Chillicothe}   //   September 21, 2022   //    This market is full of local farmers and artisans. Shop produce, baked goods, sweet treats, hand-crafted goodies, and more! Enjoy music by the Roundstone Buskers and snacks from food trucks like El Zarape Taco Truck and Swanee's Soft Pretzels.

Autumn Market in the Garden at the Luthy Botanical Garden   {Peoria}   //   September 24, 2022   //    Enjoy a creative community of artists, craftsmen, foodies and collectors coming together to bring the charm and excitement of the fall to Luthy Botanical Garden.

Peoria Art Guild Fine Art Fair at the Peoria Riverfront Festival Park  {Peoria}   //   September 24-25, 2022   //    The Peoria Fine Art Fair has been bringing original art to central Illinois for 60 years.  As one of the oldest art organizations in the country, the Peoria Art Guild Fine Art Fair is nationally recognized and showcases national, regional and local artists. The Art Fair features original works of art, including jewelry, painting, ceramics, photography, digital art, and more.

Taste of Canton  {Canton}   //   September 25, 2022   //    The streets in downtown Canton will be closed off for this local food festival!! Expect a variety of tastings from local restaurants and food trucks, a wine and beer garden, live music and inflatables for the kiddos. Oh, and don't forget the pie eating contest!!
Spoon River Scenic Drive Fall Festival   {Sanctioned sites throughout Fulton County}   //   October 1, 2, 8, 9   //   Spoon River Valley Scenic Drive Fall Festival is a celebration of arts, history, and culture throughout Fulton County. Each of the communities participating (Astoria, Bernadotte, Canton, Duncan Mills, Lewistown, Smithfield and more) are displaying a multitude of arts, crafts, flea markets, foods, history and heritage.

Schlachtfest at Hickory Grove Park  {Dunlap}   //   October 2, 2022   //    This years’ Schlachtfest will be a combined celebration of German-American Day and a kick-off to German-American Heritage month. The event will feature German music, beer, food, activities, games along with an art and craft fair.

Peoria Food and Wine Festival  {Peoria Heights}   //   October 13, 2022   //    The Peoria Food and Wine Festival is perfect for foodies and wine connoisseurs as the festival showcases local food and wines! Every year the Peoria Food + Wine festival benefits local charities–this year proceeds will be donated to The Young Minds Project.

U-Pick Farms and Orchards  {Greater Peoria}   //   Whether you're looking to pick sweet corn, pumpkins, gourds, apples, pears, vegetables, mums, or more, check out these amazing options to pick-your-own produce in the Peoria Area. For a list of farms and orchards, read Peoria Area U-Pick Farms + Orchards

Halloween Events, Activities, + Adventures  {Greater Peoria}   //   For spooky activities and events in September and October, check out this list, excerpted from the September/October 2022 Calendar of Events:  Halloween in Greater Peoria 2022
 
Haunted Houses, Trails + Manors  {Greater Peoria}   //   Leaves changing colors and pumpkin spice mean the arrival of fall and Halloween and the opening of haunted attractions across Greater Peoria. Check out these 5 terrifying haunted attractions in the Greater Peoria Area

Top 6 Favorite Cheesy Dishes

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Oct. 29, 2021
				






Did you know that the month of October celebrates American Cheese Month!?  As the month is coming to an end, Discover Peoria has decided to wrap it up with five of our favorite super cheesy meals you can get in the Peoria area. When all else fails….cheese! 
 
1. The cheesier, the better!   //  Thyme Kitchen and Craft Beer combines two of our favorite cheesy foods into one with their Grilled Macaroni & Cheese! Your taste buds will sing when you bite into the delicious combination of toasted bread, American cheese, gouda and macaroni.

 
2. Who doesn’t love a good soup?  //  Not only does Jim's Bistro in Peoria Heights have the most delicious french onion soup, but it’s topped with a super tasty layer of melted cheese. Plus, soup is perfect for the approaching cold weather!
 
3. Not your ordinary nachos!  //  You have to try the Seafood Nachos from Jonah’s Seafood House in East Peoria! Jonah’s serves up crab, shrimp and a blend of cheeses on homemade tortilla chips. Yum! 

 
4. Ravioli is always a good idea  //  Craving some Italian food? The three-cheese ravioli from Johnny's Italian Steakhouse combines basil pesto, parmesan and Johnny’s marinara sauce into one dish that’s super cheesy and absolutely to die for!
 
5. The only bad burger is the one you didn’t eat!  //  You haven’t lived until you’ve tried the Piggyback Mac Burger from Obed and Isaac’s Microbrewery and Eatery! This tasty pub burger is topped with mac and cheddar cheese, smoked pork and drizzled with bbq sauce on a pretzel bun. 

 
6. I've never met a pizza I didn't like.  //  Picture yourself biting into a hot, delicious slice of gooey oozy pizza. That's exactly what happens with every Cheese Nuts Brick Oven Pizzeria pie! Regardless of what you order, each bite is bursting with complimentary flavors, the sauce is on point, and the crust is just the right amount of crispy. 
 
I think we can all agree that cheese improves the flavor of life! Don’t miss out on the cheese-licious goodness the Peoria Area has to offer.

13 Rainy Day Adventures with Kids

By Guest Writer: Annalee Anderson on

					Aug. 30, 2022
				






As we all know, Greater Peoria weather is unpredictable—78-degree sunshine on a Tuesday won’t guarantee snow won’t make an appearance on Wednesday. Luckily, Greater Peoria has some excellent indoor options to keep in your back pocket for the next unpredicted inclement day. Scroll through these local gems for adventures that are guaranteed to hold the kiddos’ attention and burn some of that pent-up rainy day energy.
 
Caterpillar Visitors Center  {Peoria}    //     This one-of-a-kind museum is a great way to spend a rainy day! With Caterpillar diggers, massive machinery, and vehicles from modern to vintage, this interactive and educational stop will have kids raving! The hands-on activities like the backhoe digital simulator and exploring in the cab of a real bulldozer is sure to engage kids (especially those who like big machinery) for hours.
 
Elevate  {Peoria + East Peoria}    //     Trampoline parks are the ultimate indoor playground for kids, and luckily Elevate has two local locations, Peoria and East Peoria. Kids can bounce, jump, and play laser tag all in a day’s work! Time allotments range from one to two hours, with the option of adding a laser tag game to your jump time. Elevate also offers exclusive memberships for homeschoolers and toddlers!
 
Escape 60  {Peoria}    //     Escape rooms offer a thrilling adventure for your family and friends, sure to leave your kids ready for more! With themed escape rooms, travel to a wizarding world, CSI crime scene, Doctor Who immersive experience, and more! Escape 60 encourages relationship strengthening and communication skills, all while having a blast!
 

Fired Up  {Peoria Heights} or Peek-in Pottery  {Pekin}    //  Fired Up in Peoria Heights or Peek in Pottery in Pekin are two excellent options to coax out the inner artist in everyone. Both of these local spots are a paint-your-own-pottery studio with a wide array of paint colors and pottery options. Kids can create core memories with their friends and family, either with a birthday party or rainy day painting. Both shops have wonderful paint color and style guidance for kids of all ages and abilities.
 
First Ascent  {Peoria}    //      Rock climbing is a surefire way to get kids moving and grooving on a rainy day. First Ascent in Peoria’s Warehouse District has your kiddos covered! Their motto is “get your kids climbing our walls instead of yours,” and they offer plenty of opportunities to do so. Specifically, First Ascent has kid-friendly drop-in climbing sessions, climbing classes, and a climbing team. On First Ascent’s website, there is more information regarding their kid-only offerings. Happy Climbing!
 
Five Points Washington  {Washington}    //      This fitness center located in Washington offers a wide range of classes and activities for children and adults. There are youth fitness classes such as kids yoga, aquatic fit and fun, and kids on the move, all geared towards teaching children about the importance of exercise while having fun! Aside from classes, Five Points Washington has a kids' clubhouse available for daycare accommodations. Last but not least, enjoy the indoor leisure pool on a rainy day!
 
Luthy Botanical Gardens  {Peoria}    //      Even on a rainy day, the great outdoors is accessible at the Peoria Park District’s Luthy Botanical Gardens! Located in Glen Oak Park, this conservatory offers beautiful flora to be appreciated by kids and adults alike. Tropical plants unseen in Illinois’ native ecosystem are thriving alongside other themed gardens. Luthy Botanical Gardens has free admission and specialized programs for kids!
 
Owens Center Ice Skating  {Peoria}    //      The Peoria Park District Owens Center, located on Lake Ave, offers year-round indoor ice skating on NHL sized rinks. There are options for private rentals and classes, as well as public open skate times. Admission prices and up-to-date information on public skating is listed on the Owens Center Facebook page. Start your kiddos hockey or figure skating career at the Owens Center on a rainy day!
 
Peoria PlayHouse Children’s Museum  {Peoria}    //      Located in Glen Oak Park, this Peoria Park District facility offers children “the tools and inspiration they need to be explorers and creators of the world.” Specifically, there are open art projects, animal exploration, and toddler-friendly activities. Information on admission and special events is available on their website.
 
Peoria Riverfront Museum  {Peoria}    //      With a trip to Peoria’s Riverfront Museum, your whole family will leave learning something new and exciting! Rotating exhibitions, shows in the Dome Planetarium, and movies in the Giant Screen Theater are fun attractions for all who attend. Kid-exclusive offerings are also available at the Riverfront Museum, such as the Luminescence Lab accompanying the Creatures of Light exhibit.
 
Wheels O’ Time Museum  {Dunlap}    //      For over 40 years, the Wheels O’ Time Museum has provided children and adults with insight on life in the past, including transportation, farm and home life, entertainment, and industry in Central Illinois. Open from May to October, this attraction in Dunlap is sure to leave the whole family insightful and inspired! 
 
Round 1  {Peoria}    //      This multi-entertainment facility located in Northwoods Mall offers bowling, arcade games, billiards, karaoke, ping pong, darts, and even a kids zone play area! With its variety of fun-filled activities, exclusive arcade machines, and food & beverage offerings, Round1 is unparalleled! This one-stop-amusement-shop will cure any rainy day blues.

Hike Greater Peoria with your Pup

By Guest Writer: Annalee Anderson on

					Jul. 27, 2022
				






We all love to get outside during the summer, especially the furry members of our families! The Greater Peoria Area has an abundance of hiking trails for pups and people who love a good adventure. Check out these great trails to hike with your furry friends!

 
Robinson Park  {Peoria}   //  Located off Mossville Rd near Dunlap, Robinson Park consists of a couple different trails of differing difficulty. The Illinois River Bluff trail is a 5-mile loop trail considered challenging, but very rewarding! 
 
Spring Creek Preserve  {East Peoria}   //  Marvel in bird song as you and your leashed pup hike this 2.6-mile loop. Spring Creek Preserve is a pocket of peace amongst the busy city, accessible year-round! 
 
Farmdale Reservoir  {Washington}   //  Farmdale Reservoir is a catch-all for outdoor recreation. It is a prime destination for mountain biking, equestrians, and most importantly, hiking with your pup! Farmdale Reservoir is over 800 acres in size and has a variety of trails to choose from. In particular, the Farmdale Recreation Area Trail is a 6.9-mile loop and is moderately challenging, but perfect on a cool summer morning. 
 
Weaver Park  {Washington}   //  Located off Lawndale Ave in Washington, this a 1.1-mile loop is just the place to immerse yourself and your leashed pup outdoors. The Weaver Park hiking trail runs along Farm Creek, making for great views and vibes for the half hour hike. 
 
Kinsey Park  {Peoria}   //  This hidden gem off of Southport Rd is a mountain biker’s and dog’s playground. Kinsey Park houses a network of trails all well-labeled with differing difficulty levels. Get lost (metaphorically) in the Land of Oz surrounded by the beauty of nature!
 
Black Partridge Park  {Metamora}   //  This 6.5-mile loop trail is a lively trail for all, leashed furry friends included! Black Partridge Park is a deer’s haven and has the perfect amount of shade on a hot summer’s day.
 
Detweiller Park  {Peoria}   //  Detweiller Park off Galena Rd in Peoria has an array of outdoor activity amenities from soccer to playgrounds to hiking! Specifically, the Dry Run Trail to Pimiteoui Trail is a 1.1-mile loop satisfying the need to be outdoors. Dogs are welcome to be off leash in some areas.

Peoria Area U-Pick Farms & Orchards

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Sep. 01, 2021
				







Whether you're looking to pick strawberries, raspberries, sweet corn, pumpkins, gourds, apples, pears, watermelon, vegetables, mums, or more, check out these amazing options to pick-your-own produce in the Peoria Area
 
Ackerman Family Farms  {Morton}   //  August to October  //  Ackerman Family Farms has many fall festivities including pumpkin patches, a corn maze, a petting zoo, and a gift shop filled with tasty fall treats!
Arends Orchard   {Laura}   //  July to December  //  Arends Orchard serves the Central Illinois area with delicious apples, cider, raw honey and a series of other fruits and vegetables that are grown right on the farm.
Christ Orchard  {Elmwood}   //  August to November  //  Head out to Christ Orchard for some apple picking! They also have pure honey, apple cider, pumpkins, fruit butters and preserves and much more.  
Crooked Row Farm Illinois  {Chillicothe}   //  Mid-May to October  //  Crooked Row Farm offers strawberries, raspberries, vegetables, pumpkins. They're available pre-picked or you can pick your own. Only Organic fertilizers and natural pesticides are used on this locally-owned form.
Orchard Hill Farm   {Lewistown}   //  August to October  //  Orchard Hill Farm is the perfect place for fall shopping and family fun. They sell a variety of treats such as tasty caramel apples. Don’t miss out on their cookouts, wine tastings, carriage rides, barrel train rides, corn maze, and cannons.
Partridge Point Orchard  {Metamora}   //  September to October  //  Partridge Point Orchard is a U-Pick apple orchard conveniently located 3 miles North of Metamora, IL. They have nine varieties of apples consisting of over 800 apple trees ripening throughout the season so you can pick throughout fall. Partridge Point also sells great local honey!
Pleasant Row Orchard  {Cuba}   //  September to October  //  This small but full of life orchard, Pleasant Row is just waiting to be explored! With around 800 trees with both new and old varieties of apples, you can pick from plus peaches, cherries, and beautiful fall decorative produce! 
Roth Pumpkin Patch  {Morton}   //  September to October  //  Roth Pumpkin Patch has fun fall things to do for the whole family including a corn maze, tube slides, pedal race tracks, and hayrack rides. You can also pick your pumpkin, get some delicious treats, and shop in their gift shop!
Schaer’s Country Market  {East Peoria}   //  June to December  //  Schaer's Country Market specializes in U-pick strawberries, homegrown sweet corn, cantaloupe, watermelon, tomatoes and more. Fall takes the farm into pumpkins, gourds, corn stalks, and more. Christmas trees, wreaths, garland, grave blankets begin the day after Thanksgiving.
Hilly Lane Pumpkins  {Sparland}  //  June to November  //  Cousin to Shaer's Country Market and the Metro Center Farmers Market, Hilly Lane has a great selection of pumpkins and pumpkin pies. Visit Hilly Lane for gourds of all sizes, butters and jams, and honey crisp apples. 
Tanners Orchard  {Speer}   //  August to November  //  Tanners Orchard offers a series of fall festivities throughout the season including a farm market and bakery, apple picking, a corn maze and petting zoo, events and festival days with games and activities.
The Pumpkin Place  {Princeville}   //  September to October  //  Enjoy a crisp fall morning on this family-owned pumpkin patch in Princeville! Located off Oertley Rd, The Pumpkin Place houses unique, giant, and colorful pumpkins!

Peppermint Mocha in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Dec. 01, 2022
				






Move over pumpkin spice.....it's peppermint mocha season! Nothing says winter like this festive all-star flavor combo. Luckily, the Greater Peoria Area has this duo in a variety of sips, sweets, and treats to brighten the holidays. Check out these local joints to curb your chocolate and peppermint cravings.
 
Behr Necessities  {Liverpool}    //   If you're looking for a bang for your buck, try a peppermint hot cocoa bomb from Behr Necessities for only $5. It makes one of the most delightful cups of hot cocoa you'll have all season. But don't take our word for it, treat yourself.
 
Black Maple Coffee  {Canton + Lewistown}    //   The cold weather calls for winter flavors. Pop out of the cold and into Black Maple Coffee for a peppermint bark mocha or white chocolate peppermint bark latte.
 
Brickhouse Coffee Bar  {Minonk}    //   If you're looking to get into the holiday spirit, head to Brickhouse Coffee. Not only do they serve a delightful Peppermint Mocha but their other holiday beverages are worth the buzz!
 
Cafe Santa Rosa  {Peoria}    //   During the most wonderful time of the year, head to Cafe Santa Rosa in Junction City. All the syrups are homemade including their seasonal peppermint, white mocha, and winter spice.
 
Coffee Connection  {Pekin}    //   This cozy spot is the perfect place for a hot beverage and a dose of community. Coffee Connection is always filled with a mix of wonderful conversation, gracious people, and cozy corners to study. Oh, and the peppermint mocha is top notch!
 
[CxT] Roasting Co.  {Peoria}    //   This coffee shop is known for their unique holiday flavors including this year's peppermint matcha and mocha cayenne. But don't worry, [CxT] also has your delicious classic peppermint mocha to sip on too. With two locations, (one in Keller Station and the other Downtown Peoria) you won't have an excuse not to pop in!
 
Eli’s Coffee Shop   {Morton, Tremont, Mackinaw, Metamora}  //    Try the Peppermint Cocoa as either a creamy hot drink or a blended iced drink. Topped with whipped cream, crushed candy cane pieces and chocolate drizzle, there’s no way you won’t love it
 
FaireCoffee  {Peoria, Washington, Eureka}    //    Whether you visit the Shoppes at Grand Prairie, Historic Washington Square or Downtown Eureka, FaireCoffee is full of peppermint treats!! Be sure to try their peppermint ice cream, a candy cane latte, the holly jolly latte, and the White Christmas. 
 
Four30 Scones  {Morton}    //    Not only can you get a mouth-watering peppermint truffle scone at Four30 this season, but you can pair it with their amazing peppermint mocha latte. #PerfectPairing #DuoDream
 
Frosted Bakery  {Princeville}    //   The seasonal menu is up and Frosted Bakery is winning! Whether it be a mocha, latte, frappe, or non-coffee, you can find a peppermint mocha duo to enjoy.
 
Kickabrew Coffee Co  {Edwards}    //   Kickabrew Coffee might win the classist combo this year with their Tuxedo Peppermint Mocha! It's a twist of white chocolate, mocha, and peppermint blended and frothy and truly amazing. Or you can always stick with the trusty classic peppermint mocha---either way, you're winning.
 
Leaves n’ Beans Coffee  {Pekin, Morton, Peoria Heights}    //   If you're going to walk through a winter wonderland, stroll with a peppermint mocha from Leaves n' Beans. This all-star cup of holiday cheer is brag-worthy!
 
LeBakery  {Peoria}    //   LeBakery is spreading holiday cheer with their peppermint cocoa bombs. Their homemade recipe has a unique mix of flavors that makes the ultimate creamy cup of cocoa! Head to the Metro Centre today to pick a few up and don't forget to grab one for Santa too!
 
Lucy Dot’s Little Bakery Shoppe  {Toulon}    //   If you're looking for some pink peppermint ice-cream or a peppermint mocha cupcake, run to Lucy Dot's while supplies last! Their clever holiday flavors have dropped and these peppermint goodies are only a few of the amazing holiday treats available.
 
MadMac’s Coffee  {Germantown Hills}    //   Being the new kid on the block has not stopped MadMac's from dominating with their holiday flavor selection! The classic peppermint mocha and white peppermint mocha only scratch the surface for holiday treats. Head there and check out the other 17 holiday beverages to try.
 
Minonk Chocolate Company  {Minonk}    //   Known for the highest quality chocolates made from time-tested recipes, head to Minonk Chocolate Company to try their homemade mint meltaways. These are the classic mouthwatering chocolates Peppermint Mochas dream of at night.... 
 
Princess Creations  {Canton}    //   'Tis the season for peppermint mocha cupcakes and peppermint hot cocoa bombs! Check out Princess Creations for this perfect peppermint-chocolate duo!
 
The Blend   {Washington}  //   Warm-up this winter season at The Blend with a Wintermint Mocha Latte. This refreshing classic is made entirely from scratch by the team. It very well may turn into your favorite holiday beverage.
 
The Coffee Hub  {Lacon}    //   The Coffee Hub understood the assignment. Stop in to try The Grinch, Frosty's Demise, The Candy Cane, or a cup of Christmas Sprit.
 
The Spot Coffee  {Peoria}  //   Specializing in homemade peppermint syrup, The Spot crafts peppermint mocha and peppermint hot chocolate  beverages finished off with fresh whipped cream. Yum!
 
The Sweet Bean Coffee + Treats  {Pekin}    //   For our mega Peppermint Mocha fans, The Sweet Bean is the place for you!! This holiday season you can pair a blended iced peppermint mocha frystas with a peppermint mocha cupcake AND a peppermint blossom.  ((Warning:  you will crave the peppermint blossom in the middle of the night!! This chocolate cookie and peppermint kiss is on a new level!)) Don't miss these holiday fan favorites!
 
thirty-thirty Coffee Co.  {Peoria}    //    This Illinois Maker award recipient is a great spot to try a peppermint mocha and spiced lattes this season.
 
Trefzger’s Bakery  {Peoria Heights}    //   There's a reason why Trefzger’s Bakery is Peoria’s longest standing bakery and Illinois Maker award recipient! Stop in to stock up on your holiday treats like the peppermint mocha cupcakes, and any of their famous holiday cookies and pastries!
 
Triple Dipple’s   {Chillicothe}  //  Who can say no to a peppermint bark cheesecake?! With creamy peppermint goodness, an oreo crust, chocolate chips and white chocolate peppermint whipped cream your mouth will be watering!
 
Voilà Macarons  {Peoria}    //    Rotating winter flavors are coming soon. Whether you're trying a peppermint mocha cookie or one of the many other seasonal treats, Voilà Macarons does not disappoint. Grab a dozen, these authentic European macarons pair beautifully with holiday cheer.
 
Yeni’s Palarte  {Peoria Heights}  //  is a Mexican ice cream shop that also offers food and drinks. It might be winter, but ice cream is a delicious treat year-round! Try out the peppermint bark ice cream or a festive holiday drink!
 
Zion Coffee  {Peoria}    //    If you're in the mood for a classic peppermint mocha in a bustling shop, head to Zion in the Warehouse District! Not only will this classic curb your peppermint craving, but their entire winter menu is impressive. We challenge you to try them all!
 
 
 

      
Photo Credit:  Four30 Scones + Lucy Dot's Little Bakery Shoppe

9 Great Places to Watch the Sunset in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on

					Aug. 16, 2022
				






There is really nothing better than a nice relaxing end to a long day. Whether you need to clear your mind after a stressful day or just wind down, the perfect way to end the day is by catching a sunset. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the beauty of a Greater Peoria Area sunset, all year round!
 
GRANDVIEW DRIVE  {Peoria Heights}   //   Peoria’s famous Grandview Drive wasn't named  “the most beautiful drive in the world” for no reason! Hop in the car and cruise down this 2.5  mile scenic drive for unforgettable sunset views over the Illinois River. With lookouts all along the route, feel free to pull over and get settled at the picnic benches and take it all in. Whether you are in the car or having a picnic on the grass, the sunsets on Grandview Drive are truly unmatched!
 
TOWER PARK   {Peoria Heights}   //   There is no better way to see the sunset than to be IN the sunset! Head over to Tower Park in Peoria Heights for an unmatched view of Greater Peoria sunsets. Tower Park is home to a 200 ft water tower, complete with 3 observation decks, allowing for panoramic views of the Peoria Area and breathtaking sunsets like you've never experienced before.
 
DOZER PARK  {Peoria}   //   What's better than watching a sunset? Watching a sunset with a hot dog and beer in hand! Dozer Park offers the full sunset experience, allowing you to enjoy a minor league baseball game on a nice summer evening, with a sunset as the backdrop. And even better, more often than not, Dozer Park ends the night with fireworks after the sunset, topping off the perfect summer night! 
 
CHILLICOTHE OBSERVATION TOWER  {Chillicothe}   //   Right along  the water in Chillicothe sits Eagle Landing Park. Eagle Landing might be a great place to observe native bird species, but its newest addition provides the perfect place to enjoy a Peoria Area sunset. Check out the recently added observation tower, and see for yourself why people love an evening in Greater Peoria, and do it from 50ft in the air! 
 
UNCLE BOB’S ICE CREAM SHOP  {Eureka}   //   There is only one thing better than ice cream on a warm summer night, and that would be watching a sunset on a warm summer night, ice cream in hand. Lucky for us, Uncle Bob’s Ice Cream is a one stop shop for just that. Stop by and try a one of a kind ice cream flavor and enjoy the Eureka sunsets locals love oh so much.
 
EMIQUON NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE  {Lewistown}   //   Looking to become one with nature? Head to Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge for a sunset like never before. This refuge is home to thousands of birds and native species, the perfect company for a nice sunset. Whether you're hiking, canoeing, or hanging out on the observation decks or boardwalk, a Peoria Area sunset at  Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge is the perfect way to top off a good day.
 
FONDULAC DRIVE  {East Peoria}   //   For the best views of Peoria’s iconic skyline at dusk, take a cruise down Fondulac Drive in East Peoria. Complete with two look out points, these scenic stops mean that you can enjoy year round sunsets from the comfort of your car. With the sunset as its backdrop, the city has never looked so pretty! 
 
EASTPORT MARINA  {East Peoria}   //   Treat yourself to the perfect end to the day after a long day on the water! The end of a day calls for relaxation, and what better way to do that than by watching a sunset? Whether on land or sea, everyone at Eastport Marina can catch the sun as it dips under the horizon. So put the boat in park or park your butt in a lawn chair and enjoy the perfect end to a great day.
 
SANKOTY LAKES  {Spring Bay}   //   Sankoty Lakes is a one of a kind wilderness retreat that is situated on some of the world's clearest and cleanest water. Whether you stop by for the day or stay for a week, there is one thing you are sure to enjoy: a good sunset. Head down to their Lake Canada, put the car in park, and take in the boundless beauty that Sankoty has to offer, complete with a sunset reflecting off the water.

Photo References: Cover Photo--Sankoty Lakes, Eureka Lake--Nick Windsor

Halloween in Greater Peoria 2022

By Discover Peoria on

					Sep. 05, 2022
				






Get in the Halloween spirit with these spooky, spectacular, and supernatural events. Greater Peoria is packed with haunted happenings every autumn, from frightening to family-friendly activities. Celebrate the spookiest time of year with haunted locations, cemetery tours, pumpkin picking, and beyond. 
 
Here are a few of the best things to do for Halloween in Greater Peoria, excerpted from the September/October 2022 Calendar of Events.

 
EVENTS + ACTIVITIES
Haunted Houses, Trails + Manors  {Greater Peoria}   //   Leaves changing colors and pumpkin spice mean the arrival of fall and Halloween and the opening of haunted attractions across Greater Peoria. Check out these 5 terrifying haunted attractions in the Greater Peoria Area.
 
U-Pick Farms + Orchards  {Greater Peoria}   //   Whether you're looking to pick sweet corn, pumpkins, gourds, apples, pears, vegetables, mums, or more, check out these amazing options to pick-your-own produce in the Peoria Area. For a list of farms and orchards, read Peoria Area U-Pick Farms + Orchards
 
Annual Pumpkin Launch Party at J Draper Glass  {Peoria}   //   September 7, 2022   //   Celebrating 13 years in business, J Draper Glass will is unveiling the signature 2022 glass pumpkin series! Select your pick of the patch before they go to the market with in-house discounts and cash prizes.
 
Little Shop of Horrors performed by the Peoria Players Theatre  {Peoria}   //   September 9, 10, 11, 15, 16, 17, 18   //   A deviously delicious Broadway and Hollywood sci-fi smash musical, Little Shop of Horrors has devoured the hearts of theatergoers for over 30 years. 
 
Springdale Cemetery Tour with the Peoria Historical Society   {Peoria}   //   September 10, 15, 24 and October 1, 2, 8, 9, 14  //   Historic Springdale Cemetery has many fascinating stories.  Explore the oldest chartered cemetery in the state of Illinois and enjoy the beautiful park-like setting as you hear stories of those who have their final resting place in Peoria during this guided history tour.
 
Halloween Gnomie at Art at the Bodega  {Washington}   //   September 16, 2022   //   Lets get this Halloween season started now at Art at the Bodega with an adorable gnome canvas painting class.
 
Ghost at the Peoria Civic Center  {Peoria}   //   September 21, 2022   //   Children of North America, rejoice… GHOST will once again bring the “euphoric spectacle” (ROLLING STONE) of its live ritual to North America. The North American tour will see the GRAMMY® Award-winning Swedish theatrical rock band headlining 19 arenas across the United States and Canada, including a night at the Peoria Civic Center!
 
Hocus Pocus Party at Art at the Bodega  {Washington}   //   October 7, 2022   //   Amuck! Amuck! Amuck! Come and run amuck at Art at the Bodega! Offering lots of Hocus Pocus themed projects to choose from, witches brew, cupcakes, raffles, and a costume contest.
 
Misery performed by the Peoria Players Theatre  {Peoria}   //   October 7, 8, 9, 13, 14, 15, 16   //   Written by William Goldman, based on the novel by Stephen King, ‘Misery’ follows successful romance novelist Paul Sheldon, who is rescued from a car crash by his “number one fan,” Annie Wilkes. He wakes up captive in her secluded home and quickly realizes Annie has no intention of letting him go….

Haunted Peoria Tour with the Peoria Historical Society  {Peoria}   //   October 7, 8, 15, 21, 22, 28 + 29  //   Explore the darker side of Peoria!  Discover the stories behind the ghostly appearances that have startled and puzzled Peorians through the years.  Curses, graves, legends and spooky sightings abound in this guided history tour.

Wand-Lore and Wand Making at the Luthy Botanical Garden   {Peoria}   //   October 15, 2022   //   Wizards, witches, and muggles are welcomed to the world of wand-making and wand-lore. Dressing in wizard gear is encouraged, but not mandatory. We will explore wand-making, a few magical plants…but most importantly you will be paired with your very own wand!
 
Spooktacular Craft and Vendor Market   {East Peoria}   //   October 15   //   Head out to East Peoria for the 6th annual spooktacular market featuring local crafters, vendors and locally-owned businesses.
 
Witches Walk at Fon du Lac Farm Park   {East Peoria}   //   October 21   //   Get into the Halloween spirit while trick-or-treating through the illuminated, kid-friendly park. Enjoy movies, concessions, and Halloween fun!
 
Lakeview Park After Dark {Peoria} // October 21 // After Dark brings back the vintage, all hallows eve experience of ghosts, jack-o-lanterns, and witches, through this family-friendly adventure. The marked route will guide your car along the twists and turns through Lakeview Park with surprises of Halloween fun everywhere you look!
 
Carn-Evil {Peoria} // October 21, 22, 23 and October 28, 29, 30 // A night of boos and booze awaits around every turn that includes heavy hors d’oeuvres, signature cocktails, Parks on Tap, a classic Halloween movie on the big screen, and a spooktacular hayrack ride through the park!
 
Halloween Trivia + Costumes at the Pekin Country Club  {Pekin}   //   October 22   //   Get dressed up and show off the amount of useless knowledge stored in your brain.
 
Halloween Creeps in Jeeps at the Pekin Marine Corps League  {Pekin}   //   October 22   //   Costume and Jeep decorating contests!! The creepy crawl starts and ends at Marine Corp with live music by K&R Country and a rock light show after dark.
 
PEORIA Sign + Fun Trick or Treat! at Keller Station {Peoria} // October 22 // Join Communication Junction for an afternoon of Halloween fun! Bring your little one(s) dressed in his/her Halloween costume and come sing, dance, read books and trick-or-treat in a fun, family friendly way.
 
Royal Halloween Bash at Stoney Creek Hotel  {East Peoria}  //   October 23   //   Time to dress up the kids, and take them trick-or-treating at Stoney Creek Hotel! You'll meet your favorite princesses, villains, and superheroes at this Royal Halloween Bash!
 
The Rocky Horror Picture Show performed by the Peoria Players Theatre  {Peoria}   //   October 28 + 29   //   The midnight madness returns to Peoria Players for the annual showing of The Rocky Horror Picture Show. The actors will perform onstage while the movie plays on the big screen. Doors open at 11:30 PM each night and the show will begin at midnight. 
 
2022 Halloween Extravaganza at the Villas of Holly Brook  {Pekin}   //   October 28 + 29   //   Bring lawn chairs or blankets for an outdoor showing of Casper the Friendly Ghost Friday at sundown! Saturday, join the fun for raffles, bounce houses, face painting, amazing food, local vendors, snow cones, music, bake sale and kids crafts!
 
Ghost Chase 5k Race at Three Sisters Park   {Chillicothe}   //   October 29   //   The Ghost Chase 5k is an event benefiting the Illinois Valley Central School district Band Programs and consists of a 5K run and 1 Mile fun walk. 
 
Screaming Pumpkin through Springdale Cemetery  {Peoria}   //   October 29   //   Benefitting the Yellow Bear Foundation, the Screaming Pumpkin night race will wind through the Springdale Cemetery. Chills and thrills will keep you motivated as you run or walk through our 2-mile walk, 6.55-mile run, half marathon, full marathon, or full marathon relay! Run or walk if you dare. Once you start, there is no turning back.
 
Spooky 5K Fun Run at Wildlife Prairie Park  {Hanna City}   // October 29 //   The Spooky Fun Trail Run is a great activity for you and your squad to get into the festive spirit! Dress up in costume and come enjoy the beauty of fall on the trails of Wildlife Prairie Park.
 
Trick or Treat at the Pickers Daughter  {East Peoria}    //   October 29   //  Bring your lil ghosts & goblins by the Pickers Daughter from noon to 3:00 PM for a spooky treat! Enter the drawing for a $25 gift certificate. You'll find some scary crazy sales and markdowns! Don't miss out on your chance to win some wicked prizes.
 
The Governors' Masked Ball at Betty Jayne Center for the Performing Arts  {Peoria Heights} // October 29 // Put on your best Halloween get-up and get down to the Betty Jayne for The Governors’ Masked Ball hosted by the Grey Governors! The Grey Governors are an eclectic, heavy hitting rock band with a one-of-a-kind sound! Don’t miss openers, the Common Shamans, playing their mix of grunge, punk, and classic rock!
 
HISRA Halloween Dance  {Peoria}   //   October 29   //   Heart of Illinois Special Recreation Association (HISRA) is hosting a Halloween Dance that will be such a fright. Costumes are optional but highly encouraged. Music, dancing and snacks will go from 7-9 PM. Ages 15-99 welcome!
 
 
2022 TRICK-OR-TREAT SCHEDULE IN GREATER PEORIA  >>

15 Spots to Satisfy a Sweet Tooth

By Guest Writer: Samantha Whiting on

					Feb. 13, 2023
				






If you’re looking for something to satisfy that hankering for sugar, we’ve got you covered! Indulge in any one of these local spots to satisfy your sweet tooth. With endless options for delicious treats, it’s no wonder the Greater Peoria Area  is the perfect place to call ‘home sweet home’.
 
1. Triple Dipple’s Treats and Delicacies  {Chillicothe}  //  Cheesecake lovers, this one’s for you! Triple Dipple offers a variety of satisfying flavors for everyone to enjoy. Their claim to fame? The irresistible and unique Sweet Tater Cheesecake, a combination of cheesecake and sweet potato pie. Yum!
 
2. Sweet Bean Coffee and Treats  {Pekin}  //  Sweet Bean stocks a variety of freshly baked treats each day, including their stunningly decorated sugar cookies that are just as satisfying to eat as they are to look at. With a rotating menu of delicious treats, we won’t blame you if you need to stop by for something new, every day of the week!
 
3. LeBakery  {Peoria}  //  From classic pastries and breads to delectable pies and cakes, LeBakery has something on the menu for everyone. Their extensive menu is a testament to LeBakery’s commitment to help Peoria celebrate any and every occasion. Try their fresh croissants!

 
4. Four30 Scones  {Morton}  //  Looking for something to pair with your coffee or tea? Four30 Scones has you covered with a mouthwatering variety of sweet and savory scones. We recommend ordering by the dozen!
 
5. Tadoughs  {Pekin}  //  Start your morning off right with Pekin’s famous Tadoughs, scrumptiously sweet donuts made from potatoes! Get there early to snag a box for the whole family and enjoy the classic donut taste with a delicious twist!
 
6. Minonk Chocolate Company  {Minonk}  //  Since 1915, Minonk Chocolate Company has continued to craft delicious, melt-in-your-mouth chocolate candies with the same time-tested recipe. If you love chocolate, you’ll want to order the classic tastes of Minonk Chocolate Company by the pound!
 
7. Trefzger’s Bakery  {Peoria Heights}  //  Pay a visit to the oldest bakery in Central Illinois for the flavors that have kept our sugar cravings satisfied for over 160 years. Participate in a Peoria tradition and satiate those cravings with cupcakes, cookies, pies, and more. We recommend the heavenly angel food cupcakes!

 
8. Sweet CeCe’s   {Peoria}  //  Life sure is sweet with Sweet CeCe’s! There’s nothing better than self-serve frozen yogurt piled high with sweets of every kind. There’s no stopping that smile as you create your own delicious desert. Kids love this fun and delicious activity, and you will too.
 
9. Hollands Mercantile  {Washington}  //  Who doesn’t love an old fashioned candy store? Located in the historic Washington square, Holland’s offers a variety of classic and modern treats for everyone’s tastes. If you’re not full yet, grab a bag of Holland’s famous caramel corn!
 
10. Scrolls the Sweet Room  {Morton}  //  Scrolls is what our sugar-craving dreams are made of! Indulge in this freshly rolled ice cream with delicious flavors, including vegan options. This charming space is the perfect place for family and friends to celebrate the sweeter things in life.  
11. Maurie’s Sugar Shoppe  {Eureka}  //  Caramels, chocolates, popcorn, and more can be found at Maurie’s in Eureka! This Central Illinois institution has been a staple since 1941. Their irresistible homemade fudge hits the spot every time!
 
12. Yeni’s Palarte  {Peoria Heights}  //  I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream! Yeni’s offers flavorful Mexican ice cream, food, and beverages for everyone to enjoy! Their variety of Mexican flavors and creative twists on ice cream classics, as well as their unique alcohol infused ice cream options, leaves ice cream lovers with endless options.
 
13. Carl’s Bakery & Restaurant  {East Peoria}  //  You can’t miss Carl’s Bakery & Restaurant in East Peoria, just look for the giant rooster! Carl’s offers some of the best donuts and pastries in town! Seriously sweet donuts, apple fritters, cinnamon rolls, and more can be found just next to this great photo-op.
 
14. The Sweet Shoppe  {Canton}  //  The Sweet Shoppe is Canton’s go-to spot for all things sugar. From hand-dipped malts to made to order sodas, old-fashioned sweets never tasted so good! The perfect place to gather for lunch, and to fill up on irresistible sweets.
 
15. The Confectionery  {Morton}  //  Whether you’re hosting a special event or just craving some sugar, The Confectionary offers a variety of made from scratch goodies. You’ll be dreaming about their delicious offerings, like their thumbprint cookies, all night long!

The Peoria Area College Student Bucket List

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on

					Aug. 09, 2022
				






Time flies in college and it’s over before you know it. Between classes, assignments, projects, and exams, it's easy to get caught up in the ‘on-campus’ lifestyle. So, before the time comes where you’ll be too busy applying for work or postgraduate studies, enjoy yourself by immersing in the Greater Peoria Area. From freshman to super-senior, get the most of your collegiate experience with the help of this ultimate Peoria Area college bucket list.  
 

 
Challenge Your Friends to Game Night — Need a break from studying? How about challenging the roommates to a friendly-competitive game night at one of these fun spots. Stop by Round1 at Northwoods Mall for a few games of bowling…or pool…or hit up the expansive arcade…or karaoke! Or head to the 8 Bit Arcade Bar and grab a round of drinks while enjoying endless free arcade games. This fun riverfront bar is a Peoria-first and truly one-of-a-kind—the wide variety of classic arcade games is rivaled by the impressive beer selection!
Flex Your Creativity  —  Whether it's girls night or date night, set aside the technicalities of calculus and flex your creativity at one of these DIY studios around the Peoria Area. Generations Candle Company is a creative shop that instructs its artsy guests on how to make one-of-a-kind, custom-fragranced candles. This ‘scent’sational treasure will enhance any college dorm or apartment. Peek In Pottery is a glazing studio with 12,000+ ceramic options to design and decorate however you wish. With a studio that tailors art instruction to be inclusive of needs and capabilities, this creative spot is an amazing experience for everyone. 
Catch a Game — Greater Peoria is home to three professional sports teams. Depending on the season, enjoy America's favorite pastime at Dozer Park, home of the Peoria Chiefs, or grab an iced-cold beverage and cheer on the 2022 President's Cup winners, the Peoria Rivermen, at the Peoria Civic Center. And don’t forget to cheer on the Flying Carps at a Peoria City USL2 Soccer game at Shea Stadium.
Scream (and Crawl) for Ice Cream  —  When writer's block is holding you back, replace it with a brain freeze instead. The Peoria Area has incredible ice cream shops—so many, in fact, if you tried every flavor, every week, at every location before graduation, it would take you 7+ years to get your degree. We aren’t kidding. Here’s just a few of our Ice Cream shops to crawl between: Yeni’s Palarte Mexican Ice Cream, Double D’s, Emo’s Dairy Mart, Dream Hut, FrozenSpoon, Emack & Bolio’s, Ice Cream Shack in both Peoria or Sunnyland, Twistee Treat, Bob’s Dairy Dream, Pinky’s, Uncle Bob’s Homemade Ice Cream, The Whip, Tall Bob’s Ice Cream Roundup, Pablo’s Ice Cream House, Little Land of Candy -N- More, Las Delicias Mexican Ice Cream, Ernie’s Dairy Dream, Swirls, Korner Island, Dream Hut, The Spotted Cow, 8th Street Sweet Spot, Sweet CeCe’s, Sucré Sweets and Socials, Lydia’s Dairy Barn, Stomping Ground Ice Cream, Toots Treats, Ollies Ice, Peaches Ice Cream, and more.
Enjoy the Sounds of Greater Peoria  —  Mainstream pop, indie rock, hip hop, punk, country, oldies, blues, or jazz—no matter your musical taste, you’ll find it live in Peoria any night of the week. The Twisted Spoke Saloon, Neon Bison, and The Hungry Moose are great options to listen to some tunes. Enjoy local bands in an Irish atmosphere at Kelleher’s Irish Pub and Eatery, Kenny’s Westside Pub, or West Dublin Pub. Sit back and sip some wine while you enjoy some tunes at Tres Rojas Winery, Spoon River Junction Winery, or Mackinaw Valley Vineyard. Or enjoy outdoor live music at Oliver’s in the Heights or at Pour Bros. Craft Taproom. Don't let being a college student on a budget stop you from enjoying the live music you love!
Customize Your Very Own Rock Island Trail Adventure — The Greater Peoria Area is home to the renowned Rock Island Trail, which magically combines outdoor adventure and local treats. Along the 26-mile biking and walking trail, adventurers can stop at multiple boutiques, restaurants, and shops along the way. We recommend stopping by the Missing Zither for an espresso martini on the patio of Keller Station. Make sure to hang in the beer garden at Industry Brewing, try your putty skills at Mt. Hawley Castle Golf, gear up at Bushwhacker, or check out Apricot Lane Boutique and the Fashionably Late resale boutique in Junction City, and munch on some chips and salsa over margaritas at Los Cabos, or chow down on a gyro at Kabab-G. The possibilities are endless!
Have a ’Wheel’y Fun Time — Whether you’re a gearhead, feel the need for speed, or want to get off campus, these unique adventures will fuel your Peoria Area discoveries. Grab your favorite beverages and a group of friends because it’s time to pedal-party!  Your Pedal Party is a regional-first! This custom 14-passenger cycle-powered pub will have you and your friends poppin’ bottles and pedaling through downtown Peoria Heights! Pitstop at Central Illinois Dragway for some good old-fashioned drag racing at one of Illinois longest running dragstrips. Leave your books in the dust and race over to Kartville for a day of go-karts, bumper boats, and off-road ATVs. Ride like an outlaw, and win like a champion!
Revel in a Majestic Movie Night — Sometimes a college-sized television just doesn't cut it for movie night. Luckily, the Peoria Area has some unique opportunities to jazz-up your viewing experience. The RiverFront Museum has a jaw-dropping venue for movie night. With a screen over five stories tall and seven stories wide, it extends beyond your field of vision making showtime at the Giant Screen Theater a completely lifelike experience! If you’re looking for a smaller independent experience, check out these cozy movie theaters of yesteryear—Town Theatre in Chillicothe, Majestic Theatre of Canton, and the Palace Theater in Elmwood prove history is not just for the classroom. But as historic as the vibes may be, tickets at all three retro theaters are apt for a college budget.

Greater Peoria’s Caffeine Buzz

By Discover Peoria on

					Feb. 12, 2023
				






Whether you’re a Peoria Area resident, or just passing through, we invite you to discover a unique sense of community and feel right at home in our local businesses. Check out this list of some of our favorite coffee shops, cafes, and eateries you’ll be eager to try. Make your way to these spots to unwind, caffeineate, and connect with our local communities. 
 
Black Maple Coffee  {Canton + Lewistown + Farmington}   //   Black Maple Coffee is a quaint coffee experience straight from a Hallmark movie! All three shops offer hot and iced beverages,  savory and sweet snacks made from scratch with quality ingredients, and friendly service. Stop in for a morning brew, lunch, or an afternoon pick-me-up, they have you covered.
 
Brickhouse Coffee Bar  {Minonk}   //  Brickhouse is a coffee house you must check out. This adorable shop with exposed brick and cozy nooks serves both unique and classic beverages. We highly recommend the salted caramel mocha latte, honey cinnamon cold brew, made-from-scratch gooey butter bars, lemon cake with cream cheese frosting, a strawberry guava lemonade, or just about anything from the menu---you truly can't go wrong! Stop in any time of the day for a quality experience and a delicious treat.
 
Café Santa Rosa  {Peoria}   //   Turn your work-from-home day into a treat at Café Santa Rosa, where farm-fresh imported coffee and a family feel are at the heart of what they do. Set up shop and make connections over a cup of much-needed caffeine, ordered from their wide selection of brews. 
 
Coffee Can  {Hanna City}   //   At Coffee Can, a cup of coffee can make any day brighter. Friendly faces will greet you in this uniquely designed coffee shop, made from shipping containers and filled with the smell of coffee and lots of joy. Stop in or drive through for a little bit of happiness in a cup. 
 
Coffee Connection  {Pekin}   //   Coffee Connection is the perfect place to meet new friends or connect with old ones. This charming shop is a local staple for a caffeine buzz and your daily dose of community! 
 
 [CxT] Roasting Co  {Peoria}   //   [CxT] Roasting Co is a locally owned roasting company dedicated to crafting the perfect cup of coffee. Their roasted-to-order model ensures that each sip is as fresh as it gets. Order ahead, stop in, or stock up for those cold mornings by shopping online to sip from the comfort of your own home. 
 
Dang Banh Mi and Poke  ​  {Peoria}   //   If you’re looking to change it up, perhaps boba is your new cup of tea. Dang Banh Mi and Poke offers a wide selection of boba tea, a sweet milk tea with tapioca pearls. Watch as your drink is prepared and sealed in front of you, and take a post-worthy snap of your first taste!
 
Eli's Coffee Shop ​  {Morton + Tremont + Metamora + Mackinaw}   //   Enjoy this quaint coffee shop for a hometown feel you’ll never get tired of. Eli's Coffee Shop will warm you up even on the coldest of winter days. Indulge in the Winter Drink Menu, perfect for cozying up indoors. 
 
Faire Coffee  {Peoria + Washington + Eureka}   //   Come to Faire Coffee for the friendly faces and stay for the welcoming atmosphere. Ask the baristas to whip up something special for you, and just like that, your new go-to has arrived. Faire values connection above all else, so while you’re there, make a friend or two. 
 
Frosted Bakery  {Princeville}   //   This small town, family-run bakery and coffee shop is a crowd pleaser. There has never been anything on the menu that was disappointing. The coffee is always fresh, the bakery items are perfection and your order is always served with a smile. Frosted Bakery will easily become your favorite spot to hang out in.
 
Happy Thoughts Coffee  {Chillicothe}   //   Happy Thought Coffee is nestled inside downtown Chillicothe's historic bank building built in 1868. Happy Thought Coffee has been a community staple for 25 years serving delightful beverages, quality lunch, and wonderful treats. This coffee house shares space with The Vault, a unique gift shop housed inside the old bank vault, stop in today to check out the cozy atmosphere.
 
Kickabrew Coffee Co.  {Kickapoo}   //   Head to Kickapoo for Kickabrew, a charming coffee shop with a small-town feel and delicious drinks. Enjoy one of three signature roasts, named after Kickapoo locations, and other tasty treats, and feel right at home in this unique spot. 
 
​Leaves ‘n Beans Cafe  {Peoria Heights + Morton + Pekin}   //   Hunker down at one of Leaves ‘n Beans’ three locations for a freshly brewed hot drink and a bite to eat. Enjoy this earthy and calming cafe with people who are just as passionate about a good cup of joe as you are.
 
MadMac's Coffee  {Germantown Hills}   //   New to the area, MadMac's Coffee is quickly becoming an area favorite. With a unique blend of beans roasted by [CxT] Roasting Co specifically for MadMac's, this charming coffee house is a great stop for a caffeine boost! While you're in, be sure to ask for the cheesecake flavors because this spot sells Triple Dipple's!
 
One Eleven Coffee  {Wyoming}   //   One Eleven Coffee is a café founded by three local friends with a passion for community and coffee. With each visit, expect flavorful beverages and satisfying noshes. Everything is made and served by a charming staff in a cozy, warm, and relaxing atmosphere rooted in collaboration with a buzz.
 
Regulator Roasting Company  {East Peoria}   //   Visit Regulator Roasting Company for a family-oriented atmosphere, and experience the roasting process yourself. Born out of necessity, Regulator Roasting understands those days when coffee is a must-have. This location doesn't serve brewed coffee but specializes in bean roasting. Regardless, check it out, you won't be disappointed.
 
The Blend Coffee  {Washington}   //   Spend all day curled up with a good book at The Blend. Appreciate the power of small businesses with a classic coffee shop feel, and commitment to community. Order a large, and grab a bag to take home while you’re at it!
 
The Spot Coffee​  {Peoria}   //   The Spot partners with other local businesses to bring you the best of what Illinois has to offer. From gourmet tea, to fresh baked goods, The Spot Coffee has it all. If you’re looking to indulge, this is the place to do it. 
 
thirty-thirty Coffee Co.  {Peoria}   //   Take your coffee obsession to a whole new level at thirty-thirty Coffee Co., where all the classics and then some are waiting for you. Their passionate baristas really know their stuff, so whether you're a novice or an expert, thirty-thirty Coffee Co. is there to serve you. 
 
Zion Coffee Bar   {Peoria}   //   Zion Coffee Bar’s commitment to farm-direct brews makes your trip, and your sip, worth it. Whether it’s coffee or tea, you’re bound to find something you love in this young and modern location, filled with great company and great coffee.

Rise and Shine with these Peoria Co. Breakfast Spots

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on

					Jul. 27, 2022
				






The Peoria Area has seen a mini growth-spurt of breakfast spots in the last few years. Narrowing this down to a manageable list of breakfast joints in Peoria County was challenging to say the least. Tackling the morning hungries just became effortless with these crowd favorites.

We’re not 'yolking', whichever breakfast route you follow—sweet, savory or maybe a bit of both—you’ll like these spots a 'waffle' lot!
 

 
The 50’s Diner   {{Peoria}}   //  This modern-meets-retro strip mall eatery is where folks come to tackle the Jukebox Combo and take selfies on the ’50s-vibing decor. Classic breakfast dishes are served all day at this family-owned and operated retro local favorite.
 
Childers Eatery   {{Peoria + East Peoria}}   //  Childers Eatery lays down such a mean morning meal—with good thick, crisp-chewy bacon, flaky house-made cheddar biscuits, and creamy homemade hollandaise. With three Peoria County locations, the locals are known to throw down s'mores French toast and conquer butternut squash-andouille-kale frittatas. Regardless of your mood, Childers will start your day with a classic American breakfast.
 
One World Cafe   {{Peoria}}   //  Elvis waffles. Breakfast quesadillas. Chicken and Waffles.  Truly, what more could you ask for from a breakfast menu? One World Cafe’s mission is to serve the Peoria Area with a globally-inspired menu and their kitchen does just that by serving creative interpretations on classic fan-favorites. There is something for everyone on One World’s seemingly endless menu.
 
Sweet Basil Cafe   {{Peoria}}   //   Head over to Sweet Basil Cafe for breakfast just the way you like it! This family-owned and operated spot prides itself on using the finest and freshest ingredients in everything they make, which means you can be sure their homemade biscuits and gravy were made with love AND quality ingredients. From every kind of omelet imaginable to crepes of every kind, this is a breakfast dream spot to wake up early for.
 
Gebby’s Family Restaurant   {{Peoria Heights}}   //   Gebby’s Family Restaurant is your spot for homestyle cooking! The extensive menu includes a build-your-own skillet, an endless variety of combination plates, and omelets—making an ‘egg’cellent stop to start your whole day.
 
Touch of Grey Cafe  {{West Peoria}}   //   Dinner and a show? How about breakfast and a concert! Okay, maybe the phrasing doesn't flow as well, but the concept is just as good! Stop by Touch of Grey Cafe for live music performances as you enjoy your morning coffee. This music-inspired cafe serves fan favorites like breakfast panini and a wide selection of bakery items. This joint is a great spot to spend your mornings.
 
Jubilee Cafe  {{Edwards}}   //   A late start to your day doesn't have to mean you miss breakfast thanks to Jubilee Cafe. Proudly serving breakfast all-day since 1990, the kitchen makes everything from scratch and it’s unmistakable! Try the hot, made-to-order apple fritters and you’ll fall in love with this cafe too. From the Kickapoo Special to the Hot Mess—whatever you order, you can’t go wrong.
 
Track Inn   {{Chillicothe}}   //   In about 50 years of business, this diner has earned its title as a breakfast spot many locals and visitors call their favorite! With customizable skillets, sweet-as-can-be pancakes, and a build-your-own breakfast, there is something for everyone at the Track Inn. This spot is complete with great service and a family-friendly atmosphere, so it's the perfect place to enjoy breakfast with the whole family!
 
Ardor Breads + Provisions   {{Peoria}}   //   Sometimes, sitting down at a restaurant for breakfast just doesn't fit in our busy schedules, but that shouldn't mean you miss out on a top notch breakfast. Just get it on the go! Stop by Ardor Breads + Provisions and pick up freshly baked bread, pastries, and one-of-a-kind toast options that you can enjoy anywhere! 
 
Thyme Kitchen   {{Peoria}}   //   Thyme Kitchen prides itself on providing an exciting and versatile experience to each and every one of its customers. Their brunch menu follows suit, bringing us classics we know and love, but with a twist! Omelets with goat cheese, lemon ricotta pancakes, and cajun shrimp and grits are just a few of the fun options that make brunch at this kitchen worth your “thyme”! 
 
Coffee Can  {{Hanna City}}   //  Have you ever had breakfast in a cargo container? After a stop by The Coffee Can, you can certainly say that you have! This breakfast spot is sure to bring you spectacular coffee and delicious breakfast sandwiches and bagels, and even better, a smile! The Coffee Cans' motto is that it's hard to be unhappy with a great cup of coffee in your hand, so stop by for a meal that's sure to make your day!
 
Bartonville Diner  {{Bartonville}}   //   Four words:  Breakfast. All. Day. Long. The Bartonville Diner is a quintessential Midwestern breakfast joint. This will become your new favorite if you're looking for a home-cooked classic. From French toast with all the toppings to scramblers with all fixings. Country-fried steak and eggs, buttermilk pancakes, biscuits and gravy, skillets, parfaits, and oatmeal, --all served with a neighborly smile and a hot steaming cup of coffee.

40 Ways to Celebrate Valentine’s Day

By Discover Peoria on

					Feb. 02, 2023
				






Whether you’re looking for a unique Valentine’s Day experience or staying traditional with a romantic dinner or a movie marathon, check out this list to inspire your holiday plans. So, call your Valentine, ‘Gal’entine, or ‘Pal’entine and explore what the Greater Peoria Area has to offer. Even Cupid will be jealous of your plans!

 
FANCY, FUN, + ROMANTIC DINNER
2Chez  {Peoria}  //  Which will you love more, the cozy and romantic atmosphere or the deliciously creative menu? Treat yourself and Bae to one of the best date night meals in Peoria.
 
Bernardi’s  {Washington}  //  Recreate the famous ‘noodle kiss’ from Lady and the Tramp over a mean plate of spaghetti and meatballs at Bernardi’s. This local mom and pop restaurant is serving upscale Italian food perfect for lovebirds.
 
Bistro 101  {Canton}  //  You will LOVE this downtown Canton bistro serving traditional comfort food with a gourmet twist. The aesthetic is charming, the staff is lovely, and the food is mouthwatering!
 
Black Band Distillery  {Peoria}  //  This boutique eatery is the crown jewel of the Warehouse District. Black Band is known for its craft cocktails and farm-to-table culinary experience. With such a vibrant atmosphere, Black Band is sure to be a staple in your date night rotation.
 
Connected  {Peoria}  //  Connected is a romantic and intimate hideaway preparing gourmet Italian and American entrees. If you’re looking for VIP service in a unique atmosphere, Connected is the place to go!
 
Corks by the River  {Havana}  //  Celebrate ‘Gal’entine's Day in style and meet the crew at the hottest slot machines in Havana.  With cheap drinks and local Mason County wine, this boutique gaming parlor is sure to take ‘Gal’entine’s to a whole new level.
 
Edge by Chef Dustin Allen  {Peoria Heights}  //  Walk into a contemporary dining space and farm-to-plate eating experience. Chef Dustin currates a romantic atmosphere and a creative rotating menu that won’t disappoint.
 
The Fish House  {Peoria}  //  The Fish House is sure to satisfy all appetites, specializing in fresh seafood, steak, chicken, and pasta dishes. From a party of 10 to an intimate dinner for two, reserve your Valentine’s Day table today.
 
Hearth Restaurant  {Peoria Heights}  //  This quaint American eatery has a robust wine and whiskey menu with elevated locally-focused fare. Homemade desserts and an extensive whiskey selection make Hearth Restaurant a no-brainer to enjoy with your Valentine. 
 
Jim’s Bistro  {Peoria Heights}  //  Jim’s Bistro in the Heights is a chophouse specializing in dry-aged steaks and seafood. Their large wine list and intimate surroundings make this spot a great option to spend with your sweetheart. 
 
Jim’s Steakhouse  {Peoria}  //   Building on its reputation of serving the finest quality beef available, this dining experience will make date night one to remember. Reserve your table at Peoria’s premiere steakhouse for Valentine’s Day! 
 
Jonah’s Seafood House  {East Peoria}  //  Nestled along the East bank of the Illinois River is the finest seafood in the region. This unique dining experience promises fresh eats, excellent service, and beautiful ambiance. Fantastic dining is not a privilege reserved for those in big cities—experience this treasure with your Valentine! 
 
Lariat Steakhouse  {Peoria}  //  This relaxing and intimate upscale dining experience is perfect for a comfortable and romantic evening. Every steak is hand-cut, in-house, and made to order—you and your Sweetie will love this local Peoria favorite!
 
Osaka Hibachi + Sushi Bar  {Peoria}  //  There’s not a bad seat at Osaka, but the best view is at the hibachi grill. Treat your date to a fun and interactive Valentine’s Day dinner around the hibachi station. 
 
Paparazzi  {Peoria Heights}  //   If you’re looking to take your Amore somewhere special on Valentine’s Day, try this hidden gem off the main drag in the Heights. Paparazzi serves classic Italian dishes so authentic each bite will momentarily transport you to the Lazio region in Italy. If you don’t already spend date nights here, try it this Valentine’s Day. 
 
Publik House  {Peoria Heights}  //  This local favorite has an old-world atmosphere mimicking a cozy London pub. Spend your Valentine’s Day in a casual spot with authentic English fare and American classics. It’s a great spot to toast Cupid.
 
Seasons Gastropub  {Morton}  //  This Valentine’s Day, enjoy a unique experience where innovative, high-quality food and exceptional service are always in season. This charming aesthetic spot is the perfect place to wine and dine with your partner-in-crime.
 
Suite Fire Bar + Grille  {Peoria}  //  Suite Fire is not your average hotel restaurant.… This upscale casual spot is the perfect stylish and elegant location to reserve on Valentine’s Day. Don't let the hotel trappings fool you, Suite Fire Bar and Grille is worth your attention—expect a lively atmosphere and memorable experience. 
 
Odie’s  {Chillicothe}  //  We guarantee your Valentine will love this uptown experience in downtown Chillicothe. This quaint, modern industrial atmosphere is a wonderful backdrop to a delectable menu. But don’t take our word for it….make your reservation today for Valentine’s Day today!
 
Untamed Chef  {Peoria}  //  From cocktails to cuisine, the Untamed Chef has mastered unique fare in an endearing atmosphere. With kitchen skills influenced from travels abroad, expect a menu filled with hints of Asian and Middle Eastern flair. We highly recommend treating your Valentine to the magic of the Untamed Chef.
 
Venezia Italian Bistro  {Pekin}  //   If you’re looking for an authentic, fresh, made-from-scratch Italian feast, we have a hidden gem for you and your Valentine! Head to Venezia Italian Bistro in North Pekin for melt-in-your-mouth Italian classics that will leave you and your partner stuffed and in love!

 
DATE NIGHT TO-DOS
Jukebox Comedy Club  {Peoria}  //  Hit up an open mic night or a comedy showcase at the Jukebox Comedy Club.  You may even find your new favorite comedian to foster a good case of the giggles. Laughing together will bring you and your partner closer than ever.
 
Roller Skating at Morton Roller Rink  {Morton}  //  Even if you're the most uncoordinated person on the planet, roller skating can bring you and your partner together by pushing you out of your comfort zone. And who knows, maybe you'll both end up discovering a secret talent! 
 
Wine + Cheese Night at Olio + Vino  {Peoria Heights}  //   Enjoy a favorite bottle of wine paired with a delectable charcuterie board at Olio + Vino. Don't forget the crusty bread, artisanal cheeses, cured meats and puckery olives to round it all out.
 
Catch a Movie at The Palace Theatre  {Elmwood}  //  Some date night ideas are just timeless—you and your Valentine brushing hands while reaching for popcorn at the same time—it’s adorable! Head to The Palace Theatre and share a Valentine’s Day popcorn with your crush.
 
Peoria Riverfront Museum  {Peoria}  //  Get a dose of culture by heading to the Peoria Riverfront Museum. Learning something new with your partner will spark fresh and interesting conversations.
 
Round 1  {Peoria}  //  Take your inner child out to play with a night full of street-racing games and Skee-ball at Round 1. Win your significant other's heart the old-fashioned way by winning your main squeeze one of those super-cheesy prizes. <3
 
Couple’s Massage at Senara Health + Spa  {Peoria}  //  You both work hard, you should relax just as hard. Rejuvenate your body and enhance your wellness with an appointment for you and your partner for a couples massage at Senara Health + Spa. You wont regret it!!
 
Ice Skating at Veterans Memorial Arena  {Pekin}  //  Whether you’re a pro or a newbie, skating with your sweetheart is as romantic as it sounds. Even if you fall, someone will be there to catch you! 
 
The Zone  {Peoria, Pekin}  //  Hold a game night on Valentine’s Day! For those with a competitive streak (or who just like some good, old-fashioned fun), an exciting night of board games will make Valentine’s Day memorable. Located on Downtown Pekin, in Northwoods Mall and in the Shoppes at Grand Prairie, visit The Zone for the hottest games this season.


 
VALENTINE’S DAY EVENTS
In celebration of the holiday, there are many Valentine’s Day themed events taking place in the area. See if any catch your eye. For the full list of Valentine’s Day activities, check out our calendar of events.
 
Broken Up at The Barn III  {Goodfield}  //  February 3-5, 10-12, 17-19, 24-26   //  Try an evening of dinner theater with this fast-paced comedy that takes a hilarious look at divorce and true love. Spend Valentine’s Day with dinner and a show at The Barn III.
 
St. Valentine’s Day Workshops with J. Draper Glass  {Peoria}  //  February 4, 11, 18, 25   //  J. Draper Glass is offering multiple dynamic Valentine’s Day glass blowing classes. Learn how to manipulate molten glass and trap air bubbles to create a beautiful heart-shaped paperweight, smooch bowl, flower, or glassware set.
 
Galentine's Day at Generations Candle Co.  {Peoria Heights}  //  February 9   //  Grab your gal pals for Galentine’s Day with some of your favorite locally owned women businesses. Expect a day of fun at Generations Candle Co with Embellished by Anna, Lil & E, and Liv Thai!
 
Yoga, Wine + Chocolate at Luthy Botanical Garden  {Peoria}  //  February 9   //  Start the night with a 45 minute yoga class taught by an instructor from the RiverPlex, surrounded by lush botanical plants at Luthy Botanical Gardens. Then, finish it off with a glass of wine and fine chocolates.
 
Dinner and Dancing with John Young at The Cookery  {Morton}  //  February 11   //  Looking for a truly unique evening to spend together in celebration of Valentine's weekend? Or how about the perfect gift for that couple who loves to hit the dance floor!? Even if you have two left feet, you will surely enjoy this brand new class that combines dinner with music and dance.  
 
Date Night at Generations Candle Co.  {Peoria Heights}  //  February 11 + 14   //  Mark your calendars for Date Night at Generations Candle Co. This Valentine’s Day special offers 2, 5oz pour-your-own candles, 2 cookies, and one polaroid to capture the moment. Keep the flame flickering <3
 
Galentine's Day II Chocolates, Cupcakes, Cake Pops and Truffles at The Cookery  {Morton}  //  February 13   //  Celebrate Valentine’s Day with those you love in the kitchen! This class will fill your sweet tooth and send you home with lots to share. Learn to make a menu of Hazelnut Ganache Truffles, Caramel Truffles, Chocolate Dipped Berries, Lovebug Cake Pops, Red Velvet Cake Pops, Oreo Truffles, and much more! 
 
Axe the Ex at Gone Axe Throwing {Peoria}  //  February 14   //  This event is dedicated to the broken-hearted. Single or not, bring a memento or write an ex’s name on the bullseye. Have some fun at this Anti-Valentine’s Day event. With drink specials on wine, who knows, maybe you’ll meet your next ex…

Peoria Symphony Orchestra presents Romance at The Peoria Civic Center  {Peoria}  //  February 18   //  Join the Peoria Symphony Orchestra, Maestro George Stelluto, aerial violinist Janice Martin, and the Central Illinois Ballet, for its annual Romance concert at the Peoria Civic Center Theater. This year's Romance concert has been designed in honor of the Peoria Symphony Orchestra’s 125th Season by our soloist, acrobatic violinist Janice Martin: romantic music from the Romantic Era.
