A Deep Dive Into the Peoria Area Swimming Pools

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on

					Jun. 24, 2022
				






Summers in the Peoria Area can get pretty hot. Luckily, Peoria and our surrounding region has plenty of poolside opportunities to beat the summer heat! Dip your toes or dive on into these great splash pads:
 
GWYNN FAMILY AQUATIC CENTER — Peoria
The Gwynn Family Aquatic Center is a great spot for family fun! This Peoria staple offers a zero depth pool with fun water equipment, a water slide, a diving well, and a wet sand play area! When it’s time for a sunshine escape,  the patio area has you covered with chairs and umbrellas.
 
LIMESTONE TOWNSHIP POOL — Bartonville
If you’re looking for open swim, aerobic opportunities, themed nights, or swimming lessons, the Limestone Township Pool is the perfect place. This splash pad offers a diving board, waterslide, and snack bar to keep the whole family entertained for hours.
 
METAMORA SWIMMING POOL — Metamora
This summertime hangout has a zero-depth kiddie pool, a lap pool, a diving well, water basketball, tot time, patio furniture, two playgrounds, and a concession stand with picnic tables! Head to the Metamora Swimming Pool to stay cool all season long.
 

DRAGONLAND WATER PARK — Pekin
This is the only water park in our Greater Peoria Area and is an amazing place for the whole family to splish and splash. With a zero-depth entry area, two water slides, a sand beach play spot, extensive patio lounge opportunities, and a full concession stand, this will quickly become one of your favorite summer hangouts.
 
PROCTOR RECREATION CENTER — Peoria
Head over to Proctor Recreation Center and enjoy an outdoor soak in either the splash pad, swimming area, or wading pool! Bring the whole crew—this facility also offers two gyms, an auditorium with stage, a lounge area with television, a weight room, an arts + crafts space, a game room, an outdoor basketball court, a playground, and a play field area. The Proctor Recreation Center is an all-in-one spot for summer fun.
 
ROANOKE PARK SWIMMING POOL — Roanoke
This Woodford County gem is an amazing escape from the summer heat. It hosts a zero-entry splash pool complete with refreshing water features, a slide, several diving boards, a pool that’s great for swimming laps, and a concession stand. These amenities make Roanoke Park Swimming Pool a perfect spot for a fun summer day!
 
MORTON PUBLIC SWIMMING POOL — Morton
Located at Idlewood Park, the Morton Public Swimming Pool is the perfect place to spend your summers in the sun. This pool features a zero-depth wading pool with an aquatic playground, two water slides, a lap pool and a diving well with two diving boards. Talk about limitless outdoor summer fun!
 
TREMONT COMMUNITY  POOL — Tremont
This Tremont splash pad offers a zero-depth wading pool, water slide, diving board, water basketball, and lap pool. It’s an absolute community gem that hosts swim meets, provides swimming lessons, has regularly scheduled tot time, provides aqua fitness, and is available for private parties. Keep yourself cooled off and check out the Tremont Community Pool.
 
WASHINGTON PARK POOL — Washington
Whether you are looking to relax in the sun or cool off in the water, the Washington Park Pool is a perfect summer hangout. This park features three pools including a zero-depth interactive play area, a competition pool with several lanes and two diving boards, and a wading pool with a slide. With a playground, plenty of lounge chairs and shade umbrellas, the Washington Park Pool is a favorite summer hangout.
 
FIVE POINTS WASHINGTON — Washington
The Five Points Washington indoor aquatic space is an amazing option for relief from the summer sun! Between the leisure pool with play equipment and the eight-lane lap pool, this swimming spot offers aquatic fitness classes, private swimming lessons, aqua volleyball, diving boards, and even has a basketball hoop! Five Points has something for everyone, so be sure to bring the whole crew.
 
SHORE ACRES POOL — Chillicothe
Check out this summer staple in Chillicothe! The facility features a large pool with two water slides, a diving well, zero-depth entry pool with play equipment, and a full-service concession stand. Shore Acres Pool is a one-stop-spot to beat the heat this summer.

Toast to 15 Tazewell Co. Breakfast Eateries

By Discover Peoria on

					Aug. 30, 2022
				






Tazewell County is a place where breakfast is made ‘over-easy' and you ‘butter’ believe they know their way around a breakfast menu. We love these Tazewell County breakfast spots a ‘brunch' —whether it’s simple and traditional, loaded with chorizo, piled high on country-fried steak, covered with maple syrup, or stuffed with smoked lox.
 
Here are 15 of the best, most glorious breakfast eateries for your morning feasting in Tazewell County. ‘Mimosa’ey on over and tell us your favorite.
 
Aunt Ginny’s Cafe    {{Morton}}   // Despite being new to the community, Aunt Ginny’s Cafe has certainly made a splash! Specializing in omelets, biscuits and gravy, and special breakfast horseshoe sandwiches, they've brought their a-game to Morton. Stop by for a breakfast you're sure to love. 
 
Busy Corner   {{Goodfield}}   //  With breakfast served until 1 pm and a menu full of everyone's favorite early morning foods, Busy Corner is the place to be! Whether you're an early bird or a late riser, you never have to miss out on made-from-scratch pancakes, countless omelets, or made-just-the-way-you-like-it skillets. Stop by for breakfast when you want it and enjoy it how you want it.
 
Childers Eatery   {{East Peoria + Peoria }}  // Childers Eatery lays down such a mean morning meal—with good thick, crisp-chewy bacon, flaky house-made cheddar biscuits, and creamy homemade hollandaise. With three locations, the locals are known to throw down s'mores French toast and conquer butternut squash-andouille-kale frittatas. Regardless of your mood, Childers will start your day with a classic American breakfast.
 
Common Ground Bakery and Cafe   {{Delavan}}   // Common Ground Bakery and Cafe puts a fun spin on conventional breakfast. With a menu with everything from cinnamon rolls to biscuits and gravy, breakfast subs to breakfast pizzas, you can stick to the classics or switch it up and try something new. Stop by for a bottomless cup of joe and try to enjoy all that Common Ground has to offer!
 
Cummins Family Restaurant   {{Washington}}   // All day breakfast in Washington, coming right up! Stop by Cummins Family Restaurant for omelets just the way you like them or maybe even french toast that's to die for. Cummins is sure to have everything you want in a delicious breakfast, so stop by and see for yourself!
 
Eddy’s Kitchen Family Restaurant   {{Mackinaw}}   //   New to Mackinaw, the menu at Eddy’s Kitchen is influenced solely by what Chef Eddy enjoys not only to cook but also to eat. With passion, creativity, and quality ingredients, Eddy’s Kitchen will soon become your favorite breakfast joint. From strawberry and nutella-stuffed french toast to skillets piled high with avocado and melted feta, this spot has fresh delicious breakfast items you’ll love. 
 
Eggcellent Cafe    {{East Peoria}}   //   Whether you're an early riser or like to sleep in, Eggcellent Cafe never fails to bring you endless breakfast options that you're sure to love. 6 types of eggs benedicts, crepes, limitless options of french toast and pancakes, mimosas, Blood Marys and Irish coffee are just a small part of their extensive and delicious menu!
 
Jack’s Cafe   {{Tremont}}   // Steak and eggs, breakfast sandwiches, and french toast are just a few of the options on Jack’s Cafe's seemingly endless breakfast menu. This family friendly restaurant is complete with excellent service and delicious food, so no matter when you stop by or what you order, you are sure to have an unforgettable experience! 
 
K’s Cafe   {{Minier}}   //  Calling all breakfast lovers! K’s Cafe is open early for a sunrise breakfast to help you start the day off strong. Whether it's their signature breakfast special or their delicious breakfast burritos, these top-notch options are the perfect start to an even better day.
 
Mackinaw Family Restaurant   {{Mackinaw}}   //   This homey restaurant is a spot for good ol’ fashioned home cookin’. Pancakes, waffles, and crepes in every flavor imaginable. Biscuits and gravy.  Breakfast sandwiches. Omelets. Skillets. Steak and eggs. Truly, what other classic fan-favorite could you ask for from a breakfast menu? 
 
Main Street Family Restaurant   {{Creve Coeur}}   //   Three words:  Breakfast. All. Day. This menu is packed with greasy-spoon classics—locally-sourced eggs made to order, piles of crispy hashbrowns, thick slabs of smoked bacon, hearty sausage gravy poured over fluffy biscuits, cheesy omelet, impressively tall skillets, melt-in-your-mouth pancakes smothered in orchard-fresh berries and cream—whatever you order, you can’t go wrong.
 
Mike’s Cobbler Corner Family Restaurant   {{Pekin}}   //   A late start to your day doesn't have to mean you miss breakfast, thanks to Mike’s Cobbler Corner. Proudly serving breakfast all-day long, the dishes that come out of this kitchen keep people coming back for generations! Try the hot cakes, hash browns, or any of their numerous omelets and you’ll fall in love with this hot spot, too.
 
Miss Vickie’s South  {{Morton}}  //  Head over to Miss Vickie’s South to enjoy breakfast and excellent service. Unique french toast options and a wide variety of skillets and omelets make up just a small part of their large menu. The sky’s the limit at Miss Vickie’s!
 
Olde Towne Bar and Grille   {{Delavan}}   //  Omelets, pancakes, biscuits, and gravy. What more could you need? This family owned and operated restaurant has been around for 25 years, and their delicious options have helped it earn its spot as a fan favorite. Olde Towne Bar and Grille in Delavan is the perfect spot to chow down on the breakfast foods you love! 
 
Washington Family Restaurant  {{Washington}}   //   Washington Family Restaurant is your spot for homestyle cooking with breakfast served all day! The extensive menu includes build-your-own skillet, an endless variety of combination plates, omelets, and pancakes—making this diner an ‘egg’cellent start to your day.
 

Photo References: The Shoppes at Grand Prairie (cover photo), Eggcellent Cafe (used above)

If The Spoon Fits:   36 Ice Cream Spots to Try

By Discover Peoria on

					Jul. 27, 2022
				






Today my friends, we have some very serious business to discuss.
It’s a centuries-old topic that’s both polarizing and uncomfortable, contentious, and cumbersome.
A topic that’s destroyed friendships…and broken family bonds.
A topic that causes even the great philosophers of our time to scratch their profound heads in perplexity.
It’s a topic that’s downright controversial, so brace yourselves…….
 
Today, we’re talking about the top spots for ice cream in the Peoria Area. Here are 36 of the most arguably popular spots in all the land. Which one has your heart?



Yeni’s Palarte Mexican Ice Cream   {Peoria Heights}


Double D’s   {Pekin}


Emo’s Dairy Mart   {Peoria}


Dream Hut   {Bartonville}


FrozenSpoon    {Germantown Hills}


Emack & Bolio’s   {Peoria Heights}


Ice Cream Shack    {Peoria + Sunnyland}


Twistee Treat    {East Peoria}


Bob’s Dairy Dream    {East Peoria}


Pinky’s   {Tremont}


Uncle Bob’s Homemade Ice Cream    {Eureka}


The Whip    {Wyoming}


Tall Bob’s Ice Cream Roundup    {Peoria}


Little Land of Candy -N- More    {Chillicothe}


Las Delicias Mexican Ice Cream    {Peoria}


Ernie’s Dairy Dream    {Peoria}


Swirls    {Bellevue}


Korner Island    {Marquette Heights}


8th Street Sweet Spot    {Pekin}


Sweet CeCe’s    {Peoria}


Sucré Sweets and Socials    {Morton}


Lydia’s Dairy Barn    {Eureka}


Stomping Ground Ice Cream    {Princeville}


Toots Treats    {Elmwood}


Ollie’s Ice    {Canton}


Peaches Ice Cream    {Havana}


Kona Ice  {mobile}


Brakers Market   {Eureka}


Happy Shack   {Canton}


Hannam's Dairy Dream   {Canton}


Jule's Ice Cream + Coffee   {Cuba}


The Sweet Shoppe   {Canton}


Theo's Ice Cream   {Peoria}


Scrolls   {Morton}


Fairview Ice Cream Center   {Fairview}


O's Rolled Ice Cream   {Farmington}

The ‘Hole’ List of Donut Shops in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Sep. 02, 2022
				






The donut has come a long way since its humble beginnings. What was once a less-than-fab pairing with a cup of less-than-fab cup of coffee at your local diner has now become the trendiest sweet treat out there. While the forever classic Old Fashioned-style donut will always be a cult favorite, the creations of different types of donuts has really taken this little fried piece of joy to a whole new level.
 
From being dipped in a maple balsamic glaze to having bits of bacon thrown on top and so much more, the donut has evolved into a work of art. Much like traveling to visit a favorite museum, we recommend traveling to try these top donut shops around Greater Peoria. Here are the places for donuts worth a road trip, regardless of how far you have to go:
 
Big Mike’s Donuts & Coffee   {{Bartonville}}
Carl’s Bakery   {{East Peoria}}
Frosted Bakery & Coffee Shop  {{Princeville}}
LeBakery  {{Peoria}}
Radish Kitchen    {{Peoria}}    //   Vegan 
Riley’s Vegan Sweets + Eats   {{Peoria}}    //   Vegan, also found at HyVee
Ron’s Donuts & Bakery   {{Washington}}
Supreme House of Cheese {{Toluca}}
Tadoughs  {{Pekin}}    //   Formally Spudnuts Donuts
Tanner’s Orchard  {{Speer}}    //    Seasonal
Trefzger’s Bakery  {{Peoria Heights}}
Yoder’s Homemade Donuts  {{Food Truck}}


 
Honorable Mentions:
Ardor Breads + Provisions   {{Peoria}}    //   Croissants + Pastries
Caleri's Café & Bakery  {{Roanoke + Eureka}}    //   Coffee Cake, Scones, + Muffins 
Eli’s Coffee    {{Metamora + Morton + Tremont}}    //   Scones, Breads, + Muffins 
Four30 Scones    {{Morton}}    //   Scones
Great Harvest Bread Co. {{Morton + Peoria}}   //   Tea Cakes, Scones, Cinnamon Rolls, Biscuits, Breads, + Muffins
Princess Creations  {{Canton}}   //   Cinnamon Rolls
The Confectionery    {{Morton}}    //   Coffee Cake + Muffins

11 Peoria Area Dog Parks

By Discover Peoria on

					Jul. 25, 2022
				






Avoid a ’ruff’ day. Have an un’fur’gettable time at one of these pet-friendly parks in the Peoria Area!

 
1. Brady Bark Park  {East Peoria}  //  Brady Bark Park is open year-round from dusk to dawn with areas for both small and large dogs.
 
2.  Duryea Dog Park  {Peoria Heights}  //  Built in the Fall of 2018, Duryea Dog Park is a fun place for your furry friend to play! 
 
3. Washington Bark District Park  {Washington}  //  Washington Bark District Park is the perfect place for furry friends to run, romp and socialize in safe and double-gated areas.
 
4. Happy Tails Dog Park at Mineral Spring Park  {Pekin}  //  Happy Tails Dog Park, maintained by the Pekin Park District, gives your dog the opportunity to run in a secure and fenced enclosure with double-gated entries, watering stations and areas for small and large dogs.
 
5. Walnut Dog Park  {Chillicothe}  //  Walnut Dog Park, maintained by the Chillicothe Park District, is fully fenced and includes a walking trail, special fencing and a water station.
 
6. Laura Bradley Dog Park  {Peoria}  //  Let your furry friend run at Laura Bradley Park, maintained by the Peoria Park District, located right by Bradley University. The park has double-gated entries as well as small and large dog enclosures.
 
7. Oakwood Dog Park  {Morton}  //  Oakwood Dog Park, maintained by the Morton Park District, has separate areas for large and small dogs as well as wooded and shady areas and a nearby playground.
 
8. Big Creek Park  {Canton}  //  Big Creek Park, maintained by the Canton Park District, has a large open grass space and trees for a fun pup park. With disc golf, a nearby playground, picnic area, dog park, skate park, sport fields/courts, a recreation center, and views of the Big Creek River, this park is excellent for everyone in the family.
 
9. Eagle Dog Park  {Marquette Heights}  //  Eagle Dog Park, maintained by the Pekin Park District, is located on the East side of Independence Park in Marquette Heights. This park has open grass space and trees with a great 0.5 milk walking path.
 
10. Lakeland Park  {Canton}  //  Lakeland Park, maintained by the Canton Park District, has a dog park approximately 1/2 mile from main entrance. This large and beautiful park has a wide variety of activities/amenities besides a dog park. It's a great park and a wonderful spot to watch the sunset.
 
11. Lake Eureka Park  {Eureka}  //  Lake Eureka Park has a beautiful dog park nestled into 240 acres of parklands with separate areas for large and small dogs as well as wooded and shady areas and a nearby playground.

Fall Foliage in Greater Peoria

By Discover Peoria on

					Oct. 10, 2022
				






Our neck of the woods puts on a seasonal show like nowhere else—and stunning foliage is just the beginning. Nearly everyone can agree one of the most magical parts of autumn is watching the leaves transform from lush green to bright orange and deep red. Like clockwork, we begin to reach for seasonal favorites like spiced lattes and hot cider, whip out our coziest sweaters and knitted scarves, and head outside to take in the cooler temperatures and fall foliage.  
 
With autumn in full swing, it’s the perfect time to hit the road for leaf-peeping in the Illinois River Valley. We’re sharing 14 of our favorite spots in Greater Peoria for autumn views of the changing hues.


 
Black Partridge Park  {Metamora}    //    Black Partridge Park is the crown jewel of the Metamora Park District system. It offers 450 acres of beautifully maintained trails to hike, mountain bike, run, jog and leaf-peep.
 
Eagles Landing Observation Tower  {Chillicothe}    //    Eagles Landing Observation Tower gives onlookers the chance to admire eagles and wildlife from an uninterrupted 50-foot view above the Illinois River. The Observation Tower is an amazing location to watch the annual progressive changing of the leaves.
 
EastPort Banquet Center  {East Peoria}    //    The tower at the East Port Banquet Center offers an unparalleled opportunity to enjoy the autumn colors against the Peoria skyline and within the nautical landscape of the Illinois River.
 
Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge  {Lewistown}    //    Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge is a 2600-acre wildlife refuge that abuts Emiquon Preserve and is part of an 11,000-acre wildlife refuge complex. With a mix of forests, prairies, wetlands and river views, Emiquon's mosaic wetlands reflect the autumn trees during sunset making this refuge a must-visit during peak foliage season.
 
Farmdale Reservoir  {East Peoria + Washington}    //    With approximately 15 miles of trails, Farmdale Reservoir is an excellent mix of fast open stretches and tight, twisty singletrack, with many fun gravity dips and ravines. The trails are shared by hikers, mountain bikers, and horseback riders. Sections of the Reservoir have been returned to native tallgrass prairie, while others are mature Oak-Hickory forests—making this park amazing for bird watching, photography, and leaf-peeping.
 
Fon du Lac Drive Lookout Points {East Peoria}    //    Along Fon du Lac Drive in East Peoria, there are various lookout points to stop and absorb the magnificent views of the Illinois River and Peoria Skyline. This vantage point in autumn is ablaze with beautiful fall colors reflected in the water. Bring your camera and capture the perfect photos of the colorful fall leaves along the river. 
TIP:  Use “401-525 Fondulac Dr” in your GPS to find one of the lookout points
 
Grandview Drive  {Peoria Heights}    //    Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, Grand View Drive is a 2.52 mile meandering pleasure drive and park that offers scenic views of the Illinois River. It’s not named “The World’s Most Beautiful Drive” for nothing—this scenic road through Peoria and Peoria Heights offers clear views of the Illinois River valley as well as some of the most prestigious and historic homes in the area. 
TIP:  Use “Pimiteoui Trailhead” in your GPS
 
Havana Riverfront Park  {Havana}    //    This stunning shady park is a bird watching and leaf-peeping hotspot. Havana Riverfront Park is a linear park with ample walking trails along the east bank of the Illinois River. On the park’s bluff (at the terminus of Main Street) is an observation deck and raised boardwalk nestled in a grove of American elm, red maple, mulberry, northern catalpa, and black locust trees. The deck and raised walkway are perfect spots to soak in the autumn foliage.

 
Lacon Riverside Marina  {Lacon}    //    Lacon Riverside Marina is an adorable city park and marina on the Illinois River. The view of the Lacon Bridge—one of the oldest crossings of the Illinois River—with an explosion of autumn hues in the fall leaves is a true autumnal assault on all the senses.
 
Rock Island Trail  {Dunlap, Peoria Heights, Princeville, Wyoming, Toulon}    //    This 26 mile section of crushed smooth limestone cuts through the towns of Dunlap, Peoria Heights, Princeville, Wyoming and terminates in Toulon. The trail is excellent to bike, walk, or jog and every aspect of the route leads to stunning views of the seasonal foliage.
 
Rocky Glen Park  {Peoria}    //    Rocky Glen Park is a local treasure. It is 126-acres of forest, hills, and streams. Lace up your hiking boots and check out this park. Although hills are steep and the box canyon requires some creek crossing, the rock formations are similar to those at Starved Rock State Park. There are periodic benches along the trails and perfect resting spots to stop and take in the autumn scenery and wildlife. 
 
Sand Ridge State Forest  {Forest City}    //    Sand Ridge is an island in a sea of agriculture. As the largest Illinois State Forest, it boasts sweeping expanses of native oak-hickory, extensive plantations of pine, sprawling open fields, grasslands, and completely unique sand prairies. The raw, undeveloped expanses of hardwood and pine blanketing the panoramic vistas contain miles of outstanding hiking, backpacking, snowmobiling, horseback riding and leaf-peeping opportunities. 
 
Sankoty Lakes  {Spring Bay}    //    Sankoty Lakes is a world-class wilderness retreat offering outdoor recreation, education and relaxation experience. Nestled on the banks of the Illinois River at the edge of the Sankoty Aquifer, autumn hues compliment this beautiful retreat. Spend a few days at Sankoty to bask in the autumn glory, cozy around the campfire, and roast marshmallows.
 
Tower Park  {Peoria Heights}    //    The feature of Tower Park is a 200-foot water tower with exterior glass elevator providing seasonal access to the top viewing decks. For an uninterrupted, 360-degree view of autumn in all its glory, climb (or ride) to the top of this beautiful Peoria Heights staple and checkout the fall foliage.


 
Enjoy miles of red, yellow, and orange while playing in the local pumpkin patches and apple orchards >>

16 Revolutionary Ways To Celebrate 2022 Independence Day

By Discover Peoria on

					Jun. 28, 2022
				






This Fourth of July is booming with exciting events to celebrate Independence Day in Greater Peoria. 
Prepare yourself for a long weekend of patriotic music, tri-corner hats, stars and stripes, cold beverages, barbeques, and fireworks! Bring out the red, white, and blue for the 4th of July, as we honor Independence Day with these 16 revolutionary Peoria Area celebrations:
 
Concert for the City:  FT. Jordan Feliz and Victor Solomon
Saturday July 2, 2022   //   6-10pm
Dozer Park—Downtown Peoria
Admission:  $25 per ticket
 
God Bless America:  A Patriotic Gospelfest
Saturday July 2, 2022   //   7-8:30pm
Five Points Washington—Washington
Admission:  FREE
 
Mason County Fireworks 2022
Saturday July 2, 2022   //   10am-dusk
Riverfront Park—Havana
Admission:  FREE
 
Peoria Speedway Fireworks
Saturday July 2, 2022   //   3pm-dusk
Peoria Speedway—Peoria
Admission:  Adults $10, Kids 10-Under free
 
Glen Oak Park Fireworks
Sunday, July 3, 2022   //   8pm-dusk
Glen Oak Park—Peoria
Admission:  $3
 
Morton Community Independence Day Celebration
Sunday, July 3, 2022   //   dusk
McClallen Park—Morton
Admission:  FREE
 
4th of July Honor America Celebration at Memorial Stadium
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   8-10pm
Memorial Stadium—Pekin
Admission:  Ages 13 and up $5 per person, Ages 6-12 $1 per person, ages five and under are free, Veterans and active military personnel receive free admission
 
Chillicothe July 4th
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   5:30pm-dusk
Three Sisters Park—Chillicothe
Admission:  FREE
 
Elmwood Fireworks
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   dusk
Sweetwater Park—Elmwood 
Admission:  FREE
 
Food Truck Frenzy & Fireworks at Eureka Lake
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   10am-11pm
Eureka Lake—Eureka
Admission:  FREE
 
20th Annual Fourth of July Family Fun Fest:  Boys and Girls Club of Greater Peoria fundraiser
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   5pm-dusk
Kelleher's Irish Pub—Downtown Peoria
Admission:  $250 for 8 adults, children 5 and under are free—includes two parking passes and food
 
Peoria Chiefs Game at Dozer Park
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   5:35pm
Dozer Park—Downtown Peoria
Admission:  Tickets start at $12
 
Red White and Boom
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   6pm-dusk
Peoria + East Peoria Riverfront—Peoria and East Peoria
Admission:  FREE

 
____
 
NON-FIREWORK CELEBRATIONS
Fourth of July at Sankoty Lakes
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   5pm-9pm
The Woolly Bugger—Spring Bay
Admission:  FREE
 
Peoria Jaycees Firecracker 5000
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   6:30-7:30am
Downtown Peoria—Peoria
Admission: $40
 
West Peoria 4th of July Parade
Monday, July 4, 2022   //   10am-12pm
Starting at Sterling and Rohmann Ave—West Peoria
Admission:  FREE
 
 
FIREWORKS IN A SNAPSHOT









Saturday, July 2


Sunday, July 3


Monday, July 4




Concert for the City
			 

			God Bless America: A Patriotic Gospelfest
			 

			Mason County Fireworks 2022
			 

			Peoria Speedway Fireworks


Glen Oak Park Fireworks
			 

			Morton Community Independence Day Celebration


4th of July Honor America Celebration at Memorial Stadium
			 

			Chillicothe July 4th
			 

			Elmwood Fireworks
			 

			Food Truck Frenzy & Fireworks at Eureka Lake

Get Outside:  Bike Peoria 2022!

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 18, 2022
				






The following is a compilation of different group rides and biking opportunities for some two wheeled fun around the Peoria Area. Everything is arranged by date. For further information contact the respective club or noted trip leader. Thank you for all of the groups that are leading the way!

﻿WEEKLY 2022 REOCCURRING RIDES
Monday   //   10am start from Methodist Church in Dunlap lead by Bill Semmens. Contact bsemmens5@comcast.net  IVW Ride*
Monday   //   5:30am start Farmdale to East Peoria lead by NOLB (No One Left Behind) and the Peoria Area Mountain Bike Association
Monday   //  8am start from McClellen Park, May 2 through Oct 30. Morton’s Level 1 Ride, 30-40 miles. Contact Al Wenninger at alcycle200@gmail.com   IVW Ride*
 
Tuesday   //   Locations very but usually northwest Peoria area. Start times vary. Starting date is year round depending on weather. Distance is 20 to 40 miles. Level one no drop lead by Steve Jensen and Randy Swenson. Contact LO Rides of Peoria on Facebook.   IVW Ride*
Tuesday   //   6:00am start from the Trek store in Peoria Heights. Usually between 20 and 25 miles. Contact sales@trekbicyclepeoria.com or 309-966-1239
Tuesday   //   6pm from Dunlap Elementary School in Dunlap, across from the library lead by Steve Kurt.   IVW Ride*
 
Wednesday   //   10am start time from the Methodist Church in Dunlap lead by Bill Semmens. Watch emails for changes (bsemmens5@comcast.net)  IVW Ride*
 
Thursday   //   9am start time from Russell's Cycling & Fitness in Washington lead by owned Joe Russell.   IVW Ride*
 
Friday   //   6pm Friday Night Fast Rides from Independence Park lead by the Peoria Area Mountain Bike Association  
 
Saturday   //   Locations very but usually northwest Peoria area. Start times vary. Starting date is year round depending on weather. Distance is 20 to 40 miles. Level one no drop lead by Steve Jensen and Randy Swenson. Contact LO Rides of Peoria on Facebook.  IVW Ride*
 
 
**IVW (Illinois Valley Wheelmen)  //   First 3 rides are free, then an annual membership of $15 is required.
 

 
RIDING EVENTS BY MONTH
JULY
July 20, 2022   //   Wednesday. East Peoria to Goodfield ride -meeting at 8:30 AM. Fondulac park district parking near the caboose. Lunch will be in Goodfield at the Busy Corner Cafe-expect 35 miles. IVW Out of the Box series. 
July 28, 2022   //   Thursday. Springdale cemetery ride. Start at the Peoria riverfront museum at the Water Street entrance. 6:00 PM. Highlights. Discover how large the cemetery really is and how much of yours history is hidden within as we ride all of the lives of the cemetery. 
 
AUGUST
August 4, 2022   //   Thursday. Solar system ride. Start at the Donovan Park parking lot. 6:00 PM. Highlights. Starting at Jupiter, follow the Rock Island Greenway past the terrestrial planets to the sun at the Peoria Riverfront museum and back. We will be returning just after sunset to observe the first quarter moon, Jupiter and Saturn at the Northmoor observatory -a historic 109 year old landscape. 
August 5, 2022   //   Friday. 9 PM to 10:15 PM. Meet at the bike Peoria co-op for a casual monthly first Friday night ride around town. The event is free and open everyone. Bring your bike, a helmet, and a good headlight, and will guide you on an easy paced loop around the West Bluff and West Peoria neighborhoods. For those wishing to go a bit farther, we may venture out again after that with renewed vigor and deeper into the night. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
August 20-21, 2022   //   PAMBA Wildlife Wild Festival Illinois MTB State Championship Race 
August 11, 2022   //   Thursday. 50s Soft Serve ride. Starting at corner of Lake and Knoxville. 6:00 PM. Highlights. Ride to a classic soft serve ice cream stand 
Aug 12, 2022   //   Friday . Comalara Park to Lake Bloomington with lunch at Lake Road Inn. Mileage and time to be determined. IVW Out of the Box series. Check the IVW website and Facebook page 
August 13, 2022   //   Saturday. 8 AM. Breakfast ride downtown to Garden St., Café. Meet at Martini’s downtown by 8 AM. Cruise at a leisurely pace of 10 miles an hour to and from the Garden St., Café. It is about 1.9 miles each way. After the event you can check out the Peoria farmers market. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
August 21, 2022   //   The West Adventure. Gravel Dogs/Robert Woo. The Adventure Ride series was created to encourage group rides. Route and milage to be posted on Gravel Dogs Facebook page. Sponsored by Robert Woo
August 24, 2022   //   Friday. Alpaca ride departing from Pierce community center, 610 West Cedar St., Chillicothe, 9 AM. Visiting an alpaca farm which is about 18 miles from the start. Lunch is at the Lucky dog pub and eatery at 701 N. 4th St. in Chillicothe following the ride. Mileage 32 miles. IVW Out of the Box series. 
 
SEPTEMBER
September 2, 2022   //   Friday. 9 PM to 10:15 PM. Meet up at the bike Peoria co-op for a casual monthly first Friday night ride around town. But that is free and open to everyone. Bring your bike, helmet, and a good headlight, and will guide you on an easy paced loop around the West Bluff and West Peoria subdivisions. 
September 7, 2022   //   Wednesday. Tanners ride. 9 AM. Leaving from the Pearce community center at 610 W. Cedar St. in Chillicothe. Lunch at Tanners and returning a different route down Lake Shore Drive, Hallock Hollow, and Cloverdale Road. Mileage 35 miles. IVW Out of the Box series 
September 10, 2022   //   Saturday. 8 AM to 12 PM. Breakfast ride downtown to Fox pub. Join your friends and family for a casual breakfast ride. Meet at Martinez downtown by 8 AM. Cruise at a leisurely pace of 10 miles an hour to and from the fox pub. It is about 9 miles each way. After the event you can check out the Peoria farmers market on the riverfront. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
Sep 16,17,18, 2022   //   PBJ (Peoria Bikepacking Jamboree) RIDE….2-3 DAY BIKEPACKING TRIP AROUND CENTRAL ILLINOIS.  Yeah baby. You read that right. This ride has some different options. Option one…2 day/1 night bikepacking and camping trip to Johnson Sauk Trail State Park. I have a spot for 50/FIFTY people to camp that night. You can bike up, camp, bike back. Taking the Rock Island Trail for half the trip, back roads for the rest.  Option two…3 day/2 night. Biking up to and Camping at Johnson Sauk with everyone else, but then instead of biking back to Peoria on day two, we’ll continue on to Starved Rock to camp the next night. Limited camping spots reserved at Starved Rock. Second day we take the Hennepin Canal Trail and Illinois Michigan Canal Trail to Starved Rock. Put on by yours truly/Mark Monge/Peoria Outdoor Adventure 
September 21, 2022   //   Wednesday. Leaving from Russell cycle in Washington at 9 AM to upper Spring Bay Road using back roads and returning on Metamora/Washington blacktop. Estimate 30 miles. Lunch at Kep’s Bar and Grill at 414 Mile Rd. in Washington. Sponsored by IVW
September 25, 2022   //   The Trinty Adventure Ride. Gravel Dogs/Robert Woo. The Adventure Ride series was created to encourage group rides. You can get a book by attending ANY Sunday ride we do, doesn't even have to be one of the Adventure rides. See Robert on a Sunday ride - bring your $10 cash and you'll get a book. Only 50 passport books exist, so when they're gone, they're gone. Route and mileage will be posted. Sponsored by Robert Woo / Gravel Dogs 
 
OCTOBER
Oct 2, 2022   //   The Dutchman Classic. Gravel Dogs/Robert Woo. The Adventure Ride series was created to encourage group rides. You can get a book by attending ANY Sunday ride we do, doesn't even have to be one of the Adventure rides. See Robert on a Sunday ride - bring your $10 cash and you'll get a book. Only 50 passport books exist, so when they're gone, they're gone. Can't make one of the adventure ride dates but don't want to miss your sticker? No problem, you have until November to do any/all 9 routes . Route and milage will be posted. Sponsored by Robert Woo/ Gravel Dogs 
October 7, 2022   //    Friday. 9 PM to 10:15 PM. First Friday night ride. Meet up at the Bike Peoria co-op for a casual monthly first Friday night ride around town. The event is free and open to everyone. Bring your bike, helmet, and a good headlight, and they will guide you on an easy pace loop around West Bluff and West peoria neighborhoods. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
October 8, 2022   //   Saturday. Third annual Mural Ride around Peoria. 9 AM start from the Riverfront Museum, Water Street entrance. See Peoria Outdoor Adventure Facebook and website page for additional info and alternative routes. View over 60 murals throughout Peoria and downtown. 7 mile loop at 9am, or 21 mile loop starting at 7:45 am from Bushwhacker. Sponsored by Peoria Outdoor Adventure/Mark Monge 
October 15, 2022   //   Saturday. 8 AM to 12 PM. Breakfast ride from Junction City to Mayflower Café. Meet at Bushwhacker in Junction City by 8 AM. Cruise at a leisurely pace of 10 miles an hour to and from the Mayflower Café in Dunlap. It is about 9.4 miles each way. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
Oct 16, 2022   //   The Big 150 Adventure Ride. Gravel Dogs/Robert Woo. The Adventure Ride series was created to encourage group rides. You can get a book by attending ANY Sunday ride we do, doesn't even have to be one of the Adventure rides. See Robert on a Sunday ride - bring your $10 cash and you'll get a book. Only 50 passport books exist, so when they're gone, they're gone. Can't make one of the adventure ride dates but don't want to miss your sticker? No problem, you have until November to do any/all 9 routes. Sponsored by Robert Woo/Gravel Dogs 
 
NOVEMBER
November 4,2022   //    9 PM to 10:15 PM. First Friday night right. Meet up at the Bike Peoria co-op on Main Street for a casual monthly first Friday night ride around town. The event is free and open to everyone. Bring your bike, a helmet, and a good headlight, and they will guide you on an easy paced loop around the West Bluff and West Peoria neighborhoods. For those wishing to go a bit farther, we may venture out again after that with renewed vigor and deeper into the night. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
November 12, 2022   //   Saturday. 8 AM to 10 AM. Breakfast ride from Junction City to Pizza Works. Jump on your bike and go for a casual breakfast ride. Meet at Bushwhacker in Junction City by 8 AM. Cruise at a leisurely pace of 10 miles an hour to and from Pizza Works. The route is about 2.2 miles each way.  
 
DECEMBER
Dec 2, 2022   //   9 PM to 10:15 PM. First Friday Night Ride. Meet up at the Bike Peoria co-op on Main Street for a casual monthly first Friday night ride around town. The event is free and open to everyone. Bring your bike, a helmet, and a good headlight, and we will guide you on an easy paced loop around the West Bluff and West Peoria neighborhoods. For those wishing to go a bit farther, we may venture out again after that with renewed vigor and deeper into the night. Sponsored by Bike Peoria 
 

 
﻿2022 REOCCURRING OPPORTUNITIES TO GET INVOLVED
PAMBA (Peoria Area Mountain Bike Association) Trail Work. Come out and join a great group of people interested in maintaining and expanding the area's trail systems. Further information available on the PAMBA Facebook page.  
Kinsey Park // every Tues at 5:30 
Wildlife Prairie Park // Every Wed at 4:45 
Farmdale // Every Thursday at 5:30 
Fort Creve Coeur // Every Wednesday 5:30 (and Sunday)
 

 


Check out the full story here! For more Peoria Area recreational tips, tricks, outdoorsy opportunities, and adventures follow @PeoriaOutdoorAdventure on Facebook.

Author
Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure
The Peoria Area has an abundance of exciting outdoor opportunities, which are often overlooked by visitors and residents. Peoria Outdoor Adventure was created to combine the very best of our LOCAL outdoor clubs, groups, and restaurants that make Greater Peoria an adventurous place. The Greater Peoria Area is loaded with hundreds of miles of trails, thousands of acres of creeks, rivers and parks, and an untapped potential.
Check out PeoriaOutdoorAdventure.com for hidden midwestern resources and gems.

How to Make a Local Farm Fresh Thanksgiving

By Discover Peoria on

					Oct. 10, 2022
				







Now is the time to start planning your holiday gatherings. Before you go out and buy a frozen store turkey, consider these local family farms by buying a local farm-fresh, pasture-raised turkey for Thanksgiving. Take the Local Thanksgiving Challenge, and support local farms and shops this Thanksgiving.
 
Keep reading for locally grown vegetables to accompany your farm-fresh turkey, available pie ingredients, and where to pre-order your baked goods and desserts for the holiday season.
 
LOCAL FARM-FRESH TURKEY
Preorder ASAP
 
Alwan + Sons Meat Company  {Peoria}    //     Call to reserve a fresh or frozen turkey! Order ASAP—Alwan + Sons sell out every year
 
Bittners Eureka Meat Locker  {Eureka}    //     Hickory smoked farm-fresh turkeys, frozen turkey, fresh farm-fresh turkeys, or BYOT (bring your own turkey) and Eureka Meat Locker will smoke it for you—orders begin November 1, 2022
 
Braker’s Market  {Eureka}   //   Hickory smoked, fully-cooked turkeys will be available to purchase along with smoked and spiral hams
 
Christ Orchard  {Elmwood}    //     Order your farm-fresh turkey ASAP— taking orders until all birds are reserved 
 
Elmwood Meat Products  {Elmwood}    //     Hickory smoked turkey breast available—preorders begin Oct 31, 2022

Little Blue’s Farm  {Morton}    //     To guarantee your Thanksgiving bird order ASAP and definitely by mid-November. If turkey isn’t on your menu, Little Blue’s Farm offers beef tenderloin and whole hams for your holiday feast too
 
Pottstown Meat + Deli  {Peoria}    //     Order ASAP for an Amish-raised, free range turkey! Turkey breast and honey spiral hams are also available for your Thanksgiving feast
 
Prairie Creek Pastures  {Tremont}    //     Reserve your pastured turkey ASAP. These birds are raised on pasture, no antibiotics, no drugs, and GMO-Free
 
Raber Packing Co.  {West Peoria}    //     Frozen and smoked turkey available—orders begin November 1, 2022
 
Red River Farms  {Eureka}    //     Specializing in pasture-raised turkeys, Red River Farms has a first pay, first pick process. So, if your family needs a certain sized bird, it's best to get the order in as soon as possible. Red River Farms will be taking orders until all 60 pasture-raised birds are reserved
 
Roth Turkey Farm  {Forrest}   //   Fresh (never frozen), all natural, processed, federally-inspected turkeys from an all vegetable diet, with nothing added or injected. Order your turkey early!! Roth Turkey Farm does sell out each year
 
Yordy Turkey Farm  {Morton}    //     Order ASAP! As of late September, Yordy Turkey Farm has 6,000 of their 10,000 birds left to reserve but they sell out every year! The Yordy team will try to accommodate walk-ins but it won't be a guarantee
 
 
 
APPETIZERS
Preorder Now
 
Supreme House of Cheese  {Toluca}    //   Holiday cheese and salami trays
 
 
 
VEGETABLE SIDES
Grab now and freeze or cellar store for Thanksgiving
 
 
Braker’s Market  {Eureka}  //   Green beans, Brussels sprouts, turnips, collard greens, onions, and potatoes
 
Crooked Row Farm Illinois  {Chillicothe}   //  Tomatoes, green beans, radishes, turnips, and collard greens
 
Garden Spot Vegetable Farm  {Princeville}   //   Cabbage, Brussel sprouts, carrots, and potatoes

R. E. Arends Orchard   {Laura}   //   Garden produce like squash, tomatoes, and peppers
 
 
 
PUMPKIN + SQUASH DISHES
Grab now and freeze or cellar store for Thanksgiving
 
 
Ackerman Family Farms  {Morton}   //   Many varieties of autumn and winter squashes 
 
Braker’s Market  {Eureka}   //   Squash including acorn, butternut, spaghetti, and pumpkins
 
Christ Orchard  {Elmwood}    //     15 varieties of squash including acorn, butternut, spaghetti, and more
 
Garden Spot Vegetable Farm  {Princeville}   //   Winter squash
 
R. E. Arends Orchard   {Laura}   //   Butternut squash, pumpkins, gourds
 
Schaer’s Country Market  {East Peoria}   //   Pumpkins, gourds 

Tanner’s Orchard  {Speer}    //     Squash, pumpkins
 
 
 
PIE INGREDIENTS
Grab now and freeze or cellar store for Thanksgiving
 
Ackerman Family Farms  {Morton}   //   Sugar pie pumpkins
 
Braker’s Market  {Eureka}   //   Sugar pie pumpkins, apples, frozen fruit from this season, pecans, and cranberries
 
Broad Branch Farm  {Chillicothe}    //     Eggs 
 
Christ Orchard  {Elmwood}    //     Apples and sugar pie pumpkins
 
Crooked Row Farm Illinois  {Chillicothe}  //   Sugar pie pumpkins, pears, and frozen raspberries from this season
 
Garden Spot Vegetable Farm  {Princeville}   //   Apples
 
Hilly Lane Pumpkins and Fresh Produce  {Sparland}   //   Apples and sugar pie pumpkins
 
Partridge Point Orchard  {Metamora}   //   9 varieties of apples
 
Pleasant Row Orchard  {Cuba}   //   Apples, peaches, and cherries
 
R. E. Arends Orchard   {Laura}  //   Apples and sugar pie pumpkins
 
Roth Pumpkin Patch  {Morton}   //   Sugar pie pumpkins  (Season ends Oct 31!)
 
Tanner’s Orchard  {Speer}    //     Apples, sugar pie pumpkins, and cranberries
 
 
 
BAKED GOODIES + SWEETS
Preorder pies and other bakery treats
 
ARDOR Breads + Provisions   {Peoria}    //   Dinner rolls, crescents, baguettes to dry for stuffing

Braker’s Market  {Eureka}   //   Dinner rolls, bread cubes for stuffing, and whole pies
 
Caleri's Café & Bakery  {Roanoke}    //   Selection of pre baked pies, dinner rolls, and crescent rolls
 
Frosted Bakery  {Princeville}    //   Whole freshly baked pies and sweet rolls
 
Great Harvest Bread Co.  {Morton + Peoria}   //   Rosemary + chive dinner rolls, basil + oregano dinner rolls, and wheat + white Virginia rolls, stuffing bread with onions, celery, sage and thyme to make into stuffing, pumpkin chocolate chip bread, and cinnamon swirl bread
 
LeBakery  {Peoria}    //   Dinner rolls, bread cubes for stuffing, whole pies
 
Mike’s Cobbler Corner  {Pekin}    //    Homemade fresh whole pies
 
R. E. Arends Orchard   {Laura}  //   Pre-order ASAP—pumpkin cheesecake, cider donuts, caramel apples, pumpkin bread, pecan pie, apple crisp, pumpkin pie, apple pie, and homemade apple cider
 
Supreme House of Cheese  {Toluca}    //   Made-to-order or frozen pies: pumpkin, pumpkin pecan, chocolate peanut butter, cherry, apple, peach, and blueberry
 
The Confectionery  {Morton}    //   Fresh homemade pies—fruit pies, cream pies, pumpkin pies and pecan pies will all be available in both mini and full size. Place orders early as the shop will have limited pies available
 
The Pie Doctor {Princeville}    //   Whole, fully-baked pies—place orders ASAP on website or Facebook. Homemade fruit pies are a specialty with the popular apple crumb with cranberries.  New holiday flavors are being announced soon
 
Trefzger’s Bakery  {Peoria Heights}    //   Pre-order ASAP—taking orders for fresh whole pies including:  12 different fruit pies, 6 different cream pies, pumpkin pie, pecan pie

10 Ways to Celebrate Your Birthday in the Greater Peoria Area

By Guest Writer: Samantha Whiting on

					Jun. 16, 2022
				






No matter how big or small the celebration, if you’re looking for fun ways to make a birthday special, look no further! The Greater Peoria Area is a great place to make your birthday wishes come true. Whether you’re looking to plan a special day for yourself or someone else, for day or for night, here’s a list of 10 ways to celebrate. 
 


Dine Out


Birthday brunch or celebratory dinner, dining out is a birthday staple. With so many delicious restaurants to choose from, ranging from fine dining experiences to casual eateries, you’re guaranteed to get just what you want for your special day. For a delicious porterhouse, try Alexander’s Steakhouse in Peoria. Don’t forget to make a trip through their famous salad bar! Or for some specialty pizza, try Pizza 150 in Edwards for a chill night out!
 


Treat Yourself to a Spa Day


Need to unwind? A birthday is a perfect opportunity to spend the day at the spa. For classic spa treatments like facials, massages, and more, visit C’est Ally Spa in North Peoria. For a unique spa experience, visit Peoria Himalayan Salt Cave for a dry salt therapy session in a calming environment. You deserve it. 
 


Grab Drinks With Friends


If you’re considering a night out on the town for your birthday bash, the Peoria area offers so many fun bar options to choose from. Consider The 12 Bar Lounge in Peoria Heights, where you can enjoy beautiful views, live music, and a variety of adult beverages. Or make your way to Tres Rojas Winery in Washington for a night of wine tasting.

 


Challenge Yourself with an Escape Room


Put yourself and your friends to the test with a mind-boggling escape room. Spend an hour solving riddles and racing against time in an immersive and exciting experience. Try out Escape 60 in Peoria, or Escapetown Peoria. If you’re looking for something to get your adrenaline pumping on your special day, this is it!

 


Sing Your Heart Out at Karaoke 


Who doesn’t love a round of karaoke? Hop on stage and dedicate a song to this special day. For families, enjoy this experience in private karaoke rooms at Round 1 in Peoria. For older celebrations, stop by BG Karaoke Saloon in Bartonville for a night of musical memories. 
 


Get Your Game on at an Arcade 


Hang out at an arcade for a blast from the past celebration! Enjoy games, food, and lots of fun for all ages at Round 1, or combine classic arcade games with adult beverages at 8 Bit Arcade Bar, both located in Peoria. Pinball, anyone? 

 


Bounce the Night Away 


For the young and the young at heart, pay a visit to Elevate Trampoline Park at their Peoria or East Peoria location for some bounce-off-the-walls birthday fun. Elevate offers party packages and a variety of fun for all ages. Feel like a kid again with laser tag, pizza, and trampolines!
 


Keep it Classic at the Bowling Alley


If you’re looking to kick it old school, a bowling alley is a classic birthday bash location. Rent some shoes and a ball and set up camp for a night of friendly competition at Sunset Lanes in Pekin or Landmark Lanes in Peoria. For kids or adults, birthday bowling is a must!

 


Indulge in a Shopping Spree 


What else are birthdays for? Spoil yourself by shopping small. Enjoy the variety of shopping the Greater Peoria Area has to offer. Whether you hop over to the Peoria Heights area, Junction City in Peoria, or the Historic Square in Washington, you’re bound to find yourself a birthday treat! 
 


Test Out Your Birthday Luck at a Casino    


Hit the jackpot at Par-A-Dice Hotel and Casino in East Peoria, where you can spend your birthday testing out your luck at the tables. Enjoy a round of blackjack, craps, or roulette, or bet it all on the slot machines! However you want to play, your birthday will be one to remember! 
 


Bonus: Snag some Freebies and Coupons on Your Birthday! 


Happy Birthday to you! In between your birthday events, swing by these businesses for a free birthday treat! Sign up for reward programs at places like Buffalo Wild Wings and Firehouse Subs to receive coupons for free wings, or a free medium sub! Or indulge in something sweeter at places like Cold Stone Creamery or Smoothie King, where your birthday freebie is just a tap away by joining the My Cold Stone Club or downloading the Smoothie King app.

Get Outside:  Kayak + Canoe Jaunt

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 17, 2022
				






Every year the towns of Henry, Lacon, and Chillicothe host a HLS Kayak + Canoe Jaunt.

This is a 16 miles paddle from start to finish along the Illinois River. A shuttle service is offered. Participants drop boats off in Henry, drive to Chillicothe, park the car, and a shuttle bus takes everyone back to the starting line in Henry.
It's a great day, great event, great little way to highlight three charming towns. With registration, each participant receives a t-shirt, some swag goodies, a chance to enter the adventure raffle, a snack in all three towns, and an amazing time on the Illinois River. 
Keep an eye out--this event is usually the last weekend in August every year! The year's Jaunt is scheduled for August 14, 2022. Check out our Calendar of Events for me details.
 


 
 

Check out the full story here! For more Peoria Area recreational tips, tricks, outdoorsy opportunities, and adventures follow @PeoriaOutdoorAdventure on Facebook.

The Greater Peoria Area is loaded with hundreds of miles of trails, thousands of acres of creeks, rivers and parks, and an untapped potential.
Check out PeoriaOutdoorAdventure.com for hidden midwestern resources and gems.

Free Activities to Do In Peoria

By Guest Writer: Samantha Whiting on

					Apr. 25, 2022
				






There is so much to do in Peoria! While you’re busy filling your schedule with fun events and activities and balancing your budget in between, you may find yourself wondering about the free activities our community has to offer. We’ve compiled a list of some of our favorite free things to do for you to enjoy this spring. 
 
Spend Time Outdoors
Spring is just around the corner! As temperatures increase, get out of the house and into the fresh air to enjoy some fun outdoors. 
A Perfect Picnic  //  The Peoria area is home to many beautiful parks. Pack a picnic at home and venture out to claim a spot in Robinson Park, Detweiller Park, Bradley Park, or one of the other dozens of parks in the area. 
 
Hit the Trails​  //  Hiking is good for the soul, and for your wallet! Enjoy nature on the trails of Forest Park Nature Center or join a group of hikers like Hike Like it’s Hot, a Central Illinois hiking group for women, to discover new trails and make new friends.     
 
Ride Like the Wind​  //  Peoria Park District offers Bicycle Safety Town, a place where kids can safely take their bikes to the streets! Pack up the kids and their biking gear and head over to burn some energy and ride like the wind, free of charge. 

 
 
Get Artsy
Peoria is rich with the work of local and visiting artists. Tap into your creative side to explore what the art community in Peoria has to offer. 
Enjoy a Gallery  //  Attend an art show or view an art gallery at staples of the Peoria art community like the Peoria Art Guild and The Contemporary Art Center of Peoria, where free events are offered to art enthusiasts regularly. 
 
Sculpture Walk  //  The Peoria Art Guild organizes a Sculpture Walk each year to support artists and sculptors from all over the country. Begin at the Peoria Riverfront Museum, and follow the map to explore each of the nine sculptures along the streets of downtown Peoria. 

 
 
Learn About Our Community
Peoria’s history is rich, but learning about our community’s past doesn’t have to cost a thing. Step back in time with these fun and free activities. 
Take a Drive  //  See the sights of historic Grandview Drive, a two and a half mile stretch of breathtaking landscapes and beautifully crafted houses. Explore what Theordore Roosevelt once called “the world’s most beautiful drive.”
 
Visit Historical Sights  //  Check out the Peoria Historical Society to find historical sights throughout the community, and explore significant locations on your own, or with a guided tour when the budget allows, to deepen your understanding of the history of our community.
 
Head to the Library  //  The Peoria Public Library is home to thousands of books across five branches located throughout the Peoria area. The library offers a welcoming place for all ages to learn and explore, as well as several free events and clubs.
 
Take a Trip to the Museum  //  Museums throughout our community connect us to the notable events of our past. The Peoria Riverfront Museum offers a wide variety of learning adventures, and occasionally offers Free Museum Days to both seniors and children. The Caterpillar Visitors Center allows kids to explore the history of one of the largest businesses in Peoria, free of cost.

Your Guide for Game Day Grub

By Discover Peoria on

					Oct. 01, 2022
				






ARE YOU READY FOR SOME FOOTBALL?!  Whether you’re a major sports fan or just a fan of great snacks, ‘tis the season for game day grub. No matter what team you’re rootin’ for, here is your guide for the best game day grub in the Peoria Area.
To make your game day viewing a winner, check out these spots for the perfect location to watch the game:
 
Bullpen Sports Bar at Landmark {Peoria}    //     Let’s talk wings and football things….Bullpen Sports Bar has NFL Sunday Ticket, beer, pizza, wings, and 132 inch screens. Prepare to spend every Monday, Thursday and Sunday watchin the game at the Bullpen.
 
Brasky's Bar & Grill  {Peoria}    //     With NFL Sunday Ticket, you can catch all the games over amazing wings, great nachos, and ice cold brews at Brasky’s. Check the score. Take a bite. Repeat. 
 
Castle's Patio Inn  {Peoria}    //     It doesn’t get more Sunday Funday than this—Castle's Patio Inn offers $2 domestic cans, $5 Bloody Mary’s, $4 seltzers, and $4 Propel drinks!
 
Craft309 Kitchen + Bar  {Peoria}    //     Are you ready for some football? During Monday Night Football, from 4pm to close, Craft309 is serving $3 domestic drafts and ½ price wings. Stop in to enjoy the game and enjoy these game day specials.
 
Gilmore’s Sports Bar  {Chillicothe}    //     It’s impossible to miss the action with NINE big screen TV’s showing NFL football. Come on down to Gilmore’s and cheer on your favorite NFL team!
 
Jack's on Adams  {Peoria}    //     Monday Night Football brings $13 Busch Light Buckets and $17 Domestic Bottle Buckets. Make your way to Jack’s on Adams for a specialty pizza and a bucket of brews for kickoff. Now that’s a touchdown…
 
Keps Sports Bar and Grill  {Washington}    //    No need to keep calm when football is on. Whether you’re catching a Monday, Thursday, or Sunday football game, the Keps team has you covered with cold beer, hot pizza pizza, stacked horseshoes, and killer cocktails. This hometown hangout also has pre-game and post-game Washington Panther parties.
 
Kouri's Pub  {Peoria, Pekin, Germantown HIlls}    //     Kouri’s has you covered with snacks and quarterbacks thanks to an amazing menu and NFL Sunday Ticket. Make Kouri’s your traditional spot for touchdowns.
 
Maquet’s Rail House  {Pekin}    //    Maquet’s Rail House understands Sundays are for football, food, and football! With a high-def projector, full bar, and amazing menu
 
MD's Sports Bar  {Peoria}    //     With NFL Sunday Ticket, MD’s is the place to catch all NFL Games on Thursdays and Sundays. Drink specials available all day, every Thursday:  $2 domestic pints, $3.50 Mich Ultra bottles, $1 off slow-roasted pulled pork sandwiches, and free pool all day!  Sunday specials include: $.75 boneless wings, $1.50 traditional wings, $5 bloodies, and $11 domestic buckets.
 
Mike’s Tavern  {West Peoria}    //     Even if you just want both teams to have fun, game day is next-level when there's homemade tenderloins, fresh burgers, and cold beer available. Ready. Set. Eat at Mike’s Tavern! 
 
Neon Bison  {Peoria}    //     Donw, set, party at The Neon Bison. Each game brings new specials like $3 Coronas, $3 Captain Morgan, $2 Miller products, $4 Crown, $11 buckets, and pizza discounts! The Neon Bison has even been known to serve free hot dogs and popcorn with the purchase of a drink.
 
Oliver’s Pizza + Pub  {Peoria Heights, Toluca, Edwardsville}    //     Oliver’s has an impressive game day spread!! Catch all the big games at Oliver’s this season with football streamed from NFL Sunday Ticket, Saturday and Sunday brunch, amazing pizza, frosty drinks.
 
Olympia Sports Bar & Grill  {Peoria}    //     Keep it classy until kickoff. Game day at Olympia means $2.50 domestic tall boys, $7 build-your-own Bloody Mary, and $14 mimosa flights. Every game! Every Sunday!
 
Owl’s Nest  {West Peoria}    //     For the love of the game....Sunday Funday at the Owl's Nest brings $2 Chili dogs, and $3 Bloody Marys. The kitchen is open from 11a-9p and homemade pizza is available at 1p on football Sundays. That’s another thirst down!
 
Silver Dollar Tavern  {Peoria Heights}    //     Na’cho team? Just here for the nachos and halftime? No problem, there’s a hot deal at Silver Dollar Tavern every Sunday during the game—enjoy a free nacho bar and chili dogs with any drink purchase! 
 
The 5th Quarter Sports Bar and Pizzeria  {East Peoria}    //     Catch game day vibes with TVs lining every wall in the 5th Quarter! It’s a good spot for excellent food, frothy beers, and football. It’s a good day for a game day.
 
The Fieldhouse  {Peoria}    //     Football + Fieldhouse + food = fall. You’ll find $3 Bloody Mary’s and Mimosa’s on Sundays, $1.25 tacos, $2.50 chili dogs and if you purchase a margarita you’ll get a free taco! Check out The Fieldhouse on gameday!
 
The Pour House  {Peoria}    //     With NINE big screen TVs, great drink specials, and a full kitchen, The Pour House is a great spot to catch the game! Not to mention, you can play some Golden Tee while you wait for kickoff. Touchdown!
 
TNT's Sports Bar and Grill  {East Peoria}    //     For the ultimate gameday experience head to TNT’s! Regardless of the day, regardless of your team, there’s one things you can bet on—everything on the menu pairs well with football:  homemade meatball subs, award winning Bloody Mary’s, mouthwatering philly cheese sandwiches, hot savory soups, and refreshing drink specials, and tenderloin sandwiches!

Discover Downtown Peoria Spots To Get Work Done

By Discover Peoria on

					May. 31, 2022
				






Downtown Peoria is home to many restaurants, coffee shops and destinations where you can easily stop in to get some work done. A comfortable atmosphere is important for being productive, and we guarantee you will both enjoy your environment and be productive at any of these locations. At many of these spots, you can also add to your experience and enjoy a coffee or meal. If you’re traveling for business, trying to find a hiding spot or looking for a change of scenery, Downtown Peoria has a spot for you. Must-Visit Downtown Peoria Work Locations 
 
Peoria Public Library
Enjoy some peace and quiet at Peoria Public Library. Surrounded by books, this relaxing environment will set you up for success and help you focus on knocking out your to-do list for the day. If you need a private space, take advantage of their meeting rooms by reserving one online. You never know, you might leave with a book that catches your eye!
 

Zion Coffee Bar
Located in the historic Warehouse District, Zion Coffee supports small coffee farmers by purchasing their coffee through a direct trade model. Not only is the coffee delicious, but the inside of this shop is so aesthetically pleasing you won’t want to leave. Locals know the must-try item on the menu is the avocado toast with an egg on top, which pairs perfectly with one of their many specialty lattes.
 
Meet me on Madison
If you’re coffee obsessed, Meet me on Madison needs to be your next destination to visit. We promise you will love the inside of this shop, tastefully designed with fun decor to provide a memorable experience. Not to mention, their delicious menu features super unique options to snack on while working like mini strawberry banana pancakes on a stick or a bacon pb&j panini. 
 
Great Harvest Bread 
Fuel up with a sandwich or panini and see how much you accomplish at Great Harvest Bread. With locations in Downtown Peoria and Morton, Great Harvest is known for their fresh breads, sandwiches and goodies that are baked from scratch. This casual atmosphere is a great spot to work, plus you can enjoy the scent of their exquisite bread made from flour that’s milled daily.
 
Cultured Grounds
Cultured Grounds has a great, relaxing ambiance and provides a quiet spot to work or study while also getting your caffeine fix. Get some work done while snacking on a sweet treat. If you get hungry for something more, we recommend you try the naan pizza, a Discover Peoria staff favorite!
 
thirty-thirty Coffee Co.
Take life one sip at a time! Check out thirty-thirty Coffee Co, a popular coffee shop in our region with a unique and modern atmosphere that has plenty of tables to sit down and work or study. This shop devotes themselves to coffee education and excellence with the finest customer service. Don’t leave without trying the miel latte, not only is it tasty but it will give you the fuel you need to be productive!
 
CxT Roasting Company
Cxt Coffee roasts their own coffee in small batches, guaranteeing high quality coffee that’s rich with flavor, and their rotating seasonal menu ensures you can always try something unique and different. With two different locations in our region, CxT Coffee can provide you with a midday pick me up as well as a relaxing environment to work. Try something new and order the beetroot or turmeric latte!
 
Peoria Riverfront Park
Tired of working indoors? Spend some time enjoying the outdoors with views of the Illinois River while you work! Find a bench underneath a tree or lay out a blanket. Whichever you choose, it’s the right decision. Take in the breeze and soak up some vitamin D.
 
Ardor Breads and Provisions
Focusing on fermentation, vegetation and old-fashioned cooking techniques,  Ardor Breads & Provisions is a popular artisan bakery located in Peoria’s Warehouse District. In addition to serving lattes and other drinks, Ardor sells the most delicious naturally leavened breads, hand laminated pastries and sandwiches that melt in your mouth. You’re also sure to love the aesthetic atmosphere and positive vibes of the shop.

 
Peoria understands it’s important to have locations where you can escape and be productive. Break away from the convention space or office and stop into any of these local places to work and discover an enjoyable experience.
 
Photo References: thirty thirty Coffee co., Zion Coffee Bar

Peoria: Feels Like Home

By Discover Peoria on

					May. 27, 2022
				






Greater Peoria is proud to be a region full of midwestern hospitality—where visitors and residents find comfort. Whether you are a resident, guest, visitor, or transplant, when you think about home, these iconic Peoria Area spots come to mind. 
 
Kelly Seed & Hardware Co – Peoria
After three generations of ownership and operation in Peoria, it’s hard to exclude Kelly Seed & Hardware as a pillar of the community–they’ve been selling higher quality agricultural products for over 100 years. Their services include garden solutions, with a focus on vegetables but the locals stop in for their dose of hometown news and to swap stories—or maybe, perhaps, tall tales. Kelly Seed is always a-buzz with chatter—not gossip, but hunting, fishing, farming, gardening and wildlife stories.
 
Holland’s Mercantile – Washington 
This iconic old-fashioned candy store, soda fountain, and toy store has been on the historic Washington Square for 30+ years. This candy emporium is a unique experience—the moment you step through Holland’s Mercantile’s aged wooden entryway, you will be transported back in time to a journey that begins the moment you set foot upon the creaky wooden flooring to explore the aisles of glass jars are filled with every colorful sweet and treat imaginable. This hidden gem will not disappoint.
 
Emo’s Dairy Mart – Peoria
You will recognize the clown from anywhere—red haired, a nose to rival Rudolph’s, and a cute mid century purple hat to complete the look. But it’s not what’s on the outside sign at Emo’s, it’s what's inside the famous service windows…. Located at the corner of War Memorial and Prospect, this seasonal walk-up window ice cream and hot dog stand has been a community staple for over 50 years. Ask any local what they order from Emo’s and you’ll get a variety of answers—from banana splits to chili dogs to soft serve atop a generous mound of sprinkles—rest assured, a true Peorian will have a go-to favorite.
 
Par-A-Dice Hotel Casino – East Peoria
As luck would have it, docked on the East Peoria side of the Illinois River sits the Par-A-Dice Hotel and Casino. If you’re looking for Las Vegas excitement mixed with midwestern hospitality, look no further.  This river yacht is a beacon in our own backyard. Ask any local for a story about “The Boat” and you’ll hear tales of jackpots, recollections of mouth-watering steak dinners, step-by-step instructions to find the lucky penny machines, and narratives of reunions, traditions, and good-luck rituals. Par-A-Dice is a great spot to try your luck—not to mention, a spectacular view of the river… from the river!

 
The Feed Store – Princeville
If you’re looking for a hearty, homestyle farm to table meal, we have the perfect place for you! The Feed Store in Princeville serves up traditional wholesome American food, including burgers, sandwiches, soups and salads. Whether you try the sirloin steak, grilled cheese, pot roast or the meatloaf in their casual atmosphere, you will feel like you’re enjoying a home-cooked meal. End your meal on a sweet note with a skillet cookie or some pie. With irresistible flavors like peanut butter, tollhouse cookie, oreo and pistachio cream, it might be a tough decision!
 
Schooner’s – Peoria Heights
This venerable tavern has been located on E. War Memorial Drive in Peoria Heights for 40+ years. The biggest selling point has always been familiarity. With little change over four decades, a time traveler from ‘81 would have little trouble recognizing the joint, making this a regional staple. Stop in for their famous beer-battered chicken and a cold beer, but stay for the stories as locals swap fond memories of their hometown hangout.
 
Happy Thought Coffee – Chillicothe
Happy Thought Coffee has been a part of the Chillicothe community for over 23 years, and is a popular destination for breakfast, lunch and baked goods. Enjoy a selection of coffee, soups, sandwiches and wraps. This friendly small town coffee shop also sells a variety of gifts and accessories including cookbooks, jewelry and hand and body products. With a cozy atmosphere, this hidden gem is an ideal place to spend some time and  enjoy a cup of coffee. We recommend you try the breakfast pizza with a frozen coffee!
 

Mona’s Italian Restaurant – Toluca
The Bernardi family has made it a family tradition of making Central Illinoisans feel at home. Many Italians had immigrated to the Peoria area to work the coal mines that were prevalent in the early 1900s. Nildo “Mona” Arthur Bernardi founded Mona’s Italian Restaurant as a bustling beer parlor in Toluca, Illinois in 1933. When Mona’s Restaurant opened, the Pabst Brewing Company donated a neon sign with the name Mona below it, and the rest is history. With a mission to serve authentic Northern Italian cooking, this family restaurant has expanded a great deal over the last 85+ years from its first location in Toluca. If you’re in Washington, stop into Bernardi’s for the same excellent Italian classics and fried chicken.
 
The Publik House – Peoria Heights 
Nothing makes you feel more at home than comfort food! The Publik House located in Peoria Heights is a english-style American and European gastropub that serves up American classics and pub fare. There’s no way you won’t love the cozy indoor atmosphere, or take advantage of their outdoor seating and get some sun. The Publik House is locally owned, and is known for its great wines and beer from around the world. Try the wings and mac n' cheese or pick from eight different burger options. Whether you’re a fan of chicken, steak, pork or mahi mahi, there’s also a sandwich option for you. We recommend trying the New York Steak Sandwich, which has the most tender and tasty strip steak, smoked cheddar cheese, onions and mushrooms. It’s absolutely delicious!
 
The Kountry Nook – Pekin 
As soon as you step into The Kountry Nook in Pekin, you will be wowed by the homey atmosphere and amount of inventory to choose from. Not only does this shop have all of the decor, gifts and accessory items you could possibly want, but it also has the sweetest and most genuine employees. You will definitely find something unique when selecting from their handmade items and seasonal crafts. We promise you will walk out with something you love!
 
The 50’s Diner – Peoria 
We promise the traditional diner atmosphere at The 50's Diner will make you feel right at home. Located in the Metro Centre, The 50s Diner serves up classic American favorites and all-day breakfast. Their six page menu of all your favorites is sure to have something to curb your cravings! Ranging from omelets and skillets to burgers and sandwiches, there is lots of variety to choose from. Plus, they’re home of the loosey sandwich, which features ground up hamburger and special seasoning. This location is great for a wholesome breakfast experience.

 
When you think of home, what iconic Peoria Area hometown joints come to mind?

10 Can’t-Miss 2021 Peoria Area Holiday Traditions

By Discover Peoria on

					Nov. 05, 2021
				






1. East Peoria Festival of Lights Winter Wonderland in East Peoria (November 25, 2021 - January 2, 2022) - This drive-thru electric park is the Festival of Lights’ signature event! Enjoy viewing beautiful floats as well as a series of lighted displays. The drive takes around 30 minutes to complete. 
 
2. Chillicothe Holiday Makers Market at Three Sisters Park (November 26, 2021) - Head out to Chillicothe for some holiday shopping with over 50 vendors that have boutique-style booths overflowing with handmade products and vintage treasures. There will also be food and a cash bar!
 
3. Santa Claus Parade in Peoria (November 26, 2021) - Get ready for the longest-running holiday parade in the country! This years’ theme is “A Candyland Christmas” and the parade will feature costumed characters, floats, bands and Santa Claus!
 
4. Hometown Holidays Tree Lighting Celebration in Morton (November 27, 2021) - Enjoy a celebration of shopping local this holiday season! Save the date for Small Business Saturday for an annual tree lighting, market and lots of holiday fun.
 
5. Stevens Square Tree Lighting and Holiday Stroll in Princeville (November 28, 2021) - The Village of Princeville is giving the community an opportunity to sponsor and decorate a Christmas Tree in Stevens Square Park! Sponsor a tree that will bear your name and view all the trees at the Tree Lighting and Holiday Stroll where there will be a ceremony and lighting of the park.
 
6. Christmas on Court in Pekin (December 3, 2021) - Businesses in downtown Pekin come together for this holiday tradition to host a number of great activities throughout the night. Visit Santa Claus, watch the lighting of the community Christmas tree, view live performances and enjoy some sweet treats!
 
7. Washington Specialty Shops Candlelight Stroll at the Historic Washington Square (December 3, 2021) - Get in the holiday spirit and join the Washington Square specialty shops for a night of shopping and a number of events including carriage rides and a visit from Santa!
 
8. The Inaugural Kris Kringle Market in the Heights in Peoria Heights (December 3, 2021) - Shop local this holiday season at the Kris Kringle Market in Peoria Heights where you can enjoy great vendors, get a taste of delicious locally made treats plus Santa will be making an appearance during the annual tree lighting ceremony in Tower Park. 
 
9. Christmas Walk in Elmwood (December 4, 2021) - Take a carriage ride, hear carolers, get your picture with Santa and greet your community for the holidays at Elmwood’s Central Park!
 
10. The Nutcracker at the Peoria Civic Center (December 11 - 12, 2021) - Peoria Ballet’s The Nutcracker is a family holiday tradition featuring 100 dancers joined by professional guest artists plus live music by Heartland Festival Orchestra. This festive classic is a treat for audiences of all ages!

10 Things To Do in the Peoria Area for First-Time Visitors

By Guest Writer: Samantha Whiting on

					Jul. 05, 2022
				






There is no shortage of fun in the Peoria Area. With endless options for first time visitors, it may be difficult to decide what to do! Whether you’re here for a quick trip or an extended stay, there’s always time to discover what Peoria has to offer. To get the most out of your visit, here’s a list of 10 must-do experiences! 
 
1. Dine Out  //  Exploring local eateries is an essential part of experiencing a new city. In Peoria, the options are endless. Plan dinner at Sugar Wood-Fired Bistro or The Blue Duck Barbeque Tavern, both conveniently located in Downtown Peoria for unique dining experiences you’ll never forget. Sugar features a variety of gourmet wood-fired culinary creations that pair perfectly with a selection of artisan beer. If you’re looking for something a bit heartier, dive into some brisket, pulled pork, ribs, and more at The Blue Duck.
 
2. Shop Local  //  Turn your trip into a shopping spree by shopping at a variety of small business boutiques like Wishing Star Boutique, located in Peoria and Washington, or Perfect Pear Boutique in Peoria Heights. Strut your stuff in the latest women's fashion unique to each store. There are so many shopping locations in Peoria, you’ll never want your trip to end! Shop ‘til you drop!
 
3. Stop By the Zoo  //   The Peoria Zoo will be the highlight of your visit. Whether you’re with the whole family or venturing out on your own, check out exotic animals, learn about animal conservation, and wander into new continents at the Peoria Zoo. 

 
4. Learn About Peoria  //  ​ Take a tour with the Peoria Historical Society to learn about Peoria’s rich and exciting history, or head over to the Peoria Riverfront Museum to check out a variety of rotating educational exhibits. Engage with our historic past and learn about the strides Peoria has made to become the thriving city it is today. 
 
5. Take in the Views  //  ​ While there are many things that make Peoria special, the beautiful views are high on the list. Drive through Grandview Drive to take in the Illinois River from one of the most famous vantage points. This scenic route offers a beautiful view of the best of what nature has to offer. 
 
6. Get Crafty  //  ​ Make your own souvenir at Crafted DIY Studio and Bar in Peoria. Sip on your favorite beverage while working on your own DIY craft, selected from a menu of fun ideas, or head over to Fired Up in Peoria Heights to paint your own custom pottery. Happy crafting! 
 
7. Get Outside  //  ​ Luthy Botanical Garden or the variety of parks in the Peoria Area make great spots to take in our beautiful landscapes. Luthy Botanical Garden features beautiful botanical life and sprawling gardens, perfect for trips in the warmer months of the year. A must see for nature lovers! 

 
8. Experience the Nightlife  //  ​ Hang out Downtown at Martini’s on Water for specialty martinis, including their famous chocolate martinis, or make your way to Kellehers for a classic Irish pub feel. Both locations frequently offer live music, essential for a great night out! 
 
9. Indulge in Some Sweets  //  ​ Trefzger’s Bakery in Peoria Heights is a historic one-stop-shop for all things sweet. Find something delicious to enjoy, and experience that unique Trefzger’s flavor that has satisfied Peoria’s sugar-cravings since 1861. Try their cookies, cakes, pies, and more. 
 
10. Check Out The River  //  ​ Head down to the Riverfront in Peoria to take in the sights of what put Peoria on the map, the accessible Illinois River that flows through our area. Take a walk accompanied by the waterfront view, or participate in a variety of events that take place at the Riverfront throughout the year. 

 
 
The Peoria Area is unlike any other destination, offering a unique variety of experiences you don’t want to miss! Whether you’re planning a trip, or just passing through, you’ll never run out of things to discover in Peoria!
