Great Spots for Live Music in Greater Peoria


					Sep. 30, 2021
				






There’s so much to do in the Peoria Area, and plenty of places to see live music.
Whether you’ve caught an afterparty at Kenny’s Westside Pub, or a dueling pianos competition at Jim's Steakhouse music fix at one of our many festivals. There's no better place to see your favorite local and national acts than in the Heart of Illinois. Check out some of our favorite places to see live music in the Peoria Area.
 
CEFCU Stage   //   The CEFCU stage @ The Landing on the Peoria Riverfront is the premier outdoor concert venue in Downtown Peoria. With the Illinois river behind the stage, it’s the perfect backdrop for Spring and Summer music festivals. 

Vineyard Tunes   //   We love seeing shows at vineyards… the open air, the scenic views and great wine is the perfect recipes for a memorable night. We recommend checking out the stages at Big Horse Vineyards, Tres Rojas Winery, or Mackinaw Valley Vineyard for an unforgettable viewing experience.
 
Tavern Tunes   //   At any given time, a music-lover can find live music somewhere in the Greater Peoria Area. When in doubt, check out any one of these great spots:  Ulrich's Rebellion Room, Oliver's in the Heights, Rhythm & Brews, Rhythm Kitchen Music Cafe, Twisted Spoke Saloon, The Neon Bison, City Heat, Kelleher's Irish Pub & Eatery, and many many many more!
 
Unexpected Melodies   //   Touch of Grey Cafe is a Grateful Dead-inspired venue in West Peoria, offering coffee, donuts, paninis and more. The cafe offers a truly unique experience in terms of establishment decor, its theme hinging on the popularity of arguably one of the greatest Jam bands of all time. 
 
Peoria Civic Center   //   The Peoria Civic Center, a jewel of the city that has featured major touring artists and circus performers alike, musicals and so much more. This incredible multipurpose event facility boasts a 2,196 seat theater and a separate arena with seating for just over 11,000 people. 

 
And as always, for more information on all these venues and more, be sure to check out our event calendar for all the upcoming shows scheduled in the Peoria Area.

24 Dog-Friendly Restaurants in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Aug. 27, 2021
				






Why leave your furry friend at home when you don’t have to?! The Peoria Area is packed with bark-worthy restaurants for pups! Read on for a great list of some of our establishments who welcome four-legged friends!
 
RESTAURANT EDITION
Zion Coffee Bar  {Peoria}  //  Located in the Warehouse District, Zion Coffee Bar features direct-relationship coffees, specialty cocktails, wines, beer and locally produced artisan foods. This amazing downtown hideaway allows four-legged friends to join you inside and out while you sip!
Pups welcome inside and in the outdoor space.
 
The Ice Cream Shack  {Peoria + Sunnyland}  //  Located in both Peoria and Sunnyland, the Ice Cream Shack is a seasonal spot for a sweet frozen treat! This classic regional staple offers pups a peanut butter drizzled dish your dog will go nuts for!
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
The 5th Quarter Sports Bar & Pizzeria  {East Peoria}  //  Try out some of your favorites at the 5th Quarter Sports Bar & Pizzeria! They have a great outdoor seating area that your dog will love and a large menu full of pizza, wraps, burgers, appetizers and more!
Pups welcome in the outdoor dining space.
 
Kep's Place Sports Bar and Grill  {Washington}  //  Kep's Place Sports Bar is a great dog-friendly joint! The outdoor tables welcome dining, drinking and dogs! Try Kep's fish sandwich and waffle fries with an iced cold beer on draft.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Industry Brewing {Peoria}  //  For our four-legged friends, Industry Brewing's back lot offers a dog paradise with a fire hydrant doggy drinking fountain and a restroom area with bags on site! Follow their social media for announcements on their Pups & Pints events.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Donnelly's Irish Pub​ {Peoria}  //  Donnelly's Irish Pub is a dog-friendly eatery serving a variety of pub fare to locals and tourists alike. Visitors to Donnelly's looking to dig into a plate of fish and chips alongside their furry friend can do so at one of its many outdoor tables.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Los Cabos Cantina & Grill  {Peoria}  //  Visitors to Los Cabos can sit beside their dog at one of its nine outdoor tables to enjoy burritos, enchiladas, fajitas, grilled entrees, nachos, shredded chicken taco salads, and all your Mexican favorites!
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Fieldhouse Bar and Grill  {Peoria}  //  Fieldhouse is a popular spot to grab American fare, serving cocktails and beer in a dog-friendly environment. Dog owners craving a Devil's Sweat burger and an IPA can head to one of Fieldhouse's outdoor tables to enjoy their meal alongside their canine.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Eli's Coffee Shop  {Peoria}  //  Eli's is a casual joint that serves up a variety of delicious coffee concoctions, teas, smoothies, salads, wraps, melts, pastries, baked goods, and more! Pup is welcome to join at one of their several pet-friendly outdoor tables while you enjoy your day.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Lou's Drive-In  {Peoria}  //  Lou’s Drive-In is a Peoria staple in the summertime. They are known for their tasty popcorn and root beer floats! They have both drive-up service and outdoor seating where you and your pet can have a classic and casual American meal.
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Rhythm Kitchen​  {Peoria}  //  Rhythm Kitchen is a fun and friendly eatery filled with original art where dogs are allowed to join for a meal and occasional live music. Guests wanting to dig into the shrimp creole with sweet biscuits, while Fido relaxes nearby can do so at one of Rhythm's outdoor tables.
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Oliver's in the Heights  {Peoria Heights}  //  Bring pup to the spacious outdoor patio at Oliver's in the Heights! Sit back and enjoy a late afternoon beverage and Oliver's homemade pickle chips or a slice of their famous pizza. This spot often has excellent live music and a great selection of non-alcoholic drinks and a children's menu.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Peacock's Pub  {Bartonville}  //  Small dogs are welcome at the pet-friendly Peacock's Pub, where they have four or five outdoor tables. Peacock's has classic American pub fare, like sandwiches, salads, and wraps.
Small pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Edge​ by Chef Dustin Allen  {Peoria Heights}  //  Edge by Chef Dustin Allen offers a modern dining experience that combines farm-fresh, locally grown ingredients with a pet-friendly environment. Visitors to Edge wanting to dig into a unique dish from its ever-changing menu can sit at an outdoor table to enjoy their meal and a cocktail. Edge recommends guests call ahead to make a reservation before planning their evening at this approachable, fine-dining establishment.
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Po-Boys  {Peoria}  //  Po-Boys is a dog-friendly restaurant serving New Orleans style foods in Peoria. Visitors to Po-Boys can dig into a plate of catfish bites alongside their pooch at one of the bar's outdoor tables. On chilly evenings, fire pits are lit creating a really fun outdoor atmosphere for all to enjoy.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Obed & Isaac's Microbrewery and Eatery  {Peoria}  //  Obed & Isaac’s Microbrewery and Eatery is located in a beautiful historic renovated church with an outdoor beer garden perfect for furry friends. With specialty flatbreads, burgers, and a constantly changing brew menu, you’re sure to find something on the menu you will love.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Brienzo's Wood Fired Pizza  {Peoria Heights}  //  Who doesn’t love housemade pizza? Brienzo’s Wood Fired Pizza has many tasty classic and unique pizza options that are all fresh, hand-tossed and wood-fired. Sit outside with your furry friend and try their craft wine and beer!
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.
 
Great Harvest Bread  {Morton + Peoria}  //  Great Harvest Bread is a casual bakery that serves up freshly-prepared goodies. Choose from menu options including breads, cookies, scones, bars, muffins, and more. Pup is welcome to join at the outdoor tables available at the Morton location while you enjoy your morning. Please note, table service is not available, so dogs will need wait outside while you go in to order.
Pups welcome at the outdoor tables.
 
Twistee Treat  {East Peoria}  //  Twistee Treat is a casual fast-food-style eatery with a convenient walk-up window that serves up a variety of delicious treats. This seasonal gem has been a community staple for years!! Pups are welcome to join at this iconic pet-friendly spot.
Pups welcome in the outdoor space.
 
Sugar Wood-Fired Bistro  {Peoria}  //  Sugar Wood-Fired Bistro is another option for tasty pizza where your dog can come with! They have a great outdoor patio where you can enjoy a meal cooked in a traditional wood-fired oven with craft beer and handmade desserts.
Pups welcome in the outdoor dining space.
 
Thyme Kitchen & Craft Beer  {Peoria}  //  If you want to try something new but still bring your four-legged friend with you, try Thyme Kitchen! Not only do they have a great outdoor patio but their menu is full of unique items and twists on classic meals.
Pups welcome in the outdoor dining space.
 
The Blue Duck Barbecue Tavern  {Peoria}  //  Located by the RiverFront, The Blue Duck Barbecue Tavern is a local favorite where you can enjoy a delicious barbecue with a great view and your dog can come with you! Get ready to try wood-smoked meats, hand-cut fries, craft beer and whisky.
Pups welcome in the outdoor dining space.
 
Cayenne  {Peoria Heights}  //  Cayenne is a dog-friendly Mexican restaurant serving "familiar flavors in a nontraditional way." Guests with Fido in tow can head to one of Cayenne's outdoor tables to enjoy their dish. Everything on the menu is made-to-order, including its tacos, plates, bowls, desserts, cocktails, frozen drinks, and boozy punch.
Pups welcome in the outdoor dining space.
 
Cyd's in the Park  {Peoria}  //  Located in Donovan Park, Cyd’s in the Park is a great place to relax and enjoy a meal with your best friend. They have indoor and outdoor patio dining and serve made-to-order grilled sandwiches, fresh salads, burgers, and cafe plates as well as crafted cocktails and bar snacks.
Pups welcome in the outdoor patio space.

7 Must-Try Lunch Spots in Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Sep. 10, 2021
				






All you need is love...but sometimes a lunch break works too. Check out one of these must-try lunch spots in the Peoria Area to curb your midday cravings, you won’t regret it!
 
1. Zero to gyro!  //  Khoury's Cuisine in on North University Street is a great option for lunch! With a casual Greek, Lebanese, and Mediterranean specialties, this . From eggs benedict and crepes to sandwiches and salads, you’re sure to find something you’ll love.
Try the Khoury's salad, the super gyro special, the kibbeh sandwich or the grape leaves! 

 
2. The best things in life are fry!   //   If you’re looking to try something different, The Fry Spot is the perfect place for you! Newly opened, The Fry Spot serves freshly cut loaded fries, seafood and pasta. Are you an alfredo fan? Their range of alfredo pasta will leave you speechless.
Try the gumbo fry or the lobster and shrimp alfredo! 

 
3. Get a slice of this!   //   I think we can all agree that pizza is an important diet staple! Double A's Pizza Sports Bar and Grill has a great pizza lunch buffet for a quick lunch spot. If you’re not a fan of pizza, the menu also has a range of burgers, sandwiches, salads, and calzones.
Try the white garlic pizza, Big M"AA"C calzone, and the butterfly pork chop sandwich!

 
4. Meat me in paradise!   //   Calling all meat lovers! Dac’s Smokehouse serves mouth-watering barbeque meals, meat plates, wings, wraps and tacos. Its brisket and pulled pork are tender and packed with flavor. It will definitely leave you wanting more! With a location in both Peoria, East Peoria, and Morton.
Try the St. Louis style ribs or the smoked tandoori chicken wrap.

 
5. Oki doki, give me some poke!  //  Dang Banh Mi & Poke is a local favorite among both Peorians and Bradley students. This one-of-a-kind spot has large portions, fresh flavors, and boba teas. Dang Banh Mi & Poke never disappoints!
Try the signature poke bowl, classic banh mi sandwich, and a Thai milk tea with brown sugar boba!

 
6.  Bring the heat!  //  Have a taste of the Caribbean right here in Peoria! The Jerk Hut is locally owned and serves authentic Caribbean food including curry, tacos, jerk, wings, potatoes and more. It also has tasty vegan options.
Try the curry shrimp or the jerk catfish but be ready for Jerk Hut to bring the heat! 

 
7. Live life on the veg!  //  If you’re looking for a healthier option, check out EatAndEvolve in Junction City! It serves delicious, filling and healthy breakfast and lunch meals with carb-free, gluten-free, dairy-free and vegetarian options. You can dine in, but they’re also a meal-prep delivery service. The menu changes weekly with plenty of fresh and tasty entrees! 

 
The Peoria area is packed with unique restaurants and food spots to satisfy whatever flavors you’re in the mood for. Give one of these local restaurants a try the next time your lunch cravings kick in.

5 Greater Peoria Spots for a Pizza & Cold Beer

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Oct. 06, 2021
				






October 9th is International Beer and Pizza day!! 
Beer and pizza is one of the most iconic food and beverage combinations loved all around the world. The crunch of pizza crust mixed with cheesy goodness is complimented perfectly when washed down with a crisp beer. In honor of International Beer and Pizza Day, here are 5 joints in Greater Peoria to stop for a mouth-watering pizza and a frosty cold pint.
 

1. Wood Fired Pizza and Artisan Beer….Yum!   //   Sugar Wood Fired Bistro, located in Peoria’s warehouse district is a Peorian favorite for gourmet pizza cooked in a traditional wood-fired oven. To get the full experience, you have to pair your pizza with a hand-crafted Artisan beer!

Try the Smokey Pork Chipotle pizza and the Industry I Know The Owner IPA.

 
2. Stop Drop and Roll into Firehouse Pizza!  //  Firehouse Pizza & Pub East Peoria is a regional favorite. With homemade dough and original firehouse pizza sauce, it's a great pairing with an iced cold bottle of brew! Plus, Firehouse Pizza’s restaurant has a fun fireman theme that the whole family will enjoy.

Try the Chicken Bacon Ranch Pizza with a classic PBR.
 
3. Pizza Cooked the Centuries-Old Way!   //   Brienzo’s in Peoria Heights serves up top-notch, hand-tossed and house-made pizzas. Each pizza is cooked Neapolitan style with a crispy crust and soft bread inside. Pick from a huge list of toppings and grab an iced-cold draft from the tap!

Try the Garlic Alfredo pizza with the Domaine Dupage French Country Ale.

 
4. Peace, Love and Pizza!   //   Pizza 150 in Edwards has built its menu around popular favorites with a special Kickapoo flair! With locally sourced ingredients, the pizza is absolutely to-die-for. Don’t miss weekly pizza specials and pair your meal with a beer of choice from a full bar.

Try the Cheeseburger Cheeseburger pizza with the Blue Moon Belgian White Draft.
 
5. Fresh Pizza All Throughout the Night!   //   Satisfy your late-night cravings at Hoops Pub & Pizza! Not only is it open until 5:30am so you can enjoy a beer and pizza combo no matter when you’re in the mood, but its tasty pizza will definitely have you coming back for more! You can also order your pizza by the slice.

Try the Taco Pizza with a frosty Budweiser.

Check out any of these local restaurants and eateries and stay tuned for more Peoria Area pizza & beer suggestions!

Get Outside:  Interview with CREW309

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 17, 2022
				






CREW309 is short for Cancer Recovery by Empowering Women. This nonprofit team is compiled of breast cancer survivors who rowing/sculling in the Peoria Area.
The below interview with Lindsey Vlaminck, CREW309 Outreach Coordinator, Executive Board Secretary, and rower + Coach Nikki Delinski, who provides an excellent run down of the team's two boats, equipment, costs involved, history of the crew, and how it all operates. 
 
How long has the group been around? 
Our first open practice was in December of 2017, but we started regular practices with the team in May of 2018. At the time, we were known as ROW Peoria, an affiliate team of Recovery on Water (ROW) based out of Chicago. We applied for our own 501c3 in February of 2020 and officially became CREW309 (Cancer Recovery by Empowering Women) in the summer of 2020. So I guess the technical answer to your question is 3.5 years.
 

How many women are currently in the group? Is there room for more?
CREW309 has about 20-30 active members on the team currently. CREW309 currently has a wait list of women looking to join. As soon as we gets more boats, we plan to get more women in the water rowing. We had closed recruitment due to COVID, and then with getting on the water this summer, we wanted to focus on getting our existing members comfortable in the boats before opening up more spots on the team. We will host an open house for new members this fall, with plans to onboard new members over the winter season.
 
 

What is the CREW309 mission?
Everyone on our team has either had a breast cancer diagnosis themselves or have a substantial increased risk for breast cancer due to a genetic mutation. Our mission is to help our members lower their cancer risk through the sport of rowing. Regular exercise is shown to decrease cancer recurrence by up to 50%, so by rowing on our team, our members are actively preventing cancer from forming. A great secondary gain is the support our women receive from each other, almost like a support group, without having to constantly talk about their cancer experience. So a yes to raising awareness and education, but our main goal is more about promoting exercise and healthy lifestyle choices to decrease cancer recurrence.
The crew takes a short prayer moment prior to their practice, for the safety and well being of not only those on the water but also those who are battling cancer. 
 

Tell us about the boats and equipment. 
The smaller CREW309 boat holds 4 rowers and the coxswain (pronounced “cox-in”), who is responsible for steering, race commands, race strategy and motivating the crew. The larger boat, if that’s possible, holds 8 people and is the size of a semi. ((Maybe not quite a semi...but it’s massive.))  In addition to the sculling boats, the team has a pontoon boat on hand for safety, assistance, and outings. 
 

Did everyone have an interest or background into sculling before or how did it come about?
Actually, none of our members had rowed prior to joining the team (aside from Lindsay). They all joined for an outlet to be more active and find kinship with other survivors. We row in a 4 person or 8 person boat, so we do primarily sweep rowing (one oar) instead of sculling (two oars).
 

Are there other similar groups out there that this is part of an organization-as if this is a local chapter of something larger or is this unique to the sport?
Initially we were founded as an affiliate team, as I previously mentioned, with ROW in Chicago. They were instrumental in helping us get the group started in Peoria. Once we had a solid foundation, we became our own non-profit organization, based solely in Peoria. There are other rowing teams across the country that have programs for breast cancer survivors as well. One of our secondary goals is to show Peoria the beauty of the river and the sport of rowing. There is simply something majestic about it!
 
Learn more the Peoria Area CREW309 team:  Facebook, E-mail, Website, Instagram


Check out the full interview here! For more Peoria Area recreational tips, tricks, outdoorsy opportunities, and adventures follow @PeoriaOutdoorAdventure on Facebook.

7 Local Wineries to Stop & Smell the Rosé

By Discover Peoria on

					Apr. 12, 2021
				






With the deep blue skies and warm weather right around the corner, now is the perfect time to explore the limitless wineries the Peoria Area has to offer. From horse-drawn carriages to endless acres of captivating views, these wineries will keep you coming back for more!
 

Tres Rojas Winery at Barry Vineyards  {Washington}   //   With much consideration, the name Three Reds, or better known as Tres Rojas Winery, was born from countless experiments with amateur red wines:  Pinot Noir (uno), Malbec (dos) and Sangiovese (tres). This winery pride itself on creating high-quality dry red and white wines, but you will find sweet and fruit wines too--their award-winning winemaker has something for everyone. With great wines available by the bottle, the glass, or as a build-your-own custom flight Tres Rojas is an excellent hangout spot.

 
Big Horse Vineyards  {Lewistown}   //   Big Horse Vineyards is a beautiful vineyard nestled into a working draft horse farm. The Archdale Family has created a beautiful slice of paradise, where guests can sit back and relax, enjoy a bottle of wine over breathtaking vineyard views and majestic horses. From Sunday Fundays featuring live music by local artists to stone fire pizza & wine nights---there is never a dull moment at Big Horse Vineyards!

 
Old Mill Vineyard  {Metamora}   //   Stop by Old Mill Vineyard to uncork and unwind with quality local wines that have been estate-grown and bottled. This 10 acre vineyard produces 13 varieties of red and white wines ranging from dry, off-dry, semi-sweet, to sweet. Sample each at the Bent Tree, OMV's tasting room, is situated by a pond, where guests can enjoy the annual geese broods, wandering wildlife and tranquil setting from the patio. This peaceful vineyard is the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing summer afternoon with a bottle of wine and friends.

 
Spoon River Junction Winery  {Canton}   //   With a passion for creating unique quality wine, Spoon River Junction Winery has been making wine for almost 25 years. With a national Wine Club that ships hundreds of bottles out-of-state each month, this local gem creates bold flavors for adventurous people and palates. Spend an afternoon at Spoon River Junction for sweet and dry wine tastings! Once you're situated outside around a beautiful fire pit with friends, you won't regret it!

 
Mockingbird Vineyards  {Manito}   //   The varieties grown in central Illinois may be less familiar than Cabernet or Chardonnay, but grapes like Marquette, Itasca, and Petite Pearl have tons of potential to produce world-class wines. That's where Mockingbird Vineyards comes into play. Nestled in Southwest Tazewell County, Mockingbird Vineyards offers a relaxed country setting perfect for growing excellent grapes for local wineries. With a bountiful crop of nine varieties and a grove of apple trees, Mockingbird Vineyard strives for supreme tasting juice derived from the varietals grown on their acreage. Although no wine is made on-site, you can be sure to taste their harvest, bottled at any one of the local wineries.

 
Native Trails Winery  {Lewistown}   //   Native Trails Winery offers red and white wines made from locally-grown grapes, while its picturesque and winding trails are available for guests to enjoy nature and the beautiful scenery. This 110-acre vineyard is adjacent to Dickson Mounds, a National Historic Site, which provides a distinctive nod toward the land’s Native American roots. Native Trails Winery offers a chance to sip and celebrate the free spirit of an earlier time in history with five dry and four sweet offerings all named after the native Oneota Indians heritage that runs deep in the region.

 
Mackinaw Valley Vineyard   {Mackinaw}   //   Mackinaw Valley Vineyard is situated on a glacial Moraine, a natural high point, giving guests an amazing thirty-mile view of the valley. Over the past nineteen years, this winery has seen its fair share of weddings and special events but what they're known best for is providing a unique, relaxing spot for guests to stop and smell the rosé. This 86-acre property has about 15-acres of grapes, which produce the vineyard's 20+ varieties of wine to taste. Stop in for a winery tour + tasting, a trivia night, a murder mystery dinner, a concert or for a a stroll through the grapevines to get away from the hustle and bustle of today’s hectic world.

Get Outside:  Illinois River Bluff Trail

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 17, 2022
				






This is a great example of why we love the Peoria Area...
There are some many things to do if I just open my eyes and go outside. The Illinois River Bluff Trail is a great example. Technically, it runs from the north--starting at the Peoria Park District Camp Wokanda area near Mossville, to the south into Detweiller Park. From there it connects to the Pimiteoui Trail, which is another Peoria Park District entity. 

Here's what to expect

Expect many beautiful bridges along your hike, majestic creek beds, grassy clearings, and the ever-dreaded (yet extremely-rewarding) stairways. This trail provides an excellent combination of shade and sun, with both inclines, declines, and flat sections. It's a great hike and recommended in chunks of 5 miles.
 

North of Mossville Road is a really nice flat section of the Illinois River Bluff Trail. Overall, The Illinois River Bluff Trail has a lot more hills than flat sections, so the flat ones are welcome after a hike up. Be sure to bring water and stay hydrated!
 
Unexpected Trail Markers

Near Camp Wokanda, you will notice blue tubes running all over the forest and along the trail. What you'll witness is the maple syrup gathering process---those blue tubes are collecting tree sap, which will be turned into syrup!
 

This may not be El Chapo Tunnel, but it's just as impressive! You'll stumble across this tunnel, which allows the trail to run under Route 6. 
 

Trail split near Detweiller Park for the two different trail systems---Illinois River Bluff Trail and the Pimiteoui Trail.
 
There are more trails around Peoria than you'll ever be able to knock off in a lifetime...let alone a single season, but if you want to start checking those boxes, here's a link to a list of the ones managed by the Peoria Park District.
 
 


Check out the full story here! For more Peoria Area recreational tips, tricks, outdoorsy opportunities, and adventures follow @PeoriaOutdoorAdventure on Facebook.

2021 Summer Events in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					May. 25, 2021
				






Discover Peoria is excited to promote a robust line-up of activities and events happening this summer in the Peoria area where you can discover a one-of-a-kind experience for the whole family to enjoy.
2021 Farmers’ Markets in the Peoria Area
Central Illinois is fortunate enough to be brimming with fresh local produce and vendors at different Farmers’ Markets around the area. Start your week off by checking out the Farmers Market at the Metro Centre, which is open Monday through Saturday. Tuesday evenings are for Morton Farmers’ Market N More. Wednesday evening there are back-to-back Farmer’s Markets across the street from each other at the Keller Station and Junction City. Head out to Pekin on Thursday afternoons for the Pekin Farmers’ Market and start your weekend on Friday nights in the Levee District for the East Peoria Farmers’ Market. Saturday mornings wrap up the area’s Farmers’ Markets with the Peoria RiverFront Market, Peoria’s Southside Farmers’ Market, Metamora Farmers’ Market, Canton Main Street Farmers’ Market and the Havana Farmers’ Market. If you can’t make it to one of the area’s Farmers’ Markets, check out these other recurring events happening all summer long.
Recurring 2021 Summer Events


2nd Saturday Market at Downtown Chillicothe (May 8, June 12, July 10 and August 14) - This citywide retail event and includes retail businesses on 4th, 2nd Cedar and Santa Fe streets. It runs from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the 2nd Saturday of the month year-round.


Downtown Thursday 2nd Street Market at 2nd Street (May 27, June 24, July 29 and August 26) - The downtown Chillicothe street festival takes place on the last Thursday of the month during the summer with vendors lining the street and each month has a different theme.


Tazewell Art Loop’s Fourth Fridays (May 28, June 25, July 23 and August 27) - Celebrate the arts and shop local at this summer the only event happening every fourth Friday from May through August in Morton, Pekin and Delavan.


First Fridays (June 4, July 2 and August 6) - First Fridays are a beautifully sensory experience one can take through the heart and soul of Peoria, discovering local artists, new exhibits and shopping local. 


Havana’s First Fridays & Night Market at Main Street (June 4, July 2 and August 6) - Featuring an amazing lineup of artists and musicians, visit Havana’s local shops, boutiques, restaurants and catch the live music downtown at the Stag Tap Beer Garden stage. You can also view local artists’ work at The Cove Center. 


Central Illinois Cars & Coffee at The Levee District (June 5, July 3 and August 7) - The first Saturday of each month during the summer is time car enthusiasts gather to show off and drive their new and vintage cars. 


 

Learn more about these events and others at DiscoverPeoria.com/Events.

Get Outside: There's So Much to Do in Peoria!

By Guest Writer:  Peoria Outdoor Adventure on

					Jul. 14, 2022
				






So I just got back from the store where I picked up some magazines extolling some ideas for places to visit, things to do, etc. As I was leafing through the pages and reading about all of these great opportunities that exist elsewhere, it became increasingly frustrating because I know our area has so much to offer but it’s not either widely known or promoted. 
 
Being on the river your thing? we’ve got miles and miles of waterways that range from the mighty Illinois River, to smaller ones like the Mackinaw River and the Spoon River to creeks like Kickapoo Creek.

 
Want to take it slower and skip a current? We’ve got lots of lakes everywhere. 

 
Into hiking? We’ve got trails everywhere....from the flat paved type of the Rock Island Trail and Peoria Greenway Trail, to challenging river bluff trails that will get your heart pumping. The Peoria Park District has tons of trail systems throughout the city and on the outskirts. 

 
Into camping? Check out any of the state parks and forests around. Jubilee College State Park in Brimfield, Wildlife Prairie Park, Camp Wokanda, Sand Ridge State Forest, and more. 

 
You like rock climbing? We’ve got one of the best gyms around at First Ascent in Peoria.

 
Some people say there’s not as much to do in the winter....but that’s not true. Go for a hike, bike, camp, fat bike through the snow, pick up some snowshoes and go explore. Almost without exception, whatever you like to do in the summer, you can do all year round, provided you dress appropriately for the occasion, maybe alter the gear a little and keep an open mind.

 

Check out the full story here! For more Peoria Area recreational tips, tricks, outdoorsy opportunities, and adventures follow @PeoriaOutdoorAdventure on Facebook.

2019 Peoria Area Holiday Events

By Discover Peoria on

					Nov. 13, 2019
				






Central Illinois loves the holidays! Celebrate the holidays with us this year by checking out one of the many fun events happening around the area. From the nation's longest-running holiday parade to the new Magical Cirque Christmas coming to the Peoria Civic Center, there is something for everyone to enjoy! 

Caterpillar Holiday Display  //  November 7- December 29, 2019  //  {The Caterpillar Visitors Center, Peoria, IL}  //  Searching for the perfect backdrop for your holiday cards this year? Head out to the Caterpillar Visitors Center to take your picture in front of the massict cat PM 313 Cold Planer wrapped in twinkling lights! 
 
Parade of Lights  //  November 16, 2019 @ 5:45pm  //  {Washington Street, East Peoria, IL}  //  The Parade of Lights kicks off the start of the Festival of Lights and the holiday season here in Central Illinois. Approximately 30 lighted floats will illuminate the streets of East Peoria along Washington Street, turning onto Taylor Street and ending at Springfield Road at the Post office. Special guests, the Budweiser Clydesdales will be in the parade, weather permitting! 
 
Narrated Nativity Scene  //  November 22- December 31, 2019  //  {Intersection of Taylor Street and Springfield Road, East Peoria, IL}  //  This beautiful handmade attraction - maintained by a dedicated volunteer base - details the "reason for the season." Tune into 87.9 FM to hear a two-minute narration of the original Christmas story!
The narrated Nativity Scene at the intersection of Taylor Street and Springfield Road is open 24 hours a day through the holidays. It features five realistic scenes. The original structures were created on plywood by local artists for the first Festival of Lights in 1985. Because of deterioration in storage, the scenes were restored as vinyl prints mounted to aluminum backing in 1999, giving the added advantage that the displays take on a three-dimensional appearance at night. Unlike the rest of the Festival of Lights, the nativity project is funded exclusively by private donations through the Nativity Display Association. The maintenance annually is about $1,200. Those wishing to contribute to the upkeep of the scenes can mail a check payable to Nativity Display Association to John Salzer, 105 Reinders Rd., East Peoria, IL 61611.
 
Folepi's Winter Wonderland //  November 23- December 31, 2019 from 5-11pm  //  {123 Par 3 Ln, East Peoria, IL}  //  Celebrate the holidays with a million sparkles of excitement as one of the largest lighted, nighttime festivals in the midwest. Drive-through this spectacular holiday attraction in an electric park featuring lighted displays and floats. Featured floats are skiers, prehistoric area, circus area, Clydesdales, western town, victorian area, patriotic area, space area, castle, reindeer area, sea world, vehicles, and Christmas Toys. Tune in 107.3 FM for festive holiday music while you drive!
 
132nd Annual Santa Claus Parade & Yule Like Peoria  //  November 29, 2019 @ 10:15am  //  {Downtown Peoria, IL}  //  The Santa Claus Parade is the nation's longest-running holiday parade! This Peoria tradition takes a magical journey through the downtown streets of Peoria. Over 85 units of costumed character, novelty walking units, horse units, and decorated floats will surely get you in the holiday spirit and bring delight to the children along the route. The Yule Like Peoria walk-about features refreshments and various forms of holiday entertainment in the beautifully decorated business area of downtown Peoria.
 
Caterpillar Holiday Express Santa Luncheon  //  November 29, 2019 from 12:30-2pm  //  {The Caterpillar Visitors Center, Downtown Peoria, IL}  //  Come warm up at the Caterpillar Visitors Center are the Annual Santa Claus Parade! Santa and Mrs. Claus will hop off their sleigh and head inside to visit with the children. It's a one-of-a-kind photo opp in front of the massive Cat PM 313 Cold Planer all decked out for the holidays. 
Make sure to get your tickets for this special event which will include admission to all exhibits, lunch, sweets, and access to the EXPRESS Santa Claus line. 
 
FOLEPI River Trail Classic  //  November 30, 2019  //  {The River Trail of Illinois, East Peoria, IL}  //  Hit the holiday season running in this 4-mile competitive run and 2-mile non-competitive walk along the River Trail of Illinois. The 29th annual run is a point-to-point downhill race that attracts participants from throughout the country. It is open to men, women, and children of all ages. Awards will be presented to the top three overall male and female finishers and the top three male and female finishers in five-year age divisions from ages 10 to 75. No awards are presented in the two-mile walk. The post-race party will occur at Mickie's Pizzeria. All River Trail Classic finishers will receive pizza, and those age 21 and over will receive a free beer. 
 
Folepi's Gifts Galore Shop & Stroll  //  November 30, 2019  //  {Four Corners District, East Peoria, IL}  //  Find the perfect gift during Folepi's Gifts Galore Shop & Stroll in the Historic Four Corners District and adjacent areas. Visit the unique participating businesses featuring handcrafted items, jewelry, and more. Have a bite to eat, purchase a gift for someone (or yourself), take a free horse-drawn carriage ride with Santa and get Free Balloon Art by The Unique Twist! The East Peoria Community High School Chorale will sing carols. 
 
10th Annual Kristkindlemarkt //  November 30- December 1, 2019  //  {The Lindenhof, Peoria, IL}  //  Experience old world Christmas magic at Harmonie's 10th Annual Kristkindlemarkt at The Lindenhof. There will be live entertainment everyday along with food and beverages. Typical of the Kristkindlmarkts will also be available for purchase: bratwurst, weinerschnitzel, homemae strudel, gluhwein, hot chocolate, hot cider, Bavaria pretzels, and German beer. The Kristkindl/Santa Claus will be available each day handing out candy canes to the little ones. 
 
Folepi's Enchanted Forest //  November 30- December 31, 2019  //  {The Levee District, East Peoria, IL}  //  East Peoria's Levee District is home to this display featuring a 35-foot tall Christmas tree, real lighted trees and displays, and the Terry the Tractor parade float. Join for the official lighting event at 5:45pm on Saturday, November 30, 2019 with carols by the Caterpillar Employees Mixed Chorus. You can also Santa from 6:00-7:30pm!
On Friday, December 6, 13, 20, 2019 along with free Kiddie Konas from Kona ice during Santa hours. After the kids visit Santa on December 13, they can have fun at the Holiday Buttons & Crafts event sponsored by Fondulac District Library inside the Civic Plaza from 5:30-7:30pm
 
Holiday Cruises Aboard the Spirit of Peoria //  November 30, December 4, December 6, December 11, December 13-14, 2019  //  {Spirit of Peoria, Downtown Peoria, IL}  //  Prairie Folklore Theatre celebrates the spirit of the holidays on the Spirit of Peoria with A Civil War Christmas. Featuring a hot homemade buffet, a two-hour cruise, and entertainment. Passengers will hear songs and stories from the Civil War era. 
 
Pekin Winter Wonderland Parade & Opening Ceremonies //  December 1, 2019 @ 3:30pm  //  {Begins on the 1100 block of Broadway, Pekin, IL}  //  Enjoy a parade, family-friendly activities, and then fireworks to end the night! Mineral Springs Park remains lit throughout December for all to drive through and enjoy. 
 
Peoria Area Community Festival of Nativities //  December 5-December 8, 2019 from 5-8pm  //  {The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, Peoria, IL}  //  The Peoria Area Festival of Nativities is for the whole family, there will be hundreds of nativities, live entertainment, local art, along with a picture bingo/scavenger hunt for the little ones! Come out and revel in the splendor of beautiful and unique nativities from around the world. 
 
Christmas on Court //  December 6, 2019 from 5-8pm  //  {300-600 blocks of Court Street, Pekin, IL}  // Looking for more holiday fun in Pekin? Head down to Downtown Pekin to enjoy the 17th annual Christmas on Court shop and stroll event! There will be carriage rides, a tree lighting ceremony, live entertainment and demonstrations, a scavenger hunt, and giveaways at local businesses. 
Participating downtown businesses will be open late offering treats and activities to attendees. In addition to shopping, the popular scavenger hunt will be held for the third year. Participants that complete the scavenger hunt by visiting all participating businesses on their card will be entered into a drawing to win a gift basket valued at approximately $150. 
 
Old Fashioned Christmas Walk  //  December 6, 2019 from 5-7:30pm  //  {Downtown Jones Park, Canton, IL}  //  Carriage rides, trolley rides, Santa's House, and Christmas carols are all a part of thsi annual event. Beautifully decorated store windows and trees wrapped in twinkling lights in Jones Park. Merchants around the downtown area will be open late to show their appreciation to their customers. 
 
Santa's Wildlife Express  //  December 6 - December 8, 2019 from noon-8pm  //  {Wildlife Prairie Park, Hanna City, IL}  // Do you love Wildlife Scary Park and wish you and your family could spend more time there? Well, have no fear, Wildlife Prairie Park transforms into a Winter Wonderland! Take a train ride through the North Pole and enjoy games, crafts, cookie decorating, pictures with Santa and animal encounters! 
 
Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat  //  December 6, 7, 8, 11, 14, 15, 2019 @ 7:30pm  //  {Eastlight Theatre, East Peoria, IL}  // Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat returns for the 29th year to the Eastlight Theatre. This Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice musical tells the story of Joseph and his 11 brothers. It was created as a soft rock fantasy fit for the entire family. Be sure to enjoy this Central Illinois holiday favorite! 
It's a Wonderful Heights  //  December 7, 2019 @ 8pm  //  {Downtown Peoria Heights, IL}  //  Need an excuse to head out to Peoria Heights to do some holiday shopping? Then check out all the wonderful holiday deals this season at our local retail and dining establishments. You are sure to find the perfect gifts for all your shopping needs. 
 
Peoria Ballet Nutcracker  //  December 14-15, 2019 @ 2pm + 7:30pm  //  {Peoria Civic Center}  // See this year's all-new, dazzling choreography, spectacular sets and costumes, graceful dancers from the famous Joffrey Ballet, and the timeless music of Tchaikovsky performed live by the Heartland Festival Orchestra. 
 
A Magical Cirque Christmas  //  December 20, 2019 @ 8pm  //  {Peoria Civic Center}  //  Experience incredible performers and breathtaking cirque artists from all corners of the world, accompanied by your favorite holiday music performed live. 
 
The Elf on the Shelf: A Christmas Musical  //  December 22, 2019 @ 7pm  //  {Peoria Civic Center}  //  Enjoy a heartwarming story of one small elf's big impact on his adoptive family and a glimpse into the magical lives of Scout Elves. The musical opens with a friendly Elf on the Shelf named Tater Tot speaking directly to the audience. When Tater Tot, top Scout Elf of his graduating class is sent to a disconnected, multi-generational family struggle to rediscover the Christmas spirit, he's got to find a way off the shelf and into their hearts. 
 
Get Lit Celebration!  //  December 31, 2019 @ 9pm-midnight  //  {123 Par 3 Ln, East Peoria, IL}  //  The 19th annual Get Lit Celebration is back again! Run, walk or ride the Festival's lighted trolley through the Folepi's Winter Wonderland display. Then warm-up by the bonfire and enjoy campfire treats. There will be no vehicular traffic in the Winter Wonderland during the event, and dogs are not allowed. 
New ways for families to celebrate the New Year at the Get Lit are a bonfire with campfire treats from 9:00 p.m. until midnight, and rides through the display on the lighted Trolley float from 9:00 p.m. until 9:45 p.m. and again after the completion of the run/walk until midnight. The Get Lit's traditional run/walk through the Winter Wonderland starts at 10:00 p.m. and is a way for people to "run" into the new year.
 
NYE Countdown Presented by Better Built & PNC NYE Kids Countdown  //  December 31, 2019 @ 2-6pm  //  {Peoria Civic Center}  //  Two New Year's Eve Countdowns (6:00 p.m. & Midnight) will take place at the Sonar Tide Patio next to City Hall where the NYE Ball will be 200 feet in the air lighting up downtown. There will be activities throughout the afternoon and evening for all ages to enjoy. No need to worry about the cold - there is plenty of space inside the glass atrium and patio to enjoy the festivities. 
The PNC New Year's Eve Kids Countdown activities will begin at 2:00 p.m. in Exhibit Hall D at the Peoria Civic Center. There will be face painting, balloon art, Fun on the Run, superheroes and more! 
The NYE Countdown presented by Better Built starts at 9:00 p.m in Exhibit Hall A where you can enjoy the Joe Stamm Band who will be onstage from 9:45 p.m. - 11:45 p.m. Concessions will be available and at midnight, countdown to 2020 and ringing in the new year with the ball drop and fireworks!

The Hiking Project  //  Part 1

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Mar. 24, 2021
				






If trickling creeks, old-growth forests, stunning river views, and amazing rock formations are calling your name, then there's no time like the present to grab your boots and hit the trails in Peoria. No matter where you are in the Peoria Area, hiking opportunities are close by. Get outside and enjoy our fresh air! 
 
Forest Park Nature Preserve   {Peoria Heights}  //  With over seven miles of trails, it’s easy to spend an entire day at Forest Park Nature Preserve. They also offer classes for adults and children throughout the year, covering all kinds of topics from bats to bugs. They even offer guided hiking tours.
 
Spring Creek Preserve   {Washington}  //  The Spring Creek Preserve consists of 262 acres of wooded bluffs, bottomland, and old farm fields and is managed as a natural area with hiking trails.  Located in Washington, the preserve is home to many species of birds, animals, butterflies, trees, shrubs, and wildflowers. The park is rather new and is still under development, but several hiking trails are now mowed and maintained and are accessible from the parking lot.  
 
Rocky Glen Park   {West Peoria}  //  Truly a hidden gem in West Peoria, Rocky Glen is a great place to hike and see unique sandstone rock formations, including the popular “bowl” or “Horseshoe Bottoms.” Plenty of local lore and stories swirl around this historic place to explore near Kickapoo Creek. Often referred to as a smaller Starved Rock, don’t forget to check out the small waterfalls along the cliffs.
 
SandRidge State Forest   {Havana}  //  With 44 miles of marked trails and 7,200 acres of forest, SandRidge State Forest features woodlands, open fields and unique sand prairies to explore. The forest is perfect for hikers, backpackers, horseback riders and even snowmobilers. Located about 45 minutes south of downtown Peoria, the trails are matched perfectly with a day trip to explore nearby historic Havana and the Emiquon National Wildlife Refuge.
 
Illinois River Bluff Trail   {Peoria}  //  A beautiful sanctuary for hiking the steep river bluff hills of central Illinois. The Illinois River Bluff Trail connects four Peoria Area parks Camp Wokanda, Robinson Park, Green Valley Camp, and Detweiller Park. It’s the perfect way to get to know lots of area parks.
 
Chillicothe Park District   {Chillicothe}  //  Chillicothe is full of unique hiking destinations. Check out Moffitt Nature park for a variety of hiking trails, open grass space, and forest. Visit Coal Hollow Park for forty acres of river bluff land full of hiking and walking trails and beautiful nature.
 
Rock Island Trail   {Peoria}  //  Rock Island Trail was once a passenger and freight railroad trail and is now more than 26 miles of uninterrupted nature on the Rock Island Trail. Located in the Grand Prairie Division, a vast plain formerly covered with tall prairie grasses, the trail has reverted to nature, with much of the prairie returning. 
 
Peoria Park District   {Peoria}  //  Peoria Park District is full of hiking opportunities. Stadium park has a .45 mile paved loop for hiking. Sommer Park North has 1.25 miles of paved, but not-so-level hiking opportunities and Charter Oak Park has 0.6 miles of paved hiking trails. Nature lovers will love exploring Detweiller Park, which has 5+ miles of hiking trails traversing the Illinois River bluffs. Visit Bradley Park for beautiful scenic views and some great hiking spots.
 
Ulrich Wildlife Preserve   {Morton}  //  Located in Morton, Ulrich Wildlife Preserve is a beautiful area with many hiking and walking trails. The trails have a creek running through them, making this a great location to bring kids to play!
 
McNaughton Park   {Pekin}  //  McNaughton Park in Pekin has a variety of hiking and walking trails winding through woodland and a meadow habitat for native species. The land supports about 15 species of animals, 80 species of birds and a wide spectrum of plant life. A large portion of this park is within the Land and Water Reserve by the Illinois Nature Preserves Commission.

Regional Retail Therapy // Part 1

By Discover Peoria on

					Mar. 26, 2020
				






If you're the wandering type who aimlessly strolls through the aisles with an iced latte in hand and touching, well, almost everything, then we have the list for you. Shopping lovers unite--check out these locally-owned boutique shops in the Peoria Area.
 
Lori's Kitchen Store  {Washington}   //   Located on Washington's Historic Square, Lori's Kitchen Store specializes in kitchenware, cookware, cooking classes and more.
 
A Perfect Pear Boutique  {Peoria Heights}   //   Always chic, always stylish, always changing! New fashions arriving daily, stop by A Perfect Pear Boutique to see what set's them apart from the rest.
 
Urban Artifacts  {Peoria}   //   Rescue, repurpose, recycle is the name of the game at Urban Artifacts. Check out this treasure chest of antiques, nostalgic pieces, souvenirs, and vintage items.
 
SOS Home  {Washington}   //   At SOS Home, be prepared to find boutique furniture and home decor store you can't leave without!
 
Third Stitch Boutique  {Eureka}   //   Owned and operated by a mother-daughter team, the Third Stitch Boutique showcases classic, modern, simple fashion that will take shoppers through all trends. Find items for women of all sizes.
 
Bushwhacker  {Peoria}   //   Established in 1971, Bushwhacker is Peoria’s original outdoor store. Originally a backpacking shop for hippies, now they've become the local escape to unknown adventure.
 
The Picker's Daughter  {East Peoria}   //   Located in the Historic Four Corners District​ in East Peoria, expect to browse through 80+ local vendors at The Picker's Daughter! From antiques to collectibles, handcrafted to refurbished, farmhouse to primitive, and more!
 
Sentimental Journey  {Washington}   //   For over 40 years, Sentimental Journey has been a staple for all-occasion gifts, home decor, jewelry and more! Stop by Washington's Historic Square to shop!
 
White & Rustic Boutique {Minonk}   //   Home to women’s apparel, shoes, and accessories, White & Rustic Boutique is an adorable shop, with quality items at an affordable price point. 
 
Rambler  {Peoria}   //   Rambler is a moto-outdoors inspired men's specialty shop is located in the Warehouse District. With a focus on quality, American, adventure-ready goods, this man-boutique is a great spot to explore.
 
Baker Street Boutique  {Washington}   //   This women's clothing and accessories boutique, located on Washington's Historic Square, displays beautifully curated classic pieces. The owner has an excellent eye for styling guests. Expect to star in mini fashion shows from the fitting room of Baker Street Boutique.
 
Sage & Co  {Peoria Heights}   //   Sage & Co is a trendy boutique that provides an inclusive size range of clothing options along with products for home, self-care, baby, and more!
 
Global Village  {Peoria Heights}   //   Global Village is a local, all-volunteer, not-for-profit store providing Fair Trade food and gifts for a better world. Check out this shop in the Heights today for unique gifts and treasures!
 
The Runaway Rack  {"Germantown Hills"}   //   The Runaway Rack is a mobile boutique and Central Illinois' premier "fashion truck" shopping experience! Follow this boutique on social media to discover where it will be parked. This charming experience is one-of-a-kind and highly recommended!
 
 Ever Louise Boutique  {Bartonville}   //   This adorable boutique in Bartonville specializes in stylish fashions for every season. With new arrivals weekly, follow Ever Louise Boutique on social media for amazing steals and deals.
 
Bushbaby  {Peoria}   //   This online-only boutique specializes in children's outdoor apparel and footwear. The Bushbaby goal is to foster healthy outdoor activities for local youth and their families. The owner has a wealth of knowledge and outdoor tips--the entire experience does not disappoint! http://www.bushbaby.co/
 
Fiber Faire  {Henry}   //   Fiber Faire offers sewing machine repair and service along with long arm quilting services. This quilt shop is a great spot to take classes (from beginner to advanced skillsets) and often hosts guild meetings. Check out this adorable shop, learn something new, and join in on the camaraderie!

Women-Owned in Greater Peoria

By Guest Writer:  Emma Bakken on

					Mar. 15, 2021
				






In honor of Women's History + Appreciation Month, here is a celebration of women's contributions to history, culture, and society in the Peoria Area. Narrowing this down to a manageable list was challenging to say the least, but we hope this can be a starting point for more of us to support, uplift, and champion Women-owned businesses in our community.
 
Curvy Chic Boutique owned by Kali Holt​  {Pekin}  //  Curvy Chic Boutique is a safe space designed for women with curves to feel good shopping fashionable clothing. Kali set out to to take the stress and struggle from plus size shoppers who struggled to find cute stylish clothes. The excellent customer service--greeted with a warm welcome, complete honesty, and as much or little styling assistance as wanted--has helped countless women to feel empowered, trendy, and comfortable in their own skin.

 
Mo Tru Travels owned by Arien “Mo” Wallace  {Peoria}  //  Thinking of planning a trip soon? Mo Tru Travels specializes in planning and providing affordable family travel packages both domestically and internationally. Mo is a Bradley University alumna with a passion for traveling and learning about different cultures at a low price.

 
Dream Illustrations owned by Kay Davis  {Chillicothe}  //  Dream Illustrations is a tattoo, body piercing, and permanent cosmetics shop. They have been around since 1983 and can custom draw any tattoo design you may want. Send them a message and they can get you set up with a price and quote for all your tattoo ideas!
 
Unique Tees Inc owned by Shundra Parker  {Peoria}  //  Unique Tees specializes in custom embroidery and screen printing. Located in Campustown next to Bradley University in Peoria, Unique Tees is the perfect place for all of your custom T-shirt needs! 

 
Ron’s Carpets owned by Carol Hayse  {Peoria}  //  Ron’s Carpets can help you with all of your flooring needs! Owned by Carol Hayse, Ron’s carpets in Peoria offers a variety of flooring options including carpet, vinyl, and wood. With great prices, friendly staff, and top-notch installers, you can get the flooring you want in an easy and timely manner.
 
A Perfect Pear Boutique owned by Libby Kotsuza   {Peoria Heights}  //  A Perfect Pear Boutique is an upscale shopping boutique located in Peoria Heights. This boutique, with new arrivals daily, will help you create exclusive looks from the most fashionable labels and designers. With a variety of brands, shoes, and accessories, all ages are sure to find something they love! 

 
Lela’s Resale owned by Lela Schaff  {Chillicothe + Lacon}  //  Lela’s Resale Shoppe #2, located in Chillicothe and owned by Lela Schaff, is the sister to Lela's Resale Shoppe #1 in Lacon, IL. Lela’s is a consignment and thrift store that sells new and used merchandise, furniture, and more! You never know what you might find!
 
Art at the Bodega owned by Tricia Yocum  {Washington}  //  Let your inner artist bloom! Art at the Bodega, owned by Tricia Yocum is a studio where everyone can create a masterpiece. They offer parties, classes, private events, and walk-in DIYs. They also have New To-go kits and subscription boxes. Get creative and try out a class or create on your own!
 
FaireCoffee owned by Emily Hartter  {Washington}  //  Who doesn’t love a good coffee shop? FaireCoffee in Washington is owned by Emily Hartter. FaireCoffee spreads joy through coffee one cup at a time. They offer mobile and curbside ordering and feature many unique flavor combinations including brown sugar cinnamon and lavender peppermint. Consider stopping by when you need your next caffeine fix!

 
Rileys Vegan Sweets and Eats owned by Riley Greenwood  {Peoria}  //  Riley’s Vegan Sweets and Eats, open since 2017 is Peoria’s first 100% vegan bakery. They have many dietary options including vegan, soy-free, nut-free, and more. Riley also offers family-sized meals as well as traditional treats like cupcakes and cookies. You can also preorder custom treats or mouth-watering and decorative vegan cakes!

 
Five Senses Spa and Salon owned by Paola Hinton  {Peoria}  //  Treat yourself to some relaxation at Five Senses Spa and Salon. Owned by Paola Hinton, Five Senses Spa and Salon is proud to be named as one of Salon Today’s Top 200 Spa and Salons in North America. They have a barbershop, salon stations, mani/Pedi stations and spa rooms. Give yourself a break and make a visit to Five Senses Spa and Salon!
 
Happy Thoughts Coffee owned by Sarah Williamson  {Chillicothe}  //  Looking for coffee and a meal? Happy Thoughts Coffee is another delicious coffee shop owned by Sarah Williamson that has been serving the community with tasty coffee and cafe items for almost 22 years! Happy Thoughts serves delicious beverages as well as baked goods, breakfast, and lunch items. 

 
Up Beet Jams, Inc owned by Jam Rohr   {Peoria + Bloomington}  //  Up Beet Jams, is a vegan and gluten-free meal prep service for the Peoria and Bloomington area where each week of meals also comes with a weekly music recommendation. The owner has mastered various cooking techniques to prepare unique and ever-changing vegan meals. She has also done extensive research to learn the specific benefits of a whole food plant-based diet. She offers delicious single meals, family-sized meals, and add-ons. Try one today!
 
Bear’s Bites owned by Samantha Hutchison  {East Peoria}  //  Treat your furry friends to some treats from Bear’s Bites! Bear’s Bites offers many options of locally produced and packaged dog and cat treats, bites, and more. They are 100% natural with no grain, additives, or preservatives. They also offer monthly bite boxes if you’d like your best friend to try out a few of their products! Your furry friends will thank you!

 
Castaways Bar and Grill owned by Amanda Oedewaldt  {Chillicothe}  //  Castaways Bar and Grill is the perfect place to go for top-quality meals at a reasonable price in an upbeat and fun atmosphere. Try out their delicious and fresh homemade meals including gourmet burgers, pub sandwiches, and fresh salads. Castaways gourmet flavors will keep you coming back for more!
 
Relaxed and Refreshed owned by Virginia Clark  {Peoria}  //  Your body will thank you after receiving massage therapy from Relaxed and Refreshed! Relaxed and Refreshed specializes in massage therapy to relieve the body, mind, and spirit. Virginia also provides basic facials and pedicures for when you want to treat yourself and does many types of events including one-on-one sessions and parties. 

 
Hello Headband owned by sisters, Megan + Erin Ray  {Peoria}  //  Hello Headband™, was started in 2011 on a creative whim after Megan made her first headband. What started as a hobby on Etsy quickly became a viral boom! From making upwards of 20 headbands per style and pattern, Hello Headband now makes hundreds of each pattern. Hello Headband currently has several different headband styles for everyone, including babies, children and adults, which you can find at Indie Gift House in Keller Station--the sisters' storefront and workshop.
 
World on Wheels owned by Lynnette Lee  {Peoria}  //  Learn how to glide along on a Segway with World on Wheels! Owned by Lynnette Lee, World on Wheels is the only Segway tour and Quadricycle bike rental experience in Peoria. They’re great for individual riding or corporate events and are open March thru November. Gliding with World on Wheels is as fun as it gets!

 
Looking 4 Treasures owned by Dawn Childers  {Chillicothe}  //  Looking 4 Treasures is a thrift and consignment store. Owned by Dawn Childers, Looking 4 Treasures offers quality used furniture, small appliances, a big selection of used books, tools, sports items, collectibles, primitives, pottery, pictures, and glassware. Check them out before you start your next DIY project, they might have exactly what you’re looking for!
 
Sweet Cakes by Rachael owned by Rachael Parker  {Peoria}  //  In business for 18-years, Sweet Cakes by Rachael began with just an oven, a folding table and a mixer. Rachael is also the only baker and is known for her delicious cupcakes and beautiful custom cakes. She has no set menu and is open to trying new ideas, but make sure you pre-order your treats!

Shop Woodford County

By Discover Peoria on

					Nov. 30, 2022
				






If you're the wandering type who aimlessly strolls through the aisles with an iced latte in hand and touching, well, almost everything, then we have the list for you. Shopping lovers unite—check out these locally-owned boutique shops in Woodford County.

 
EL PASO
El Paso Antique Mall  {El Paso}    //    Specializing in memories, not just things, the El Paso Antique Mall is the premier antique store for vintage collectibles, glassware, furniture, and much much more.
 
North Pine Boutique  {El Paso}    //   This charming boutique is the place to find trendy and stylish women’s clothing and accessories. 

 
EUREKA
Hello Beautiful Boutique  {Eureka}    //    Promoting self love and beauty through fashion, Hello Beautiful Boutique sells womens clothing + accessories. 
 
Home and Farm Artisan Market  {Eureka}    //    Located on the square in downtown Eureka, IL, Home and Farm Artisan Market has a variety of treasures from soap and candles to vintage clothing and decor. 
 
Objects  {Eureka}    //    A treasure trove for antique lovers, objects specializing in finding hidden gems to enrich your life. You’ll find pottery, glassware, seasonal decorations, antique furniture, and beautiful home decor. 
 
Third Stitch Boutique  {Eureka}    //    The Third Stitch Boutique showcases classic, modern, simple fashion that will take shoppers through all trends. Find items for women of all sizes.

 
GERMANTOWN HILLS
The Nook at Nena Hardware  {Germantown Hills}    //    Tucked inside Nena Ace Hardware is The Nook with home decor, jewelry, drinkware, and more. 
 
The Runaway Rack  {Mobile Boutique Truck}    //    Fashion on the go, The Runaway Rack is a charmingly curated women’s boutique store. Found locally throughout the year, you’ll be able to shop shackets, scarves, tops, jewelry, hats and more. 

 
METAMORA
Past and Present {Metamora}    //    Expect a variety of new and vintage items like reclaimed barn wood furniture, local honey, hand printed signs, and great gift options culled from specialty markets. 
 
Reclaimed Resale  {Metamora}    //    This resale store offers a little bit of everything from furniture and home decor to clothing and kitchenware. As a local non-profit, proceeds are donated to local students, families, and charities. 
 
The Cottage Peddler  {Metamora}    //   Expect a stylish array of quality refurbished furniture, boutique clothing for women + children, home decor, and much more.   
 
Timeless Treasure Market  {Metamora}    //   Located on the historic town square, Timeless Treasure Market showcases locally made products like bath bombs, seasonal decor, and more. As a fun outing, check their events for crafting classes.

 
MINONK
White + Rustic Boutique {Minonk}    //    This beautiful boutique carries Women’s tops, bottoms, rompers, shoes, and accessories.
 
Photo Reference: White + Rustic Boutique

6 Greater Peoria Breweries

By Discover Peoria on

					Mar. 01, 2021
				






Peoria may be the Whiskey City, but it's also a great place for a beer! While they all offer that tasty, sudsy brew, each brewery has its own unique personality. Check out these beloved breweries and take a growler home with you. And don't forget, drink responsibly. 
 
Evergreen Farm Brewing  {Metamora}  //  With an innovative gamble, brewer Adam Sommer, transformed his family's small, midwestern, traditional, 225-acre, five generation farm into Evergreen Farm Brewing. With conventional farming out of the question and craft niche breweries taking off, Sommer decided to transform the farmhouse into a brewery---and we're so glad he did! This one-of-a-kind brewery is not only producing excellent beer, but has created a new concept for brewing with a direct connection to the farm it originates. Sommer has coined the process, "Ground to Growler."
Fun Detail:  ​In the mid 1800s, the once-farmhouse-now-brewery was the first house in the area with indoor plumbing and electric lights (evidence of both remain today!)

 
Bearded Owl Brewery  {Peoria}  //  Gather around the campfire, the origin story of Bearded Owl Brewery is best told illuminated by a crackling flam in the woods. While taking an evening hike with his son Jimmy on a camping trip, Nick Babcok's attempts at giving young Jimmy a scare came back to bit him, or better yet, scratch him. Upon entering an old, abandoned bar, Nick discovered he was not alone inside when he saw the orange eyes of a horned owl roosting. Jimmy, reluctantly following his dad inside, was stunned by the giant bird. As the owl took flight, both Nick and Jimmy hit the ground to avoid its large talons. 
Fun Detail:  ​Nick's great uncle Lewis worked for Peoria's Gipps Brewing Company before taking up employment at a local speak-say during Prohibition. 

 
Industry Brewing Co.  {Peoria}  //  Owned by Peoria's successful Spice Hospitality, Industry Brewing offers a unique twist on the usual classics. Wash down your pretzel and beer cheese with the Kolsch style - Happy Hour. Industry Brewing is the place to meet your co-workers for a beer after a long week. Or enjoy the warm summer nights with live entertainment in the beer garden. whatever your tastes or preferences, Industry Brewing has something for everyone. 
Fun Detail:  ​Industry Brew welcomes those on two wheels and four legs! Being right off the Rock Island Trail, it's a prime stop for a cold drink or hot meal, with plenty of bike parking. Four legged friends will feel at home on the back patio with a fire hydrant doggy drinking fountain and a restroom area with bags on site.

 
Obed & Isaac's Microbrewery and Eatery  {Peoria}  //  Located inside a renovated and historic church, Obed and Isaac's opened its second location in the heart of Illinois in 2016. The Conn Hospitality Group Inc. continued their combination of historic architecture, delicious food and great beer from their first location in Springfield, IL, and found success in Peoria. The atmosphere inside is unlike any other restaurant in town, with its stained-glass design elements (be sure to check out the bathrooms).
Fun Detail:  ​This outside patio is the perfect spot to hang out on a beautiful day. With bocce ball courts, bags, DAGz boards, and fire pits, you'll never want to leave.

 
Pour Bros. Craft Taproom  {Peoria Heights}  //  Pour Bros. Craft Taproom is Illinois' first pour-your-own taproom in Heritage Square features the popular Pour The Experience wall where guests can select and pour their own drinks with the swipe of a game card. Though not brewed onsite, the selection is well-curate with an ever-changing small-batch menu of craft beer, ciders, meads and amazing handcrafted cocktails.
Fun Detail:  ​Year-round, Pour Bros. features live music. Head inside during the chilly months for a laid-back acoustic concert or have a-rockin' summer concert in Heritage Square. 

 
Rhodell Brewery  {Peoria}  //  A regional brewery tour isn't complete without visiting the granddaddy of them all, Rhodell Brewery. Since opening its doors in 1998, Rohell's started with three beers on tap. Now offering 13 beers that rotate regularly, this brewery prioritizes small-batch flavor to bring guests the best in ales, lagers, stouts and IPAs. 
Fun detail: Rhodell Brewery offers guests to brew their own beer--talk to your bartender for more details.

Shop Peoria County // Part 1

By Discover Peoria on

					Nov. 29, 2022
				






If you're the wandering type who aimlessly strolls through the aisles with an iced latte in hand and touching, well, almost everything, then we have the list for you. Shopping lovers unite—check out these locally-owned boutique shops in Peoria County.

 
PEORIA
Apricot Lane Boutique  {Peoria}    //    Shop Apricot Lane Boutique Peoria for the latest women's fashion apparel.
 
Blue Boutique  {Peoria}    //    Blue Boutique specializes in quality items like clothing, accessories, gifts, and more
 
Bushbaby  {Peoria}   //   This online-only boutique specializes in children's outdoor apparel and footwear.
 
Bushwhacker  {Peoria}   //   Established in 1971, Bushwhacker is Peoria’s original outdoor store. Originally a backpacking shop for hippies, now they've become the local escape to unknown adventure.
 
Indie Gift House  {Peoria}   //  The makers of Hello Headband bring you a boutique specializing in all things gifts—candles to candy and towels to quirky stickers.
 
Kelly Seed  {Peoria}   //  With a complete line of alfalfas, clovers, pasture mixes, waterway mixes, lawn mixes, and garden seeds, Kelly’s can take care of the Central Illinois farmer and homeowner alike.
 
Noelle Rose Boutique  {Peoria}   //  Trendy, Boho inspired shop with clothes and accessories. 
 
Pink Sugar Boutique   {Peoria}   //  Exclusive brands from casual everyday styles to that special event dress that make women look and feel their best. Featuring brands such as Sanctuary, Free People, BB Dakota, DL 1961, Cupcakes and Cashmere, and French Connection. 
 
Rambler  {Peoria}    //    Rambler is a moto-outdoors inspired men's specialty shop located in the Warehouse District. With a focus on quality, American, adventure-ready goods, this man-boutique is a great spot to explore.
 
Random Boutique  {Peoria}   //  The place to go when you want to find something out of the ordinary, Random Boutique has an array of fun and funky clothes. 
 
Relics  {Peoria}   //  Gift shop aiming to bring interesting things to Peoria that tell a story. Relics carries jewelry, cards, books, decor, vintage surprises, and plants.
 
Running Central  {Peoria}   //  More than just a running store. Seeking to offer comfort and enjoyment for every occasion whether you are a mother, father, grandparent, or a walker, runner, or fitness enthusiast.
 
Uniquee Tees Inc  {Peoria}  //  Uniquee Tees specializes in custom embroidery and screen printing. Located in Campustown next to Bradley University in Peoria, Uniquee Tees is the perfect place for all of your custom T-shirt needs.
 
Urban Artifacts  {Peoria}   //   Rescue, repurpose, recycle is the name of the game at Urban Artifacts. Check out this treasure chest of antiques, nostalgic pieces, souvenirs, and vintage items.
 
Wishing Star Boutique by Tabatha  {Peoria}    //    Wishing Star Boutique is the Peoria Area's headquarters for the latest trends in fashion! Channeling Southern vibes with Midwestern flair, WSB dresses the fashionista, the casual gal, and the working woman on the go.

 
PEORIA HEIGHTS
A Perfect Pear  {Peoria Heights}    //    Think of Perfect Pear Boutique as a locally-owned Nordstrom or Neiman-Marcus. The boutique offers the same designer lines coveted in metropolitan cities like New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago. 
Generations Candle Company  {Peoria Heights}    //    Generations offers custom fragrances as a unique experience. Create your own candle fragrance or purchase one premade. 

Global Village  {Peoria Heights}   //   Global Village is a local, all-volunteer, not-for-profit store providing Fair Trade food and gifts for a better world. Check out this shop in the Heights today for unique gifts and treasures.

I Know You Like A Book  {Peoria Heights}    //    I Know You Like a Book is an independent bookstore offering new books, used books and reading-related gift items. Serving the literary Central Illinois community for over 15 years.

Sage and Co  {Peoria Heights}    //    A size inclusive lifestyle store that offers clothing, home decor, self care, and more.
 
Shabby Shac  {Peoria Heights}    //    Shabby Shac offers repurposed, Upcycle, Vintage, Antique, Arts/Crafts, Shabby and uniquely outside the box items.

The Nook  {Peoria Heights, Germantown Hills, + Morton}    //    The Nook is your one stop shop for great gifts, beautiful decor, fun accessories, and on-trend apparel.
 
So Chic  {Peoria Heights + Morton}    //    With two locations you can find the perfect stationery, party supplies, decor, and more at So Chic. They also offer party planning services!

 
WEST PEORIA
Primitiques Market on Main {West Peoria}    //  Furniture store with unique pieces for every home. 

 
CHILLICOTHE
Covered Wagon Crafts  {Chillicothe}    //   Covered Wagon Crafts is a Arts and Crafts store located in Chillicothe, Illinois. For over 30 years, this shop has offered art + craft supplies and collectors items. 
 
Cranberry Creek  {Chillicothe}    //   Cranberry Creek specializes in hand-poured soy candles and hand-crafted natural bath and body products, Essential oils, home decor, clothing and accessories. They produce their soap in small batches to guarantee that each bar of soap is top quality.
 
Little Shop of Hoarders  {Chillicothe}   //   A fun "Re-Sell Re-tell" shop full of usual and unusual treasures! Antiques, Art, Vintage, Furniture, Sculptures, Book Nook, Sporting Goods, Home Decor, Seasonal Items, and much more
 
Looking 4 Treasures  {Chillicothe}  //  Looking 4 Treasures is a thrift and consignment store offering quality used furniture, small appliances, a big selection of used books, tools, sports items, collectibles, primitives, pottery, pictures, and glassware.
 
Peggy Says Sew  {Chillicothe}    //   Full service seamstress to fit all of your sewing and alterations needs. 
 
Sweet Finds  {Chillicothe}   //   An exciting new take on the traditional shopping experience, with deals that couldn't even be found online. Unexpected finds and sweet deals on an array of items from guitars and headphones to sweaters and shoes. 
 
The Princess Closet  {Chillicothe}    //   Dedicated to promoting confidence in young adults by striving to help them attend their formal events in style. Choose from over 100 new or gently used dresses!

 
BARTONVILLE
Ever Louise Boutique  {Bartonville}   //   This adorable boutique in Bartonville specializes in stylish fashions for every season. With new arrivals weekly, follow Ever Louise Boutique on social media for amazing steals and deals.
 
Faith + Grace Children’s Boutique  {Bartonville}    //   A children’s boutique that creates a unique one-of-a-kind shopping experience that captures the look and vibe of the hot trends.  The boutique is locally owned, and all the styles are hand-picked by the owner.  
 
Feeling Chic Boutique  {Bartonville}    //   Offers beautiful, trendy, and affordable clothing that looks amazing on all body types. They work hard to pick pieces that will flatter all body shapes and are quality fabrics!

 
BRIMFIELD
Brimfield Hardware  {Brimfield}    //   Brimfield Hardware is your reliable source for home repair and remodeling products. Since 2000, they’ve been the proud supplier for homeowners, contractors, and farmers in Brimfield.

 
PRINCEVILLE
EB Buildings and Lumber Co.  {Princeville}    //    A full-service lumberyard, post frame building business, and retail hardware home center.

 
ELMWOOD
New 2U Community Thrift Store  {Elmwood}    //    Consignment and thrift store specializing in gently used clothing items.

 
HANNA CITY
Country Relics  {Hanna City}    //    Country gifts, primitives, candles, seasonal décor, rugs, textiles, antiques and lots more.
 
South Eden Village Mall  {Hanna City}    //    A gift, furniture and antique mall filled with finds from the past and fun, beautiful, and useful items. 

 
EDWARDS
The Fashion Farm Boutique  {Farmington}    //   Owned by a fun and loving mom with a passion for fashion and helping other women feel beautiful! We are a women’s boutique here for your fashion, accessory and gift needs!

 
KICKAPOO
The Fashion Farm Boutique Kickapoo {Edwards + Kickapoo}   //   The Fashion Farm Boutique offers stylish and comfortable clothing and accessories for women from sizes S-3XL.  The store offers unique pieces and gift options.
